original: de la yid mi bde ba'i phyir sdig pa ni /

analyzed: bshags pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: is destroyed by confession.

original: bsod nams ni de ltar zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsod nams ni de ltar zad par mi 'gyur te /

original: yid bde ba'i phyir yang mi zad de /
analyzed: yid bde ba'i phyir yang mi zad de /

analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi phyir zang zing med pa'i sems kyis bsgrags pa ni nyes pa med do ;
translated: There is no fault in boasting with a disinterested mind for the sake of helping sentient beings.

original: / dkon mchog sprin las ji skad du /
analyzed: / dkon mchog sprin las ji skad du /
translated: As the Cloud of Jewels says,

analyzed: sman pa'i dpes bdag bstod pa nyes pa med par bstan pa lta bu'o //

original: yang bsod nams bsrung bar 'dod pas //
analyzed: yang bsod nams bsrung bar 'dod pas //
translated: Moreover, one who wishes to protect merit

original: rnyed dang bkur stis 'jigs bya zhing //
analyzed: rnyed dang bkur stis 'jigs bya zhing //

original: khengs pa rtag tu spang bar bya //
analyzed: khengs pa rtag tu spang bar bya //

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang bya zhing //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang bya zhing //
translated: One should be like a bodhisattva

original: chos la yid gnyis spang bar @84a * //
analyzed: chos la yid gnyis spang bar @84a * //

analyzed: bya ; ;'di ni dkon mchog brtsegs pa las rab tu bstan te /
translated: This is taught in the Heap of Jewels:🔽“Bhagavan, how should a bodhisattva who has done an evil action get rid of the stain of that evil action?”

original: 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i chos skyes shing byung ba rnams yongs su zad par 'gyur te dge ba'i chos de dag gis rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //🔽bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i chos skyes shing byung ba rnams yongs su zad par 'gyur te dge ba'i chos de dag gis rgyas par mi 'gyur ro // bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: Kāśyapa, bodhisattvas who have four qualities will exhaust any virtuous qualities that have arisen and will not increase those virtuous qualities.🔽What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are🔽conceit, seeking the secret mantra of the Lokāyatas,🔽attachment to gain and honor, looking at the home life,🔽hatred and slander of bodhisattvas,

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i gsang tshig tshol ba dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par zhen pas khyim la lta ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par sdang zhing skur ba 'debs pa dang / ma thos pa dang ma zin pa'i mdo sde rnams spong ba'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i gsang tshig tshol ba dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par zhen pas khyim la lta ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par sdang zhing skur ba 'debs pa dang / ma thos pa dang ma zin pa'i mdo sde rnams spong ba'o zhes bstan to //
translated: and rejecting sūtras that have not been heard or memorized.

original: 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi gzhung las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi gzhung las kyang /
translated: It is also taught in the scriptures of the noble Sarvāstivādins:

analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong gis 'di ltar skra dang sen mo'i mchod rten la yan lag thams cad kyis phyag 'tshal te sems dang bar byed pa la ltos //
translated: “Monks, look how a monk, with all his limbs, prostrates to a stūpa of hair and nails and purifies his mind.

original: btsun pa de lta lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa de lta lags so //
translated: “Yes, Venerable.”

original: dge slong dag dge slong 'dis sa ji tsam zhig non pa'i 'og dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong na yod pa'i gser gyi 'khor lo la thug pa'i bar na bye ma ji snyed yod pa de snyed du dge slong 'dis 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid stong 'gyur🔽du longs spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas de nas tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor gyis /🔽bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong 'dis sa ji tsam zhig non pa'i 'og dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong na yod pa'i gser gyi 'khor lo la thug pa'i bar na bye ma ji snyed yod pa de snyed du dge slong 'dis 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid stong 'gyur du longs spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas de nas tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor gyis / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
translated: “Monks, this monk will enjoy a thousand reigns as a universal monarch, from the golden wheel to the jewel, as many times as there are grains of sand in the eighty-four thousand leagues of earth below him.”🔽Then the venerable Upāli

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bur che bar gsungs na bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gang du bsrabs pa dang yongs su byang ba dang yongs su zad par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bur che bar gsungs na bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gang du bsrabs pa dang yongs su byang ba dang yongs su zad par 'gyur /
translated: “Blessed One, you have said that the roots of virtue of this monk are so great. Blessed One, where will those roots of virtue be diminished, purified, and exhausted?”🔽“Upāli, they will be diminished, purified, and exhausted in the hells.”

original: nye ba 'khor ji ltar tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pas tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la rma byung ba dang rmas par byas pa de lta bu ni ngas ma mthong ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ji ltar tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pas tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la rma byung ba dang rmas par byas pa de lta bu ni ngas ma mthong ste /
translated: Upali, I have never seen a case where a fellow brahmacarin has caused a fellow brahmacarin to bleed.

original: nye ba 'khor des dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po 'di dag bsrabs pa dang yongs su byang ba dang yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor des dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po 'di dag bsrabs pa dang yongs su byang ba dang yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Upali, he has destroyed, completely destroyed, and utterly destroyed his wholesome actions.

original: nye ba 'khor de lta bas na ci nas 'gal ba la yang sems kyis gnod par mi bya na rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes 'don to //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor de lta bas na ci nas 'gal ba la yang sems kyis gnod par mi bya na rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes 'don to //
translated: Upali, therefore, you should not even think of harming someone who is hostile, much less do so with your body, which is conscious.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par rol pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par rol pa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Play of Mañjuśrī Sūtra says,

original: khong khro ba khong khro ba zhes bya ba ni bskal pa brgyar bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'joms pas de'i phyir khong khro ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khong khro ba khong khro ba zhes bya ba ni bskal pa brgyar bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'joms pas de'i phyir khong khro ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Anger, anger: it destroys the wholesome actions accumulated over a hundred eons. Therefore it is called ‘anger.’”

original: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Array of Stalks Sūtra (Gaṇḍavyūha-sūtra) says,

original: mtshan mo'i lha mo sems @84b can kun skyob pa'i dpal gyis sngon gyi rtogs pa brjod pa bsnyad pa las kyang /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i lha mo sems @84b can kun skyob pa'i dpal gyis sngon gyi rtogs pa brjod pa bsnyad pa las kyang /
translated: says:

original: de dag phan tshun brnyas pa'i mi dge ba 'dus pas tshe'i tshad kyang nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun brnyas pa'i mi dge ba 'dus pas tshe'i tshad kyang nyams par 'gyur /
translated: “Because of the nonvirtue of mutual contempt, the life span decreases.

original: kha dog dang stobs dang bde ba las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kha dog dang stobs dang bde ba las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: And there is a complete loss of complexion, strength, and happiness.”

original: 'dir ni brgya lam na yang khengs par mi bya'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir rtag tu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni brgya lam na yang khengs par mi bya'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir rtag tu zhes brjod do //
translated: Here, in order to teach that one should never be conceited, the text says “always.”

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni ji ste na khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni ji ste na khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: How can one accept gain and honor?

original: dkon mchog sprin las ji skad du /
analyzed: dkon mchog sprin las ji skad du /
translated: As the Ratnamegha says,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i rin po che'i phung po ri rab tsam thob na yang len to //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i rin po che'i phung po ri rab tsam thob na yang len to //
translated: “Here a bodhisattva obtains a heap of jewels the size of Mount Meru and accepts it.

original: dngos po ngan pa zhig thob na yang len to //
analyzed: dngos po ngan pa zhig thob na yang len to //
translated: He obtains a small thing and accepts it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de 'di ltar sems te sems can 'di dag ni ser sna can brkam pa 'dod pas bkol ba 'jungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'di ltar sems te sems can 'di dag ni ser sna can brkam pa 'dod pas bkol ba 'jungs pa yin te /
translated: He thinks like this: These sentient beings are stingy, greedy, slaves to desire, and miserly.

original: rgyu de dang rkyen de dang gzhi des chu'i phung po chen pos non pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor 'byung nub byed pa de dag la yun ring por don dang phan pa dang bde ba chen por 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen de dang gzhi des chu'i phung po chen pos non pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor 'byung nub byed pa de dag la yun ring por don dang phan pa dang bde ba chen por 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: Because of that cause, that condition, that basis, they are like a great mass of water being pushed by the wind, rising and falling in the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: de blangs nas bdag gir mi byed chags pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de blangs nas bdag gir mi byed chags pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: Having taken it, he does not make it his own, and does not generate a greedy mind.

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad dang thun mong du sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dag la yang bya ba byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad dang thun mong du sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dag la yang bya ba byed do //
translated: Rather, he shares it with all sentient beings, and uses it for the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la yang phan par byed do //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la yang phan par byed do //
translated: He also benefits those sentient beings who are suffering.

original: sbyin pa'i bdag po de yang gzengs bstod pa dang shin tu dga' bar byed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bdag po de yang gzengs bstod pa dang shin tu dga' bar byed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: He also praises the donor and makes him very happy.

original: de bzhin du de nyid las /
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid las /
translated: Similarly, that same text says:

original: sbyin pa des khengs par yang mi 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa des khengs par yang mi 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: And he does not become proud because of that generosity.

original: yang de nyid las /🔽gal te yang rgyu de dang rkyen de dang gzhi des grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa zhig byung yang des khengs par mi 'gyur nga rgyal mi skye rgyags pa mi skye ste de 'di snyam du sems so //🔽ring por mi thogs par grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa 'di su la nye bar gnas pa dang / su dag gis nye bar gnas par byas pa dang / grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa gang zhig nye bar gnas pa 'di gsum gang yang thams cad du thams cad med par 'gyur na de la mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can su zhig mi rtag cing mi gnas pa'i chos mi brtan pa yid brtan du mi
analyzed: yang de nyid las / gal te yang rgyu de dang rkyen de dang gzhi des grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa zhig byung yang des khengs par mi 'gyur nga rgyal mi skye rgyags pa mi skye ste de 'di snyam du sems so // ring por mi thogs par grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa 'di su la nye bar gnas pa dang / su dag gis nye bar gnas par byas pa dang / grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa gang zhig nye bar gnas pa 'di gsum gang yang thams cad du thams cad med par 'gyur na de la mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can su zhig mi rtag cing mi gnas pa'i chos mi brtan pa yid brtan du mi
translated: And the same text says,🔽“If that cause, that condition, that basis were to give rise to fame, reputation, and praise, he would not become proud because of that, would not become arrogant, would not become conceited. He would think as follows:🔽‘It will not be long before it is not known to whom this fame, reputation, and praise belong, by whom they were made known, and what the fame, reputation, and praise are that were made known. Since all three of these are completely nonexistent, what wise man would arouse a thought of delight

original: rung ba dag la dga' ba'i sems bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: rung ba dag la dga' ba'i sems bskyed pa'am /
translated: in regard to impermanent phenomena that do not endure, that are unstable, and that cannot be relied upon?

original: khengs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: khengs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Or will I become arrogant,

original: nga rgyal dang rgyags pas dregs par 'gyur snyam ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang rgyags pas dregs par 'gyur snyam ste /
translated: or will I become conceited and haughty because of pride and intoxication?”

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang grags @85a * //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang grags @85a * //
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas are very attentive to gain, honor, fame,

original: pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa rnams la dran pa shin tu nye bar gzhag cing gnas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa rnams la dran pa shin tu nye bar gzhag cing gnas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: praise, and fame, and they remain so.

original: gzhan yang dman pa'i yid kyis gdol bu lta bur 'jig rten na spyod pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang dman pa'i yid kyis gdol bu lta bur 'jig rten na spyod pa yin /
translated: Moreover, they behave in the world with a humble mind, like a servant.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsod snyoms slong ba'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag pas dman zhing dman pa'i yid kyis nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dang dregs pa dang bral ba rnams yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsod snyoms slong ba'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag pas dman zhing dman pa'i yid kyis nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dang dregs pa dang bral ba rnams yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are humble, with a humble mind, free of pride, intoxication, and arrogance, because they are always and constantly focused on the idea of begging for alms.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It also says,

original: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par byung ste rab tu byung nas bdag gi grogs po dang blon po dang gnyen bshes dang snag gi gnyen mtshams la shi ba dang 'dra'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par byung ste rab tu byung nas bdag gi grogs po dang blon po dang gnyen bshes dang snag gi gnyen mtshams la shi ba dang 'dra'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
translated: “Noble son, when bodhisattvas leave the household life and go forth, they think, ‘I am like a friend, minister, relative, or blood relative who has died.’

original: bdag gi gzugs mi sdug par khas blangs shing bdag gis gos kha dog mi sdug pa bgos te tshul gzhan du bsgyur ro zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
analyzed: bdag gi gzugs mi sdug par khas blangs shing bdag gis gos kha dog mi sdug pa bgos te tshul gzhan du bsgyur ro zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
translated: They think, ‘I have accepted that my body is ugly. I have put on ugly-colored clothes and changed my appearance.’

original: sprang ba'i rgyu sprang ba'i phyir mgo bregs shing lag na lhung bzed thogs nas grong nas grong du 'gro'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
analyzed: sprang ba'i rgyu sprang ba'i phyir mgo bregs shing lag na lhung bzed thogs nas grong nas grong du 'gro'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
translated: They think, ‘I have shaved my head and taken up a begging bowl in order to beg for alms. I now go from town to town to beg.’

original: gdol bu dang 'dra bar dman pa dman pa'i sems kyis bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'gro'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
analyzed: gdol bu dang 'dra bar dman pa dman pa'i sems kyis bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'gro'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
translated: They think, ‘I am like an outcast, and with a lowly, lowly mind I go out for alms.’

original: bdag ni bsod snyoms pa ste bdag gi 'tsho ba gzhan la rag lus so zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
analyzed: bdag ni bsod snyoms pa ste bdag gi 'tsho ba gzhan la rag lus so zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
translated: They think, ‘I am a beggar, and my livelihood depends on others.’

original: brnyas pa'i bsod snyoms ngan ngon len to zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
analyzed: brnyas pa'i bsod snyoms ngan ngon len to zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
translated: I will take the alms of contempt and the worst scraps.”

original: bdag gis slob dpon dang bla ma dang sbyin pa'i gnas rnams mnyes par bya dgos so zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
analyzed: bdag gis slob dpon dang bla ma dang sbyin pa'i gnas rnams mnyes par bya dgos so zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
translated: “I must please my masters, gurus, and those worthy of honor.”

original: bdag gis tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdag gis tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la 'di lta ste /
translated: “I must please my fellow practitioners of celibacy

original: cho ga dang spyod yul dang kun spyod pa de dang des mgu bar bya'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
analyzed: cho ga dang spyod yul dang kun spyod pa de dang des mgu bar bya'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
translated: with this and that ritual, domain, and conduct.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma thob pa rnams thob par bya'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma thob pa rnams thob par bya'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin /
translated: “I must obtain the qualities of a buddha that I have not yet obtained.”

original: sems can khros pa dang gnod sems rnams kyi nang na bzod pa mang bar bya'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin no zhes gsungs so /🔽// / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: sems can khros pa dang gnod sems rnams kyi nang na bzod pa mang bar bya'o zhes nga rgyal bcom pa yin no zhes gsungs so / // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: “I must be patient with angry and malicious beings.”🔽In the noble Sūtra of the Questions of Sāgaramati,

original: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: it says,

original: de lus yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de lus yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: “Their bodies are pure.

original: lus mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pa dang / lag pa dang rkang pa 'jam zhing mnyen pa dang / bsod nams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i lus shin tu rnam par phye ba dang / dbang po ma tshang ba med pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: lus mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pa dang / lag pa dang rkang pa 'jam zhing mnyen pa dang / bsod nams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i lus shin tu rnam par phye ba dang / dbang po ma tshang ba med pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
translated: His body is well adorned with the major marks, his hands and feet are soft and supple, his body is well-proportioned in accordance with merit, his faculties are not deficient, and all his major and minor body parts are complete.

original: @85b gzugs kyis rgyags shing dregs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: @85b gzugs kyis rgyags shing dregs pa med pa yin te /
translated: But he is not arrogant or proud because of his physical appearance.

original: lus che ba'i tshul dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus che ba'i tshul dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: He does not have a large body.

original: de chos gzung bar bya ba'i phyir sems can ci tsam du dman pa gzugs ma tshang ba rnams la yang 'dud do rab tu 'dud do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de chos gzung bar bya ba'i phyir sems can ci tsam du dman pa gzugs ma tshang ba rnams la yang 'dud do rab tu 'dud do zhes gsungs so //
translated: He bows down to and pays homage to any sentient being, even those of the lowest caste and those with incomplete faculties, in order to uphold the Dharma.

original: yang de nyid las bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang de nyid las bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Again, the same text says,

original: dper na gang gi tshe rgya mtsho chen po mchis par 'gyur ba de'i tshe gzhol ba'i phyogs na mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na gang gi tshe rgya mtsho chen po mchis par 'gyur ba de'i tshe gzhol ba'i phyogs na mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: Blessed One, it is like this: when the great ocean exists, the land slopes toward it.

original: de gzhol ba'i slad du chu klung thams cad dang chab mig dang 'bab chu thams cad tshegs chung ngus der 'bab bo //
analyzed: de gzhol ba'i slad du chu klung thams cad dang chab mig dang 'bab chu thams cad tshegs chung ngus der 'bab bo //
translated: In order to flow into it, all the rivers, springs, and streams flow into it with little difficulty.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nga rgyal ma mchis pa bla ma dang sbyin gnas la gus pa la yang tshogs chung dus chos zab mo'i sgo rnams rna ba'i dbang po la grag par 'gyur zhing dran pa la yang gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nga rgyal ma mchis pa bla ma dang sbyin gnas la gus pa la yang tshogs chung dus chos zab mo'i sgo rnams rna ba'i dbang po la grag par 'gyur zhing dran pa la yang gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, the profound Dharma doors are heard by the ears and are also retained in the memory with little difficulty by the bodhisattva who is free from pride and who respects gurus and those worthy of honor.

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' nga rgyal gyis khengs nga rgyal gyis rengs par gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' nga rgyal gyis khengs nga rgyal gyis rengs par gyur te /
translated: Blessed One, therefore, when a bodhisattva becomes puffed up with pride and rigid with pride,

original: bla ma dang sbyin gnas rnams la kun du mi 'dud cing 'dud par mi bgyid la rab tu mi 'dud na /
analyzed: bla ma dang sbyin gnas rnams la kun du mi 'dud cing 'dud par mi bgyid la rab tu mi 'dud na /
translated: and does not bow down, bow down, and bow down to gurus and those worthy of honor,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ma'o byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni nga rgyal gyi lcags kyus zin par rig par bgyi'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ma'o byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni nga rgyal gyi lcags kyus zin par rig par bgyi'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Blessed One, it should be known that this bodhisattva has been seized by the hook of pride.

original: 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u las kyang /
translated: The noble Transcendent Wisdom Chapter states:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nga rgyal gyi las so //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nga rgyal gyi las so //
translated: O son of the victors, these ten are the activities of pride for bodhisattvas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bla ma dang sbyin gnas dang slob dpon dang pha ma dang dge sbyong dang bram ze dang yang dag par song ba dang yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la mi gus pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
analyzed: bla ma dang sbyin gnas dang slob dpon dang pha ma dang dge sbyong dang bram ze dang yang dag par song ba dang yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la mi gus pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
translated: Lack of respect for gurus, those worthy of offerings, masters, parents, ascetics, brahmins, those who have gone well, and those who have entered the path is an activity of pride.

original: chos smra ba dang / khyad par can gyi chos khong du chud pa dang / chos rgya chen po ston pa dang theg pa chen po la zhugs pa dang 'byung ba'i lam gyi tshul shes pa dang / gzungs dang mdo sde la shin tu byang ba rnams la mi 'dud de /
analyzed: chos smra ba dang / khyad par can gyi chos khong du chud pa dang / chos rgya chen po ston pa dang theg pa chen po la zhugs pa dang 'byung ba'i lam gyi tshul shes pa dang / gzungs dang mdo sde la shin tu byang ba rnams la mi 'dud de /
translated: Not bowing to Dharma teachers, those who have realized special qualities, those who teach the vast Dharma, those who have entered the Great Vehicle, those who know the way of the path of liberation, and those who are well trained in the dhāraṇīs and sūtras,

original: khengs shing 'gying la chos dang chos smra ba la gus pa mi skyed cing sri zhu dang zhes mi byed pa ni /
analyzed: khengs shing 'gying la chos dang chos smra ba la gus pa mi skyed cing sri zhu dang zhes mi byed pa ni /
translated: being arrogant and conceited, not generating respect for the Dharma and Dharma teachers, and not serving them,🔽is an activity of pride.

original: nga rgyal gyi las so //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi las so //
translated: It is an action of pride.

original: chos mnyan pa dang yang dag pa'i gtam bya bar 'dug pa na /
analyzed: chos mnyan pa dang yang dag pa'i gtam bya bar 'dug pa na /
translated: When one is sitting in a place where the Dharma is being taught and a discourse is being given,

original: chos kyi shugs rgya chen po skyes kyang la la zhig 'di la dad pa skyes par 'gyur du 'ong snyam ste chos smra ba la legs so zhes bya ba sbyin par mi byed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so //🔽mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed nas bdag gi gzengs bstod cing pha rol khyad du gsod pa dang bdag shes pa @86a * //
analyzed: chos kyi shugs rgya chen po skyes kyang la la zhig 'di la dad pa skyes par 'gyur du 'ong snyam ste chos smra ba la legs so zhes bya ba sbyin par mi byed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so // mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed nas bdag gi gzengs bstod cing pha rol khyad du gsod pa dang bdag shes pa @86a * //
translated: if one does not give the word “Good!” to the Dharma teacher, thinking “Let no one else feel devotion toward him,” that is an action of pride.

original: la mi 'jug cing sems kyi nges par sems pa mi skyed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
analyzed: la mi 'jug cing sems kyi nges par sems pa mi skyed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
translated: If, having aroused a sense of pride, one exalts oneself and deprecates others, and if one does not understand one’s own faults and does not reflect on the stability of one’s mind, that is an action of pride.

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal bskyed nas shes shing rtogs bzhin du bsngags par 'os pa'i gang zag rnams kyi bsngags pa 'chab pa dang mi snyan par brjod cing gzhan gyi yon tan bsngags pas yid mi dga' bar 'gyur ba ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal bskyed nas shes shing rtogs bzhin du bsngags par 'os pa'i gang zag rnams kyi bsngags pa 'chab pa dang mi snyan par brjod cing gzhan gyi yon tan bsngags pas yid mi dga' bar 'gyur ba ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
translated: If, having aroused a sense of pride, one conceals the praiseworthy qualities of those who are worthy of praise, and if one speaks ill of them and is displeased when others praise their good qualities, that is an action of pride.

original: 'di ni chos so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos so //
translated: This is the Dharma.

original: 'di ni 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba'o //
translated: This is the Vinaya.

original: 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no zhes bya bar yang dag par shes la /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no zhes bya bar yang dag par shes la /
translated: This is the word of the Perfectly Awakened One.”

original: gang zag la zhe sdang zhing chos la zhe sdang ba dang dam pa'i chos spong ba dang gzhan dag kyang rtsod du 'jug cing ldog par byed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
analyzed: gang zag la zhe sdang zhing chos la zhe sdang ba dang dam pa'i chos spong ba dang gzhan dag kyang rtsod du 'jug cing ldog par byed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
translated: “To hate individuals and the Dharma, to abandon the holy Dharma, to cause others to dispute and turn away from the Dharma, and to be conceited about one’s own view: these are the actions of pride.

original: stan mthon po 'dod pa dang gces te las su mi bsko ba'i chos tshol ba dang gzhan gyi rim gro bya bar sdod cing mngon bar dga' ba dang gnas brtan rgan po tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du spyad pa rnams la mi ldang zhing mi su ba
analyzed: stan mthon po 'dod pa dang gces te las su mi bsko ba'i chos tshol ba dang gzhan gyi rim gro bya bar sdod cing mngon bar dga' ba dang gnas brtan rgan po tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du spyad pa rnams la mi ldang zhing mi su ba
translated: “To desire high seats, to seek out teachings for the sake of gain and not for practice, to be pleased with the service of others, and to not rise up and honor the elders who have practiced pure conduct for a long time: these are the actions of pride.

original: dang bsnyen bkur mi byed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so ;
analyzed: dang bsnyen bkur mi byed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so ;
translated: “To not bow down to those who are worthy of respect: these are the actions of pride.

original: / bzhin khro gnyer can du byas shing mi 'dzum pa dang / tshig 'jam zhing mnyen pa med la rtag tu khengs pa'i sems kyis glags lta skabs tshol ba ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
analyzed: / bzhin khro gnyer can du byas shing mi 'dzum pa dang / tshig 'jam zhing mnyen pa med la rtag tu khengs pa'i sems kyis glags lta skabs tshol ba ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
translated: Having a frowning face and not smiling, not having soft and gentle speech, and always having a conceited mind, looking for opportunities to find fault, is the function of pride.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du lhung zhing mkhas pa'i gan du mi 'gro mi bsnyen mi bsten bsnyen bkur mi byed yongs su mi 'dri zhing dge ba ni ci mi dge ba ni ci /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du lhung zhing mkhas pa'i gan du mi 'gro mi bsnyen mi bsten bsnyen bkur mi byed yongs su mi 'dri zhing dge ba ni ci mi dge ba ni ci /
translated: Falling into manifest pride, not going to the wise, not attending on them, not serving them, not asking questions, not asking, “What is virtuous? What is non-virtuous?

original: ci byas na yun ring por don dang phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci byas na yun ring por don dang phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur /
translated: What should I do to bring about benefit, welfare, and happiness for a long time?

original: ci byas na yun ring por gnod pa dang mi phan pa dang mi bde bar 'gyur zhes mi 'dri ste /
analyzed: ci byas na yun ring por gnod pa dang mi phan pa dang mi bde bar 'gyur zhes mi 'dri ste /
translated: What should I do to bring about harm, misfortune, and suffering for a long time?”

original: de rmongs pa las ches rmongs par gyur nas /
analyzed: de rmongs pa las ches rmongs par gyur nas /
translated: Not asking these questions, being more confused than confused,

original: gti mug gis blong zhing nga rgyal gyis brgyal te 'byung ba mi mthong ba ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
analyzed: gti mug gis blong zhing nga rgyal gyis brgyal te 'byung ba mi mthong ba ni nga rgyal gyi las so //
translated: being overwhelmed by delusion, and fainting from pride, not seeing the way out, is the function of pride.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis zil gyis non pas sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par mi byed pa dang sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zad par byed pa dang gsar mi skyed pa dang / bshad par mi bya ba 'chad pa dang 'thab mo byed cing rtsod pa mang bar gyur te /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis zil gyis non pas sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par mi byed pa dang sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zad par byed pa dang gsar mi skyed pa dang / bshad par mi bya ba 'chad pa dang 'thab mo byed cing rtsod pa mang bar gyur te /
translated: They are overcome by manifest pride, so they do not please the appearance of the Buddhas. They exhaust their former roots of virtue and do not create new ones. They explain what should not be explained, and they fight and argue a lot.

original: 'di lta bu'i chos la gnas pas 'dod rgyal chen por lhung ba'i gnas su gyur kyang /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i chos la gnas pas 'dod rgyal chen por lhung ba'i gnas su gyur kyang /
translated: Even though they have fallen into the state of great recklessness by abiding in such a Dharma,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi stobs skyed pas dbang phyug thob par 'gyur yang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi stobs skyed pas dbang phyug thob par 'gyur yang /
translated: they attain lordship by generating the power of the thought of awakening.

original: des bskal pa brgya stong du sangs rgyas 'byung ba yang mi mthong na chos nyan par lta ga la 'gyur te 'di ni nga rgyal gyi las bcu pa'o //
analyzed: des bskal pa brgya stong du sangs rgyas 'byung ba yang mi mthong na chos nyan par lta ga la 'gyur te 'di ni nga rgyal gyi las bcu pa'o //
translated: But they do not see the appearance of the Buddhas even for a hundred thousand eons, let alone hear the Dharma. This is the tenth action of pride.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' dag gis @86b nga rgyal gyi las bcu po de lta bu de dag yongs su spangs nas /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' dag gis @86b nga rgyal gyi las bcu po de lta bu de dag yongs su spangs nas /
translated: “O Son of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattvas, having completely abandoned such ten actions of pride,

original: ye shes kyi las bcu thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi las bcu thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: One obtains the ten actions of pristine wisdom.

original: de nyid las sems can thams cad la nga rgyal med pa zhes ye shes kyi las legs par bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid las sems can thams cad la nga rgyal med pa zhes ye shes kyi las legs par bshad do //
translated: And in the same text, the action of pristine wisdom is well explained as “no pride toward any sentient being.”

original: 'phags pa yul 'khor skyong gis zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa yul 'khor skyong gis zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble Multitude of Jewels says,

original: rmongs pa de dag nga rgyal dbang gis na //
analyzed: rmongs pa de dag nga rgyal dbang gis na //
translated: “Those confused by pride🔽are born in the lower realms, in places without a chance to practice,🔽in poor families, in low castes,

original: ngan song pa dang mi khom skye ba dang // dbul dang dman pa'i rigs su skye ba dang // dmus long mdog ngan mthu chung nyid 'dzin byed //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ngan song pa dang mi khom skye ba dang // dbul dang dman pa'i rigs su skye ba dang // dmus long mdog ngan mthu chung nyid 'dzin byed // ces gsungs so //
translated: blind, ugly, and weak.”

original: chos yang dag par sdud pa las kyang /
analyzed: chos yang dag par sdud pa las kyang /
translated: The noble Sūtra on Chanting the Dharma Together also says,

original: sems can gyi zhing ni byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ste ;
analyzed: sems can gyi zhing ni byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ste ;
translated: “Sentient beings are the bodhisattva’s buddha-field.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang las sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'thob par 'gyur ba de la log par bsgrub pa mi rigs so snyam mo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang las sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'thob par 'gyur ba de la log par bsgrub pa mi rigs so snyam mo //
translated: If a buddha-field is made up of sentient beings, and if the qualities of a buddha are attained in dependence on sentient beings, then it is not right to do anything wrong to sentient beings.”

original: de yang 'di snyam du legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa thams cad ni sems can la brten nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang 'di snyam du legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa thams cad ni sems can la brten nas 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, he thinks: All good and bad actions arise in dependence on sentient beings.

original: nyes par spyad pa la brten nas ni ngan song rnams 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa la brten nas ni ngan song rnams 'byung ngo ;
translated: In dependence on bad actions, the miserable realms arise.🔽In dependence on good actions, gods and humans arise.

original: / legs par spyad pa la brten nas ni lha dang mir 'gyur ro snyom mo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / legs par spyad pa la brten nas ni lha dang mir 'gyur ro snyom mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas na dkon mchog ta la la'i gzungs las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na dkon mchog ta la la'i gzungs las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Ratnamegha-sutra says,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di la byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la thog ma nyid du sems rnam pa bcu bskyed de /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di la byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la thog ma nyid du sems rnam pa bcu bskyed de /
translated: “O son of the victors! Here, a bodhisattva who is a beginner should first generate ten thoughts toward sentient beings.🔽What are the ten?

original: rnam pa bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: phan pa'i sems dang / bde ba'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / mnyen pa'i sems dang / sdug pa'i sems dang / phan gdags pa'i sems dang / kun du srung ba'i sems dang / snyoms pa'i sems dang / slob dpon gyi sems dang /
analyzed: phan pa'i sems dang / bde ba'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / mnyen pa'i sems dang / sdug pa'i sems dang / phan gdags pa'i sems dang / kun du srung ba'i sems dang / snyoms pa'i sems dang / slob dpon gyi sems dang /
translated: The ten attitudes are: the attitude of benefit, the attitude of happiness, the attitude of love, the attitude of gentleness, the attitude of affection, the attitude of helpfulness, the attitude of protection, the attitude of impartiality, the attitude of a teacher, and

original: ston pa'i sems te /🔽sems rnam pa bcu po 'di dag bskyed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ston pa'i sems te / sems rnam pa bcu po 'di dag bskyed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: the attitude of a trainer.

original: dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya'i mdo las /
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra on the Posture for Beginning to Generate the Power of Faith says:

original: bdag nyid ni sems can thams cad kyi slob mar khas len pa la gnas shing sems can gzhan dag kyang slob mar khas len pa la gzhag go snyam du dbugs dbyung ba rnyed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni sems can thams cad kyi slob mar khas len pa la gnas shing sems can gzhan dag kyang slob mar khas len pa la gzhag go snyam du dbugs dbyung ba rnyed do //
translated: “I will stand as one who accepts all sentient beings as my disciples, and I will lead others to accept all sentient beings as their disciples.”

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Thinking in this way, I will find relief.🔽In the same way, I will stand as one who bows down to and pays homage to all sentient beings.

original: rnam par 'dud pa dang rab tu 'dud pa la gzhag go snyam du dbugs dbyung ba rnyed do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par 'dud pa dang rab tu 'dud pa la gzhag go snyam du dbugs dbyung ba rnyed do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thinking in this way, I will find relief.

original: de la rnam par 'dud pa dang rab tu 'dud pa ni sems can thams cad la nga rgyal med pa nyid do //🔽de bzhin du 'phags pa dri ma med par grags @87a * //
analyzed: de la rnam par 'dud pa dang rab tu 'dud pa ni sems can thams cad la nga rgyal med pa nyid do // de bzhin du 'phags pa dri ma med par grags @87a * //
translated: Here, bowing and prostrating are the absence of pride toward all sentient beings.

original: pas bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: pas bstan pa las kyang /
translated: In the same way, the noble Holy Teaching of Vimalakīrti says,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la ston pa ltar gces par byed ces gsungs so //🔽stan 'ding ba dang rkang pa 'khru ba la sogs pa'i las byed pa na yang 'jig rten ma dad par 'gyur ba bsrung ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la ston pa ltar gces par byed ces gsungs so // stan 'ding ba dang rkang pa 'khru ba la sogs pa'i las byed pa na yang 'jig rten ma dad par 'gyur ba bsrung ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to be reborn in a pure buddha-field, you should cherish all sentient beings as much as a teacher.

original: sems kyis gces pa dang gus par bsam pa goms par bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyis gces pa dang gus par bsam pa goms par bya'o //
translated: When you do actions such as preparing a seat or washing the feet of others, you should do them with a mind that cherishes and respects others, in order to avoid giving rise to lack of faith in the world.🔽You should cultivate this attitude.

original: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las kyang gsungs te /
translated: The noble Array of Stalks Sūtra also says,

original: des seng ge'i khri chen po de la 'dug ma thag tu skye bo mang po de dag mngon du phyogs par 'gyur te thal mo sbyar nas rgyal po de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: des seng ge'i khri chen po de la 'dug ma thag tu skye bo mang po de dag mngon du phyogs par 'gyur te thal mo sbyar nas rgyal po de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: As soon as he sat down on the great lion throne, the crowd turned toward him, and with palms together they bowed to the king.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te ;
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te ;
translated: The same should be applied to the rest.

original: rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrogs pa des slong mo pa de dag mthong ba'i mdo de la de'i rgyus ches dga' bar gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrogs pa des slong mo pa de dag mthong ba'i mdo de la de'i rgyus ches dga' bar gyur gyi /
translated: “The king who proclaims the maṇḍala of the sound of all dharmas, having seen those beggars, was overjoyed by that sūtra.

original: bskal pa tshad med pa'i mthas klas par zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bskal pa tshad med pa'i mthas klas par zhes bya ba nas /
translated: For countless eons, up to …

original: gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i rnam par thar pa zhi ba'i bde ba la gnas pa thob pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i rnam par thar pa zhi ba'i bde ba la gnas pa thob pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: he did not attain the peace and happiness of the liberation of the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm.”

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, it is like this:

original: dper na / skyes bu sred pa la spyod pa pha ma dang phu nu dang bu sring dang mdza' bo dang blon po dang gnyen bshes dang bu dang bu mo dang chung ma dang yun ring mo zhig tu bral ba la 'brog dgon par 'khyams te /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu sred pa la spyod pa pha ma dang phu nu dang bu sring dang mdza' bo dang blon po dang gnyen bshes dang bu dang bu mo dang chung ma dang yun ring mo zhig tu bral ba la 'brog dgon par 'khyams te /
translated: For example, a person who is addicted to craving, separated for a long time from his parents, brothers, sisters, friends, ministers, relatives, sons, daughters, and wife, wanders in the wilderness,

analyzed: / nye ba 'khor byang chub sems dpa' gang dag thabs la mkhas pa de dag ni zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i ltung bas 'jigs kyi 'dod chags dang ldan pas ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Upāli, those bodhisattvas who are skilled in means fear a downfall from hatred, but not one from passion.

original: thabs mkhas pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is skill in means?

original: gang dag shes rab dang snying rje gnyis kyis sems can gtong ba las zlog pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag shes rab dang snying rje gnyis kyis sems can gtong ba las zlog pa'o //
translated: They are turned away from abandoning sentient beings by means of both wisdom and compassion.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang sems can gtong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang sems can gtong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Both of them abandon sentient beings,

original: shes rab gcig pus ni sdug bsngal stong pa nyid du khong du chud pa'i phyir dang / snying rje gcig pus ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis ring por mi thogs par snying rje nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab gcig pus ni sdug bsngal stong pa nyid du khong du chud pa'i phyir dang / snying rje gcig pus ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis ring por mi thogs par snying rje nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because by wisdom alone one understands suffering to be emptiness, and by compassion alone one’s compassion would quickly deteriorate due to the power of the afflictions.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Skill in Means Sūtra says,🔽“Son of noble family,

original: rigs kyi bu dper na /🔽gsang sngags dang rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mi'i rgyal pos bzung ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dper na / gsang sngags dang rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mi'i rgyal pos bzung ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: thag pa lnga'i bcing bas bcings su zin kyang de gang gi tshe 'gro ba 'dod pa de'i tshe gsang sngags dang rig sngags kyi stobs bskyed pa gcig gis bcings pa thams cad @92b gtubs te 'gro'o //
analyzed: thag pa lnga'i bcing bas bcings su zin kyang de gang gi tshe 'gro ba 'dod pa de'i tshe gsang sngags dang rig sngags kyi stobs bskyed pa gcig gis bcings pa thams cad @92b gtubs te 'gro'o //
translated: A human king who holds secret mantra and knowledge mantra, even though he is bound by the fivefold fetters, when he wishes to go somewhere, by the power of a single secret mantra or knowledge mantra, he cuts all his fetters and goes.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du /
translated: Son of noble family, it is just like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa yang gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las dga' bar myong zhing de dag dang lang long du gyur pas gnas kyang gang gi tshe 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pa dang thams cad mkhyen
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa yang gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las dga' bar myong zhing de dag dang lang long du gyur pas gnas kyang gang gi tshe 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pa dang thams cad mkhyen
translated: When bodhisattvas are skilled in means, even when they experience the pleasures of the five sense objects and live in a state of excitement with them, when they want to, they can use the power of their wisdom to turn them into factors conducive to enlightenment.

original: pa nyid kyi sems gcig gis 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad bcom nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: pa nyid kyi sems gcig gis 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad bcom nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, when he experiences the delights of the five sense objects and dwells in the midst of them, when he wishes, by the power of his wisdom and by the single thought of omniscience, he conquers all the sense objects and is born in the Brahma world.

original: zhe sdang la yang de ltar ci'i phyir 'dod par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: zhe sdang la yang de ltar ci'i phyir 'dod par mi byed ce na /
translated: Why is it not accepted that hatred is also like that?

original: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i phyir dang snying rje dang bral bas na thabs nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i phyir dang snying rje dang bral bas na thabs nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is by nature a misdeed and because it is impossible for it to be a method, since it is devoid of compassion.

original: yang na gzhan gyi don grub pa rang gi don las shin tu lci bar lhag par mos pa na /
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyi don grub pa rang gi don las shin tu lci bar lhag par mos pa na /
translated: Or else, when one is intent on the accomplishment of others' goals as being more important than one's own goal,

original: khro ba la gnas pas kyang gzhan la rjes su bstan nas gdung ba sngon du 'gro bas de ma thag tu phyin chad mi byed pa'i sdom pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: khro ba la gnas pas kyang gzhan la rjes su bstan nas gdung ba sngon du 'gro bas de ma thag tu phyin chad mi byed pa'i sdom pa 'thob bo //
translated: And even if he is angry, he teaches others by his own example, and by his prior suffering, he immediately obtains the vow not to do it again.

original: gnod pa las bzlog pa'i phyir khros pa la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gnod pa las bzlog pa'i phyir khros pa la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault of anger when it turns away from harm?

original: skabs phye na de'i bag chags gsos par 'gyur bas snying rje nyams pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skabs phye na de'i bag chags gsos par 'gyur bas snying rje nyams pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he gives an opportunity, the latent impressions are nourished, and there is the fault of the decline of compassion.

original: de bcad na rtsa ba 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bcad na rtsa ba 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: If he cuts it off, the root is cut off. This will be taught later.

original: gal te sems can de la phan du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa' snying rje nyams pas sems can gyi don chen po'i rgyun nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sems can de la phan du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa' snying rje nyams pas sems can gyi don chen po'i rgyun nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if he benefits that sentient being, the Bodhisattva's compassion declines, and the stream of great benefit to sentient beings is interrupted.

original: 'phags pa bden pa po'i le'u'i dpes ni snying rje la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa bden pa po'i le'u'i dpes ni snying rje la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: By the example of the chapter on the Noble Truthful One, one should understand that he abides in compassion.

original: der ha cang snying rje bkag pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi don la mkhas pas 'jig rten pa 'dun par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der ha cang snying rje bkag pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi don la mkhas pas 'jig rten pa 'dun par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason why compassion is so strongly prohibited there is that the worldling is to be attracted to the world’s aims.

original: zlog pa na yang gal te phan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la khong khro bar gyur na /
analyzed: zlog pa na yang gal te phan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la khong khro bar gyur na /
translated: And if the worldling becomes angry at the Bodhisattva who is trying to help him,

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' ma yin par 'gyur zhing gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' ma yin par 'gyur zhing gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then he will not be a Bodhisattva, and both will be harmed.

original: 'dod chags kyang nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyang nyes pa yin te /
translated: Attachment is also a fault.

original: 'dod pa dag la brten pa'i mi //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag la brten pa'i mi //
translated: The man who relies on desires

original: ldongs 'gyur pha ma gsod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ldongs 'gyur pha ma gsod par 'gyur //
translated: will become blind and kill his parents.

original: 'dod bsten tshul khrims ldan pa'ang gsod //
analyzed: 'dod bsten tshul khrims ldan pa'ang gsod //
translated: He will kill even one who has morality,

original: des na rtag tu spang bar bya //
analyzed: des na rtag tu spang bar bya //
translated: so one should always avoid desires.

original: zhes bstan te /🔽bdag bde ba la chags pas ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal yal bar 'dor bar mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bstan te / bdag bde ba la chags pas ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal yal bar 'dor bar mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: It is taught.🔽If you say that one who is attached to his own happiness will ignore the suffering of others,

original: gang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gi sdug bsngal du ma goms pa de la ni mthong ba bden te /
analyzed: gang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gi sdug bsngal du ma goms pa de la ni mthong ba bden te /
translated: it is true that one who is not accustomed to regarding the suffering of others as his own will see things that way.

original: gang shin tu goms pa de la ni nyes pa gnyi ga mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang shin tu goms pa de la ni nyes pa gnyi ga mi 'byung ngo //
translated: But for one who is very familiar with it, neither fault occurs.

original: zla ba @93a * //
analyzed: zla ba @93a * //
translated: For one who is very familiar with it, neither of these two faults occurs.

original: sgron ma'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: sgron ma'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As it says in the Candrapradīpa Sūtra,

original: kun dga' bo 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di lta ste /
translated: Ānanda, it is like this:

original: dper na 'di la skyes bu la la zhig rkang pa nas spyi bo'i bar du 'bar bar gyur te rab tu 'bar zhing me lce gcig tu gyur pa de la /
analyzed: dper na 'di la skyes bu la la zhig rkang pa nas spyi bo'i bar du 'bar bar gyur te rab tu 'bar zhing me lce gcig tu gyur pa de la /
translated: Suppose that a person’s body, from the soles of the feet upward and from the tips of the hair downward, was ablaze, burning fiercely, a single flame.

original: skyes bu la la zhig der nye bar 'ongs te /
analyzed: skyes bu la la zhig der nye bar 'ongs te /
translated: Then another person came to that person and said,

original: 'di skad du kye skyes bu tshur shog //
analyzed: 'di skad du kye skyes bu tshur shog //
translated: “Hey, you! Come here!

original: lus la me 'bar ba ma zhi bar 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang phrad cing ldan par rtses shig dga' bar gyis shig dga' mgur spyod cig ces zer na kun dga' bo 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: lus la me 'bar ba ma zhi bar 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang phrad cing ldan par rtses shig dga' bar gyis shig dga' mgur spyod cig ces zer na kun dga' bo 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Without extinguishing the fire that blazes on your body, enjoy the five sensory pleasures, play around, have fun, and enjoy yourself!” Ānanda, what do you think?

original: skyes bu de lus la me 'bar ba ma zhi bar 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang phrad cing ldan par 'gyur te rtse ba dang dga' ba dang dga' mgur spyod par byed dam /
analyzed: skyes bu de lus la me 'bar ba ma zhi bar 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang phrad cing ldan par 'gyur te rtse ba dang dga' ba dang dga' mgur spyod par byed dam /
translated: Would that person’s body, with the fire burning on it not extinguished, come into contact with and enjoy the five sensory pleasures, and play around, have fun, and enjoy himself?🔽Ānanda said,

original: kun dga' bos gsol pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bos gsol pa /
translated: “No, Gautama.”

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: Blessed One, that is not so.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kun dga' bo yongs su brtag pa bzung ste skyes bu de lus la me 'bar ba ma zhi bar 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang phrad cing ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo yongs su brtag pa bzung ste skyes bu de lus la me 'bar ba ma zhi bar 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang phrad cing ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Ānanda, suppose that man’s body were on fire, and he were not to extinguish that fire, but were to enjoy himself with the five external sense pleasures.

original: rtse ba dan dga' ba dang dga' mgur spyod du zin kyang de bzhin gshegs pa sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sems can rnams ngan song gsum gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur cing dbul ba dag mthong nas yid bde ba'am sems bde ba ma byung
analyzed: rtse ba dan dga' ba dang dga' mgur spyod du zin kyang de bzhin gshegs pa sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sems can rnams ngan song gsum gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur cing dbul ba dag mthong nas yid bde ba'am sems bde ba ma byung
translated: Even so, Ānanda, when the Tathāgata was practicing the conduct of the bodhisattva previously, he did not experience mental pleasure or mental well-being when he saw that sentient beings were suffering in the three lower realms and were poor.

original: ngo zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngo zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: 'jig rten na yang bu gsal shing la bskyon pa mthong ba na pha ma la rang gi tshul dang mthun par snying rje ba'i dbang gis rang gi bde ba la mi chags par snang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang bu gsal shing la bskyon pa mthong ba na pha ma la rang gi tshul dang mthun par snying rje ba'i dbang gis rang gi bde ba la mi chags par snang ngo //
translated: In the world, when a father or mother sees their child impaled on a stake, they do not cling to their own pleasure because of the power of compassion that is appropriate to them.

original: dben pa zhig tu byas na khyo yod pa'am /
analyzed: dben pa zhig tu byas na khyo yod pa'am /
translated: If they were to make a private place, they would have a husband.

original: mgo gtsang ma rigs dang chos dang rgyal mtshan gyis bsrungs pa la yang rung ste 'dod pa la log par g-yem par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgo gtsang ma rigs dang chos dang rgyal mtshan gyis bsrungs pa la yang rung ste 'dod pa la log par g-yem par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not sexual misconduct even if it is with a woman of a different caste, or with a woman protected by the Dharma, or with a woman protected by the king, or with a woman protected by her family.

original: sems can gyi don du 'gyur la sems can la yang mi gnod pa bsgrubs na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du 'gyur la sems can la yang mi gnod pa bsgrubs na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one does it for the sake of sentient beings, and it does not harm sentient beings.

original: yang dag par tshangs par spyod pa rnams ni don byas pa'i phyir de dag lam srid la sogs pa bzhin du ring du spang zhing mchod do //
analyzed: yang dag par tshangs par spyod pa rnams ni don byas pa'i phyir de dag lam srid la sogs pa bzhin du ring du spang zhing mchod do //
translated: The pure ones are to be honored and kept at a distance, like the path, the sky, etc., because they have fulfilled their purpose.

original: de lta na ni dge slong gis kyang bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni dge slong gis kyang bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, a monk would also have to do it.

original: de lta ma yin te ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin te ;
translated: No, it is not like that.

original: de bzhin du tshangs par spyod pa'i rnam pas sems can gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs par spyod pa'i rnam pas sems can gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, for the sake of accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings, one should practice pure conduct.

original: de skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: Thus it is said in the Akṣayamatisūtra:

original: des dus dang dus ma yin pa btang snyoms su bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des dus dang dus ma yin pa btang snyoms su bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “He should be indifferent to time and non-time.”

original: ci ste de las sems can gyi don du 'gyur ba lhag pa mthong na bslab pa @93b dbul lo //
analyzed: ci ste de las sems can gyi don du 'gyur ba lhag pa mthong na bslab pa @93b dbul lo //
translated: If one sees a greater benefit for sentient beings from that, one should give up the training.

original: bskal pa mang por goms pas bdag nyid du gyur pa'i snying rje chen po dang thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba can gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dod chags kyis bar du gcod par byed par 'gyur ram ci
analyzed: bskal pa mang por goms pas bdag nyid du gyur pa'i snying rje chen po dang thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba can gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dod chags kyis bar du gcod par byed par 'gyur ram ci
translated: How could attachment obstruct the bodhisattvas who have fully completed the roots of virtue, such as great compassion and skill in means that have become their nature through habituation for many eons?

original: 'di ni mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: This is impossible.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las kyang bstan te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las kyang bstan te /
translated: The Skill in Means Sūtra also teaches this:🔽In the story of the young brahmin Nakṣatra, for forty-two thousand years he maintained pure conduct.

original: bram ze'i khye'u skar ma lo bzhi khri nyis stong gi bar du tshangs par spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas des gom pa bdun pa la gnas te snying rje skyes nas bdag gi brtul zhugs 'di bshig ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u skar ma lo bzhi khri nyis stong gi bar du tshangs par spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas des gom pa bdun pa la gnas te snying rje skyes nas bdag gi brtul zhugs 'di bshig ste /
translated: When he was on the seventh step, compassion arose and he thought, “I will break this vow of mine and

original: sems can dmyal bar song bar gyur kyang sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal de myong bar bzod kyi /
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar song bar gyur kyang sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal de myong bar bzod kyi /
translated: even if I go to the hells, I will endure the suffering of the hells.

original: bud med 'di shir 'ong gis bde bar gyur cig ces rigs kyi bu bram ze'i khye'u skar ma de slar log ste bud med de la lag pa g-yas pa nas bzung nas sru mo khyod ci 'dod pa bya'i longs shig ces de skad ces smras so //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bud med 'di shir 'ong gis bde bar gyur cig ces rigs kyi bu bram ze'i khye'u skar ma de slar log ste bud med de la lag pa g-yas pa nas bzung nas sru mo khyod ci 'dod pa bya'i longs shig ces de skad ces smras so // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The young brahmin Nakṣatra returned and said to the woman, Aunt, whatever you desire, take it from my right hand.

original: rigs kyi bu nga 'dod pa ngan pa dang ldan pa'i snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed pas kyang bskal pa khrir 'khor ba phyir bsnyil te spangs par gyur to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu nga 'dod pa ngan pa dang ldan pa'i snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed pas kyang bskal pa khrir 'khor ba phyir bsnyil te spangs par gyur to //
translated: Son of noble family, because I generated the thought of great compassion endowed with evil desires, I turned back and abandoned cyclic existence for ten thousand eons.

original: rigs kyi bu sems can gzhan gang dag sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba des byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes pa la ltos zhes gsungs so //🔽yang de nyid las /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems can gzhan gang dag sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba des byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes pa la ltos zhes gsungs so // yang de nyid las /
translated: Son of noble family, look at the bodhisattva skilled in means who was born in the world of Brahmā, while other sentient beings were born in the hells.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig gi dge ba'i rtsa ba skye bar 'gyur ba lta na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig gi dge ba'i rtsa ba skye bar 'gyur ba lta na /
translated: And the same text says, If a bodhisattva sees that the roots of virtue of a single sentient being will arise,

original: ltung ba ji lta bu byung ba bskal pa brgya stong du sems can dmyal bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i ltung ba byung yang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ltung ba byung ba dang sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal de la spro ba nyid du
analyzed: ltung ba ji lta bu byung ba bskal pa brgya stong du sems can dmyal bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i ltung ba byung yang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ltung ba byung ba dang sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal de la spro ba nyid du
translated: Even if a bodhisattva has a downfall that would cause him to live in the hells for a hundred thousand eons, he should be enthusiastic about that downfall and the suffering of the hells,

original: bgyi ste / sems can gcig po de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su btang ba dang yongs su bri bar ni mi bgyi'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bgyi ste / sems can gcig po de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su btang ba dang yongs su bri bar ni mi bgyi'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: and should not give up or diminish the roots of virtue of even a single being.

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: And the same text says:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa brgya la la zhig tu sdig pa'i grogs po'i dbang gis nyes pa byung na de 'di ltar slob ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa brgya la la zhig tu sdig pa'i grogs po'i dbang gis nyes pa byung na de 'di ltar slob ste /
translated: “Noble sir, if a skillful bodhisattva should happen to commit an offense because of the influence of bad friends, he should train in this way:

original: gal te bdag gis phung po 'di dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya na ni bdag gi sems yongs su gdung ba dang ldan par yang 'gyur gyis 'di ltar bdag gis sems can @94a * //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis phung po 'di dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya na ni bdag gi sems yongs su gdung ba dang ldan par yang 'gyur gyis 'di ltar bdag gis sems can @94a * //
translated: ‘If I were to attain nirvana with these aggregates, I would have a mind that is full of anguish.

original: yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par gnas pa de lta bu'i go cha bgos la /
analyzed: yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par gnas pa de lta bu'i go cha bgos la /
translated: For the sake of bringing them to full maturity, I will remain for the very latest time, the final age.

original: bdag gi sems la gdung bar ni mi bya'i /
analyzed: bdag gi sems la gdung bar ni mi bya'i /
translated: I will not torment my mind.

original: ji lta ji ltar 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar sems can yongs su smin par bgyi'o //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar sems can yongs su smin par bgyi'o //
translated: To the extent that I will be revolving in cyclic existence, to that extent I will bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: ltung ba 'di yang chos bzhin du gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba 'di yang chos bzhin du gso bar bya'o //
translated: And I will purify this downfall in accordance with the Dharma.

original: phyis nyes par mi bya'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: phyis nyes par mi bya'o snyam du sems so //
translated: I will not commit this mistake again.

original: rigs kyi bu yongs su brtag pa bzung na gal te rab tu byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi po thams cad zhig par gyur kyang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu yongs su brtag pa bzung na gal te rab tu byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi po thams cad zhig par gyur kyang /
translated: Son of noble family, suppose that an ordained bodhisattva were to destroy all four of the root precepts.

original: thabs la mkhas pa 'dis sel bar byed pa lta na /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa 'dis sel bar byed pa lta na /
translated: But if he were to clear them away by this method of skill in means,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la ltung bar mi 'gyur bar nga smra'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la ltung bar mi 'gyur bar nga smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: I say that he would not have a downfall.

original: 'di ni dkon mchog sprin las kyang gsal ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni dkon mchog sprin las kyang gsal ba nyid de /
translated: This is also made clear in the Cloud of Jewels:

original: mtshams med pa byed par 'dod pa'i mi gsad par gnang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed par 'dod pa'i mi gsad par gnang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he permitted the killing of a man who was about to commit a heinous crime.

original: nyan thos kyi 'dul ba las kyang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'dul ba las kyang /
translated: And in the Vinaya of the Disciples,

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i gnas nyid la snying rje bas ri dags la sogs pa btang bas nyes pa med par gsungs so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i gnas nyid la snying rje bas ri dags la sogs pa btang bas nyes pa med par gsungs so //
translated: it is said that there is no offense for a Bodhisattva to give away deer, etc., out of compassion, even though it is a downfall.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' la 'dod chags skyes nas bde 'gro 'thob pa 'di ni 'dod chags yon tan can yin te khro ba ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' la 'dod chags skyes nas bde 'gro 'thob pa 'di ni 'dod chags yon tan can yin te khro ba ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: When a Bodhisattva arouses desire and thereby attains a happy rebirth, that desire is a good quality, but anger is not.

original: 'phags pa thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As the noble Skill in Means Sūtra says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dga' byed la bu mo dpal yon can gyi mchog chags par gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dga' byed la bu mo dpal yon can gyi mchog chags par gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas //
translated: in the story of the courtesan Vāsantī,

original: dga' byed smon lam phyi phyir 'debs pa ni //
analyzed: dga' byed smon lam phyi phyir 'debs pa ni //
translated: “Vāsantī made aspiration prayers again and again:

original: bud med gang dag chags sems kyis blta ba //
analyzed: bud med gang dag chags sems kyis blta ba //
translated: ‘Those who, with a mind of desire, look upon me,🔽may they give up the female body

original: de ni bud med lus kyang yongs spangs te //
analyzed: de ni bud med lus kyang yongs spangs te //
translated: and attain the male body.’

original: skyes bu spangs pa'i sems can 'gyur bar shog / gang gis sems can gzhan dag dmyal 'gro ba ;
analyzed: skyes bu spangs pa'i sems can 'gyur bar shog / gang gis sems can gzhan dag dmyal 'gro ba ;
translated: May beings become free of the faults of sentient beings.

original: / des ni dpa' bo dag la chags bskyed na //
analyzed: / des ni dpa' bo dag la chags bskyed na //
translated: When a hero generates desire for other sentient beings,

original: mtho ris 'gro zhing skyes pa nyid 'gyur ba //
analyzed: mtho ris 'gro zhing skyes pa nyid 'gyur ba //
translated: he goes to the higher realms and becomes a man.

original: de yi yon tan 'di 'dra kun dga' ltos //
analyzed: de yi yon tan 'di 'dra kun dga' ltos //
translated: Look at the qualities of the bodhisattvas, Ānanda!

original: de bzhin du sbyar te //🔽su zhig rtsi rgyal grags pa chen po yi //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te // su zhig rtsi rgyal grags pa chen po yi //
translated: And so on.🔽Whoever generates anger toward the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la zhe sdang skyed //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la zhe sdang skyed //
translated: those great kings of physicians,

original: de dag nyon mongs las kyang bde sbyin na//🔽de la bkur sti byed pa smos ci dgos //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs las kyang bde sbyin na// de la bkur sti byed pa smos ci dgos //
translated: will be given happiness even by the afflictions,

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽de ltar sems can gyi don gyi thabs gzhan med na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // de ltar sems can gyi don gyi thabs gzhan med na /
translated: so what need is there to mention the bodhisattvas?

original: 'dod chags las byung ba'i nyes pa yang nyes pa ma yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags las byung ba'i nyes pa yang nyes pa ma yin par bshad do //
translated: Thus, if there is no other means to benefit sentient beings, even the faults arising from desire are explained as not being faults.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Skill in Means Sūtra says:

original: smad 'tshong ma ltar don byed nas byang chub sems dpa' btang @94b snyoms rjes su byed de sems can de 'dor ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: smad 'tshong ma ltar don byed nas byang chub sems dpa' btang @94b snyoms rjes su byed de sems can de 'dor ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: Like a prostitute, he practices for his own purpose and then abandons that sentient being, acting indifferently toward the bodhisattva.

original: sa thob pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pa la 'di bsam par bya'i gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa thob pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pa la 'di bsam par bya'i gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: This is to be contemplated by one who has attained the bodhisattva stages and practices the six perfections, not by others.

original: de ltar zhar la 'ongs pa yin te re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar zhar la 'ongs pa yin te re zhig gzhag go //
translated: This digression is finished.

original: de'i phyir zhe sdang skabs dbye bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhe sdang skabs dbye bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, do not open the door to anger.

original: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang bka' stsal te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang bka' stsal te /
translated: The Catuhsataka also says,

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa'i ltung ba gnyis te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa'i ltung ba gnyis te /
translated: Sariputra, there are two downfalls of bodhisattvas that entail a grave offense.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: zhe sdang dang ldan pa dang / gti mug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang ldan pa dang / gti mug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the one associated with anger and the one associated with delusion.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /

original: sh'a ri'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' dang pos thog ma'i ltung ba sde bcu las lci ba rnams bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' dang pos thog ma'i ltung ba sde bcu las lci ba rnams bshags par bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra, the first type of bodhisattva should confess the most serious downfalls from the ten categories.

original: ltung ba yod pa sde lnga las lci ba rnams bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba yod pa sde lnga las lci ba rnams bshags par bya'o //
translated: He should confess the most serious downfalls from the five categories of downfalls.

original: sh'a ri'i bu bud med kyi lag nas 'dzin pa dang / mig gis blta ba dang / gnod sems kyang ltung ba ste gang zag gcig gam gnyis la yang bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu bud med kyi lag nas 'dzin pa dang / mig gis blta ba dang / gnod sems kyang ltung ba ste gang zag gcig gam gnyis la yang bshags par bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra, holding the hand of a woman, looking at her with the eyes, and malice are downfalls that should be confessed to one or two people.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mtshams med pa lnga dang dan pa'i ltung ba dang / bud mang las ltung ba byung ba dang lag pa las ltung ba byung ba dang khye'u las ltung ba byung ba dang / mchod rten las ltung ba byung ba dang / dge 'dun las ltung ba byung ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mtshams med pa lnga dang dan pa'i ltung ba dang / bud mang las ltung ba byung ba dang lag pa las ltung ba byung ba dang khye'u las ltung ba byung ba dang / mchod rten las ltung ba byung ba dang / dge 'dun las ltung ba byung ba dang /
translated: Bodhisattvas who have the five heinous actions, downfalls that are like the heinous actions, downfalls from sexual activity, downfalls from hand-to-hand combat, downfalls from children, downfalls from stūpas, and downfalls from the saṅgha

original: de las gzhan pa'i ltung ba lci ba rnams ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sum cu rtsa lnga la gcig pos nyin mtshan du ltung ba lci ba rnams bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ltung ba lci ba rnams ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sum cu rtsa lnga la gcig pos nyin mtshan du ltung ba lci ba rnams bshags par bya'o //

original: de la ltung ba bshags pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ltung ba bshags pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The confession of offenses is as follows:

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o //

analyzed: rin chen pad mos rnam par gnon pa la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ji snyed bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag bdag la dgongs su gsol //🔽gang bdag gis skye ba 'di dang skye ba gzhan dag thog ma ma mchis pa'i skye ba nas 'khor bar 'khor ba na /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ji snyed bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag bdag la dgongs su gsol // gang bdag gis skye ba 'di dang skye ba gzhan dag thog ma ma mchis pa'i skye ba nas 'khor bar 'khor ba na /
translated: All the Tathāgatas, Arhats, and Perfectly Awakened Ones who are present, living, and teaching in all the world systems of the ten directions, may those Blessed Buddhas please consider me.🔽Whatever bad actions I have done,🔽encouraged others to do, or rejoiced in, from beginningless lifetimes cycling in samsara up to this present life,

original: sdig pa'i las bgyis pa dang / bgyid du stsal ba dang / bgyid pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / mchod rten gyi dang dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi nor phrogs pa dang / 'phrog tu stsal ba dang 'phrog pa la rjes su yi rang bar gyur ba dang /
