analyzed: sdig pa'i las bgyis pa dang / bgyid du stsal ba dang / bgyid pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / mchod rten gyi dang dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi nor phrogs pa dang / 'phrog tu stsal ba dang 'phrog pa la rjes su yi rang bar gyur ba dang /
translated: such as stealing the property of the Three Jewels, the property of the Saṅgha of the four directions, or encouraging others to steal or rejoicing in such acts,

original: mtshams ma mchis pa'i las bgyis pa dang bgyid du stsal ba dang bgyid pa la rjes su yi rang bar gyur pa dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam bzung ste spyod pa dang spyod du stsal ba dang rjes su yi rang bar gyur ba dang /
analyzed: mtshams ma mchis pa'i las bgyis pa dang bgyid du stsal ba dang bgyid pa la rjes su yi rang bar gyur pa dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam bzung ste spyod pa dang spyod du stsal ba dang rjes su yi rang bar gyur ba dang /
translated: I have engaged in the ten unwholesome courses of action, have caused others to do so, and have rejoiced in those acts.

original: las kyi sgrib pa gang gis bsgribs nas sems can dmyal @95b bar mchi ba'am /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa gang gis bsgribs nas sems can dmyal @95b bar mchi ba'am /
translated: Whatever karmic obscurations I have that would cause me to go to the hells,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang gshin rje'i yul du mchi ba'am /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang gshin rje'i yul du mchi ba'am /
translated: to the realm of hungry ghosts,

original: yul mtha' 'khor gyi kla klo rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yul mtha' 'khor gyi kla klo rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: to be born in the borderlands as a barbarian,

original: lha tshe ring por skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: lha tshe ring por skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: to be born as a long-lived god,

original: dbang po ma tshang bar 'gyur ba dang / log par lta ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba la mnyes par mi bgyid pa'i las kyi sgrib pa de dag thams cad ye shes su gyur pa /
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang bar 'gyur ba dang / log par lta ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba la mnyes par mi bgyid pa'i las kyi sgrib pa de dag thams cad ye shes su gyur pa /
translated: to have incomplete faculties, to hold wrong views, and to not please the buddhas when they appear—all those karmic obscurations I confess with a remorseful attitude.

original: spyan du gyur pa dpang du gyur pa tshad mar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mkhyen cing gzigs pa de dag gi spyan sngar so sor bshags so //
analyzed: spyan du gyur pa dpang du gyur pa tshad mar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mkhyen cing gzigs pa de dag gi spyan sngar so sor bshags so //
translated: In the presence of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who are witnesses, who are the knowers, who are the seers, who are the expounders, who are the Tathāgatas, who are the Arhats, who are the Perfectly Enlightened Ones, I confess each and every one of my vile actions.

original: mthol lo // mi 'chab bo //
analyzed: mthol lo // mi 'chab bo //
translated: I reveal them, I do not conceal them.

original: slan chad kyang sdom par bgyi'o //
analyzed: slan chad kyang sdom par bgyi'o //
translated: Henceforth, I restrain myself.🔽May those Blessed Buddhas consider me.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag bdag la dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag bdag la dgongs su gsol //
translated: Whatever vile actions I have done,🔽and whatever I have ordered to be done,🔽and whatever I have applauded when done by others,🔽in this lifetime or other lifetimes,

original: gang bdag gis skye ba 'di dang skye ba gzhan dang thog ma ma mchis pa'i skye ba nas 'khor bar 'khor ba'i tshe /
analyzed: gang bdag gis skye ba 'di dang skye ba gzhan dang thog ma ma mchis pa'i skye ba nas 'khor bar 'khor ba'i tshe /
translated: since beginningless lifetimes circling in cyclic existence,

original: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa la zan chang cig tsam sbyin pa stsal ba dang / tshul khrims bsrungs par gyur pa dang ; gang bdag gis tshangs par spyad par gnas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / gang bdag gis sems can yongs su smin par bgyis pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang gang bdag gis byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa la zan chang cig tsam sbyin pa stsal ba dang / tshul khrims bsrungs par gyur pa dang ; gang bdag gis tshangs par spyad par gnas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / gang bdag gis sems can yongs su smin par bgyis pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang gang bdag gis byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: Even if I have given a single meal to someone in the animal realm, or if I have observed moral discipline, or if I have planted roots of virtue by abiding in pure conduct, or if I have planted roots of virtue by bringing sentient beings to maturity, or if I have planted roots of virtue through the thought of awakening,

original: gang bdag gis bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus /
analyzed: gang bdag gis bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus /
translated: or if I have planted roots of virtue through unsurpassed wisdom, I gather all of those together.

original: gcig tu spungs bcal te /
analyzed: gcig tu spungs bcal te /
translated: I gather them together,

original: mngon par bsdus nas /
analyzed: mngon par bsdus nas /
translated: I collect them,

original: bla ma'i yang bla ma bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i yang bla ma bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o //
translated: and I dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, which is the guru’s unsurpassed guru.

original: ji ltar 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis yongs su bsngos pa dang / ji ltar ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su bsngo ba de bzhin du bdag gis kyang yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis yongs su bsngos pa dang / ji ltar ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su bsngo ba de bzhin du bdag gis kyang yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: Just as the Blessed Buddhas of the past have dedicated, just as the Blessed Buddhas of the future will dedicate, just as the Blessed Buddhas of the present are dedicating, in the same way I dedicate.

original: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags so //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags so //
translated: I confess each and every nonvirtue.

original: bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: I rejoice in all virtue.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba gdab bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba gdab bo //
translated: I request the Buddhas to teach.🔽I request them not to pass into nirvāṇa.🔽I dedicate all my sources of good🔽to the attainment of enlightenment.🔽To all the supreme humans, the victorious ones,🔽who have come in the past, who will come in the future,

original: bdag bla na med pa'i ye shes su gyur cig / mi mchog rgyal ba gang dag da ltar bzhugs pa dang // gang dag 'das pa dag dang de bzhin gang ma byon //
analyzed: bdag bla na med pa'i ye shes su gyur cig / mi mchog rgyal ba gang dag da ltar bzhugs pa dang // gang dag 'das pa dag dang de bzhin gang ma byon //
translated: and who are present now,

original: yon tan bsngags pa mtha' yas rgya mtsho 'dra kun la //
analyzed: yon tan bsngags pa mtha' yas rgya mtsho 'dra kun la //
translated: infinite oceans of excellent qualities,

original: @96a * // thal mo sbyar ba bgyis te skyabs su nye bar mchi //
analyzed: @96a * // thal mo sbyar ba bgyis te skyabs su nye bar mchi //
translated: I pay homage with palms joined.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gang dag snying rje'i stobs ldan zhing //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gang dag snying rje'i stobs ldan zhing //
translated: The bodhisattvas who have the power of compassion,

original: dpa' bo sems can rnams la phan phyir spyod byed pa //
analyzed: dpa' bo sems can rnams la phan phyir spyod byed pa //
translated: the heroes who practice for the benefit of beings,

original: de dag rnams kyis skyabs med sdig byed bdag la skyobs //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyis skyabs med sdig byed bdag la skyobs //
translated: may they protect me, a sinner without protection.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rnams la bdag skyabs mchi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rnams la bdag skyabs mchi /
translated: I go for refuge to those bodhisattvas.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'/
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'/
translated: In this way, Shariputra,

original: sangs rgyas sum cu so lnga 'di dag la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i yid la byed pas sdig pa thams cad rnam par dag par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sum cu so lnga 'di dag la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i yid la byed pas sdig pa thams cad rnam par dag par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva should purify all his evil deeds by attending to all the tathagatas, beginning with these thirty-five buddhas.

original: de de ltar sdig pa thams cad rnam par dag pas /
analyzed: de de ltar sdig pa thams cad rnam par dag pas /
translated: In this way, having purified all his evil deeds,

original: sems can rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams zhal nye bar ston to //
analyzed: sems can rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams zhal nye bar ston to //
translated: the buddhas, the blessed ones, show him their faces in order to liberate beings.

original: de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo 'khrul pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir tshig 'bru sna tshogs rnam par nye bar ston kyang chos kyi dbyings las mi g-yo'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo 'khrul pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir tshig 'bru sna tshogs rnam par nye bar ston kyang chos kyi dbyings las mi g-yo'o // de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, the Buddhas, in order to ripen the childish ordinary beings who are deluded, display various words, but do not move from the dharma-dhātu.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyin mtshan du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi mtshan 'dzin pa dang yongs su brjod pa dang phung po gsum pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs klog pas ltung ba 'gyod pa las byung ba dang / ting nge 'dzin kyang thob pa gang yin pa de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa thams cad kyis ltung ba 'gyod pa'i gnas rnam par sbyang bar mi nus so zhes gsungs so //🔽rnam par sun 'byin pa kun du spyod pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyin mtshan du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi mtshan 'dzin pa dang yongs su brjod pa dang phung po gsum pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs klog pas ltung ba 'gyod pa las byung ba dang / ting nge 'dzin kyang thob pa gang yin pa de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa thams cad kyis ltung ba 'gyod pa'i gnas rnam par sbyang bar mi nus so zhes gsungs so // rnam par sun 'byin pa kun du spyod pa bshad zin to //
translated: The bodhisattva who holds the names of those Buddha Bhagavats day and night, recites the Tripiṭaka Dharma, and attains meditative concentration, that is, the arising of regret for downfalls, is not able to purify the basis of regret for downfalls by all the vehicles of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽The practice of remorse has been explained.

original: gnyen po kun du spyod pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyen po kun du spyod pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The practice of the antidote should be explained.

original: de la mdo sde zab mo la brten pas kyang sdig pa zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la mdo sde zab mo la brten pas kyang sdig pa zad par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, by relying on the profound sutras, sins are extinguished.🔽The Diamond Cutter Sutra states:

original: rdo rje gcod pa las ji skad du rab 'byor rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang dag 'di lta bu'i mdo sde tshig 'di dag len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa de dag ni mnar bar 'gyur shin tu mnar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje gcod pa las ji skad du rab 'byor rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang dag 'di lta bu'i mdo sde tshig 'di dag len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa de dag ni mnar bar 'gyur shin tu mnar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhuti, any sons of good lineage or daughters of good lineage who take up, hold, read, and master these words of such a sutra will be tormented, will be greatly tormented.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar sems can de dag gi tshe rabs snga ma'i mi dge ba'i las ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa byas pa gang dag yin pa'i tshe rabs snga ma'i mi dge ba'i las de dag tshe 'di la mnar bas 'byang bar 'gyur
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar sems can de dag gi tshe rabs snga ma'i mi dge ba'i las ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa byas pa gang dag yin pa'i tshe rabs snga ma'i mi dge ba'i las de dag tshe 'di la mnar bas 'byang bar 'gyur
translated: Subhuti, it is because those beings, in this life, will purify the nonvirtuous actions of previous lives that would lead to rebirth in the lower realms.

original: te / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: te / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: And they will attain the enlightenment of buddhahood.

original: stong pa nyid la mos pas kyang sdig pa dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mos pas kyang sdig pa dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, by being devoted to emptiness, sins are purified.

original: de @96b bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod kyi mdo las gsungs pa /🔽'od srungs gang gis pha yang yin la /
analyzed: de @96b bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod kyi mdo las gsungs pa / 'od srungs gang gis pha yang yin la /
translated: The Tathagata's Treasury Sutra says:

original: rang sangs rgyas kyang yin pa de srog bcad na de'i srog gcod pa'i nang nas ma rungs pa'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyang yin pa de srog bcad na de'i srog gcod pa'i nang nas ma rungs pa'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: KaSyapa, if someone kills his father who is also a Solitary Sage, that is the worst of all killings.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor rku ba 'di ni ma byin par len pa'i nang na ma rungs pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor rku ba 'di ni ma byin par len pa'i nang na ma rungs pa'o //
translated: KaSyapa, if someone steals the property of the Three Jewels, that is the worst of all thefts.

original: 'di lta ste ma yang yin la dgra bcom ma yang yin pa de la log par spyad pa 'di ni 'dod pa la log par spyod pa rnams kyi nang na ma rungs pa'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste ma yang yin la dgra bcom ma yang yin pa de la log par spyad pa 'di ni 'dod pa la log par spyod pa rnams kyi nang na ma rungs pa'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: KaSyapa, if someone engages in sexual misconduct with his mother who is also an arhat, that is the worst of all sexual misconduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa 'di ni brdzun du smra ba'i nang na ma rungs pa'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa 'di ni brdzun du smra ba'i nang na ma rungs pa'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: KaSyapa, if someone denigrates the Tathagata, that is the worst of all lies.

original: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la mi snyan pa brjod pa 'di ni phra ma'i nang na ma rungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la mi snyan pa brjod pa 'di ni phra ma'i nang na ma rungs pa'o //
translated: KaSyapa, if someone speaks unpleasantly about the noble Sangha, that is the worst of all divisive speech.

original: 'di lta ste 'phags pa rnams la gnod pa 'di ni tshig rtsub po'i nang na ma rungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'phags pa rnams la gnod pa 'di ni tshig rtsub po'i nang na ma rungs pa'o //
translated: For example, among harsh words, the worst is to harm the noble ones.

original: 'di lta ste chos 'dod pa rnams rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa 'di ni tshig kyal pa'i nang na ma rungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos 'dod pa rnams rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa 'di ni tshig kyal pa'i nang na ma rungs pa'o //
translated: For example, among idle chatter, the worst is to distract those who desire the Dharma.

original: 'di lta ste mtshams med pa byed par shom pa 'di ni gnod sems kyi nang na ma rungs pa'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mtshams med pa byed par shom pa 'di ni gnod sems kyi nang na ma rungs pa'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: For example, among ill will, the worst is to plan to commit the crimes with immediate retribution.

original: yang dag par song ba rnams kyi rnyed pa 'phrog pa'i sems 'di ni brnab sems kyi nang na ma rungs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par song ba rnams kyi rnyed pa 'phrog pa'i sems 'di ni brnab sems kyi nang na ma rungs pa'o //
translated: For example, among covetousness, the worst is the thought to steal the possessions of those who have gone to the right path.

original: 'di lta ste lta bas gzings pa 'di ni log par lta ba'i nang na ma rungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste lta bas gzings pa 'di ni log par lta ba'i nang na ma rungs pa ste /
translated: For example, among wrong views, the worst is to be bound by views.

original: 'od srungs 'di ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di ni kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di ni kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, these are the ten paths of unwholesome action that are grave.

original: 'od srungs gal te sems can gcig cig mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa 'di dag dang ldan par gyur la /
analyzed: 'od srungs gal te sems can gcig cig mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa 'di dag dang ldan par gyur la /
translated: Kāśyapa, if a single sentient being were to possess these great misdeeds of the ten unwholesome actions,

original: da yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu dang rkyen dang ldan pa'i chos ston pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: da yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu dang rkyen dang ldan pa'i chos ston pa la 'jug ste /
translated: and if the Tathāgata were to teach the Dharma that engages with causes and conditions,

original: 'di la bdag gam /
analyzed: 'di la bdag gam /
translated: thinking, “In this there is no self,

original: sems can nam /🔽srog gam / gang zag gam /
analyzed: sems can nam / srog gam / gang zag gam /
translated: no sentient being,🔽no life-force, no person,

original: gang byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang byed pa'am /
translated: no agent,

original: gang myong ba ni gang yang med do snyam nas /
analyzed: gang myong ba ni gang yang med do snyam nas /
translated: and no experiencer,”

original: chos thams cad ni byas pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dus byas pa med pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos nyid la 'jug cing /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni byas pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dus byas pa med pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos nyid la 'jug cing /
translated: and if they were to enter into the nature of all phenomena, which is uncreated, unconditioned, illusory, free from afflictions, and naturally luminous,

original: chos thams cad gdod ma nas dag par yid ches te mos na /
analyzed: chos thams cad gdod ma nas dag par yid ches te mos na /
translated: and if they were to believe and have conviction that all phenomena are primordially pure,

original: sems can de dag ngan song du 'gro bar nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can de dag ngan song du 'gro bar nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: I would not say that those sentient beings would go to the lower realms.”

original: las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sutra of the Purification of Karma says:

original: 'jam dpal gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' @97a * //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' @97a * //
translated: Manjusri, moreover, a bodhisattva

original: gang gis ltung ba la ltung ba ma yin par mthong ba dang 'dul ba ma yin pa la 'dul bar mthong ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la rnam par byang bar mthong ba dang / 'khor ba'i khams la mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mthong ba des las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa thob po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis ltung ba la ltung ba ma yin par mthong ba dang 'dul ba ma yin pa la 'dul bar mthong ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la rnam par byang bar mthong ba dang / 'khor ba'i khams la mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mthong ba des las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa thob po zhes gsungs so //
translated: who sees a downfall as not a downfall, who sees what is not the Vinaya as the Vinaya, who sees the afflictions as purification, and who sees the realm of cyclic existence as the expanse of nirvana attains the purification of karmic obscurations.

original: dam tshig gsum gyi rgyal po las kyang /
analyzed: dam tshig gsum gyi rgyal po las kyang /
translated: The King of Tantras of the Three Sacred Commitments also states:

original: sdig pa'i gnyen po kun du spyad par gsungs te /
analyzed: sdig pa'i gnyen po kun du spyad par gsungs te /
translated: The antidote to misdeeds is to engage in the following.

original: mig btsums la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la dmigs pa'i sems kyis yi ge brgya pa lan stong phrag brgyad bzlas brjod byas na /
analyzed: mig btsums la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la dmigs pa'i sems kyis yi ge brgya pa lan stong phrag brgyad bzlas brjod byas na /
translated: Close your eyes and recite the hundred-syllable mantra eight thousand times with a mind focused on the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: mig btsums bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mig btsums bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: While your eyes are closed, you will see the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: sdig pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be free from evil.

original: yang na mchod rten la skor ba byed cing stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mchod rten la skor ba byed cing stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, one should circumambulate a stūpa, reciting the mantra eight thousand times.

original: sku gzugs dang dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam gang yang rung ba zhig mdun du bzhag nas kyang bskor zhing lan stong bzlas par bya ste cho ga ni 'di nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sku gzugs dang dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam gang yang rung ba zhig mdun du bzhag nas kyang bskor zhing lan stong bzlas par bya ste cho ga ni 'di nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Placing in front of oneself an image or a volume of the scriptures, one should circumambulate it and recite the mantra one thousand times. The rite is the same.

original: skul byed ma'i gzungs las kyang /
analyzed: skul byed ma'i gzungs las kyang /
translated: The Dhāraṇī of Cundā also says:

original: ji srid du sdig pa byad pa'i mtshan ma mthong ba de srid du bzlas brjod bya ste /
analyzed: ji srid du sdig pa byad pa'i mtshan ma mthong ba de srid du bzlas brjod bya ste /
translated: “As long as one sees the signs of the destruction of evil deeds, one should recite the mantra.

original: rmi lam na zas ngan pa skyug pa dang / zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa 'thungs pa dang / skyugs pa dang / nyi ma dang zla ba mthong ba dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / me 'bar ba dang ma he dang mi nag po thub pa dang /
analyzed: rmi lam na zas ngan pa skyug pa dang / zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa 'thungs pa dang / skyugs pa dang / nyi ma dang zla ba mthong ba dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / me 'bar ba dang ma he dang mi nag po thub pa dang /
translated: In dreams, one vomits bad food, drinks curd, milk, and so on, vomits, sees the sun and moon, flies in the sky, subdues a blazing fire, a buffalo, and a black man,

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma'i dge 'dun mthong ba dang / 'o ma 'byung ba'i shing dang glang po dang khyu mchog dang / ri dang seng ge'i khri dang khang bzangs kyi steng du 'dzeg pa dang / chos nyan pa rmis na sdig pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma'i dge 'dun mthong ba dang / 'o ma 'byung ba'i shing dang glang po dang khyu mchog dang / ri dang seng ge'i khri dang khang bzangs kyi steng du 'dzeg pa dang / chos nyan pa rmis na sdig pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one sees a community of monks and nuns, or a tree that produces milk, or an elephant or bull, or ascends a mountain, lion throne, or palace, or hears the Dharma, one is free from evil.

original: sdig pa byang bar shes par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdig pa byang bar shes par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should know that evil is purified.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzungs kyi le'u las kyang gnyen po kun du spyod par gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzungs kyi le'u las kyang gnyen po kun du spyod par gsungs te /
translated: The chapter on dhāraṇīs in the Tathāgataguhya Sūtra also teaches the practice of antidotes:

original: dper na mi zhig ngan skyugs kyis reg pa las legs par bkrus te khrus byas nas spos kyis byugs na /
analyzed: dper na mi zhig ngan skyugs kyis reg pa las legs par bkrus te khrus byas nas spos kyis byugs na /
translated: For example, if a person is touched by vomit, he should wash it off well, bathe, and apply perfume.

original: de'i dri nga ba med cing bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dri nga ba med cing bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bad smell will be gone and removed.

original: de bzhin du mtshams med pa lnga byed pa'i sdig pa de byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshams med pa lnga byed pa'i sdig pa de byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the evil of one who has committed the five heinous actions is purified.

original: gang yang mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan par gyur la /
analyzed: gang yang mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan par gyur la /
translated: And also, one who possesses the paths of the ten nonvirtues

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa rnyed nas de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sku gzugs byed na de'i sdig pa yang mi mngon par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa rnyed nas de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sku gzugs byed na de'i sdig pa yang mi mngon par 'gyur /
translated: If one has gained faith in the Tathagata and makes an image of that Tathagata, even his sin will not become manifest.

original: bye brag tu ni byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa @97b dang ; bye brag tu ni khyim gyi gnas nas 'byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sdig pa byang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bye brag tu ni byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa @97b dang ; bye brag tu ni khyim gyi gnas nas 'byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sdig pa byang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: In particular, if one has the thought of enlightenment, and in particular if one has gone forth from the home life and has morality, his sin will be purified.

original: me tog brtsegs pa'i gzungs las kyang gsungs te /🔽seng ge rnam par rtse ba gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa lo gcig gam lo brgya'am lo stong yang rung ste /
analyzed: me tog brtsegs pa'i gzungs las kyang gsungs te / seng ge rnam par rtse ba gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa lo gcig gam lo brgya'am lo stong yang rung ste /
translated: The Flower-Peak Scripture also says,🔽If one were to honor with all the necessities of happiness for one year, or for a hundred years, or for a thousand years, a Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened Buddha,

original: bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / byang chub kyi sems kyis yang dag par zin pa gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / byang chub kyi sems kyis yang dag par zin pa gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i phyir /
translated: and if another, motivated by the thought of enlightenment, were to make an offering to the Tathagata for the sake of worship,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten la me tog 'ga' 'bul lam chu snyim pa gang tsam 'thor ram /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten la me tog 'ga' 'bul lam chu snyim pa gang tsam 'thor ram /
translated: Or if they offer a few flowers to a stūpa of a Tathāgata who has passed into nirvāṇa, or sprinkle it with a handful of water,

original: byug pa'i thig le 'dri 'am /🔽me tog gi nyal nyil 'phyag gam /
analyzed: byug pa'i thig le 'dri 'am / me tog gi nyal nyil 'phyag gam /
translated: or sweep the area around it,

original: byug pa 'bul lam /
analyzed: byug pa 'bul lam /
translated: or offer perfume,

original: me tog 'bul lam /
analyzed: me tog 'bul lam /
translated: or offer flowers,

original: bdug spos 'bul lam /
analyzed: bdug spos 'bul lam /
translated: or offer incense,

original: mar me 'bul te phul nas dga' ba'i sems kyis gom pa'i gar stabs 'ga' bor te /
analyzed: mar me 'bul te phul nas dga' ba'i sems kyis gom pa'i gar stabs 'ga' bor te /
translated: or offer lamps, and then, with a happy mind, take a few steps,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes smra ba de dag ni /🔽seng ge rnam par rtse ba bskal par ram bskal pa brgya'am bskal pa stong du'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes smra ba de dag ni / seng ge rnam par rtse ba bskal par ram bskal pa brgya'am bskal pa stong du'am /
translated: and say, ‘Homage to that Blessed One, the Buddha!’🔽Then, Siṃha, Vi krānta, Vikrāmiṇ, Vikrāntagāmin, Vikrāntadeva, Vikrāntatejas, Vikrāntabāhu, and Vikrāntasaṃnāha,

original: bskal pa brgya phrag stong du yang ngan 'gro log par ltung bar 'gyur ba de'i gnas med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bskal pa brgya phrag stong du yang ngan 'gro log par ltung bar 'gyur ba de'i gnas med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: for them there is no chance, for an eon or a hundred eons or a thousand eons or a hundred thousand eons, of falling into the lower realms.

original: sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po'i mdo las kyang ;
analyzed: sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po'i mdo las kyang ;
translated: And in the Sūtra on the King of Medicines, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance,🔽it says,

original: gang dag yang bslab pa'i gzhi lnga po dag 'dzin pa dang / gang dag bslab pa'i gzhi bcu po dag 'dzin pa dang / gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa bslab pa'i gzhi bzhi brgya po dag 'dzin pa dang / khyim gyi gnas nas byung ba'i dge slong gang dag bslab pa'i gzhi nyis brgya lnga bcu po dag 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: gang dag yang bslab pa'i gzhi lnga po dag 'dzin pa dang / gang dag bslab pa'i gzhi bcu po dag 'dzin pa dang / gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa bslab pa'i gzhi bzhi brgya po dag 'dzin pa dang / khyim gyi gnas nas byung ba'i dge slong gang dag bslab pa'i gzhi nyis brgya lnga bcu po dag 'dzin pa dang /
translated: those who uphold the five basic precepts, those who uphold the ten basic precepts, those who uphold the four hundred precepts of the bodhisattva vow,🔽those who uphold the two hundred and fifty precepts of the fully ordained monks,

original: dge slong ma gang dag bslab pa'i gzhi lnga brgya po dag 'dzin pa ste /🔽gang dag ji ltar yongs su bzung ba'i bslab pa'i sdom pa de dag gi nang nas /
analyzed: dge slong ma gang dag bslab pa'i gzhi lnga brgya po dag 'dzin pa ste / gang dag ji ltar yongs su bzung ba'i bslab pa'i sdom pa de dag gi nang nas /
translated: and those who uphold the five hundred precepts of the fully ordained nuns,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi gang yang rung ba zhig las nyams par gyur te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi gang yang rung ba zhig las nyams par gyur te /
translated: if any of them should transgress any of the precepts they have taken,

original: ngan 'gro ngan song gis 'jigs skrag pa de dag bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od de la mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed na /
analyzed: ngan 'gro ngan song gis 'jigs skrag pa de dag bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od de la mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed na /
translated: and if they are terrified of the lower realms, the miserable destinies, and if they make various kinds of offerings to the blessed Thus-Gone One, the medicine buddha, the beryl light,

original: de dag la ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal med par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they are free from the sufferings of the three lower realms.

original: bud med gang la la bu btsa' ba'i dus na sdug bsngal ma rungs pa drag po byung ba des /
analyzed: bud med gang la la bu btsa' ba'i dus na sdug bsngal ma rungs pa drag po byung ba des /
translated: If a woman is suffering severe pain when giving birth,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa @98a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa @98a * //
translated: if she makes offerings to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata,🔽the Medicine Buddha, King of Constellations,

original: sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od de la mchod na de myur du yongs su thar bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od de la mchod na de myur du yongs su thar bar 'gyur /
translated: she will be quickly freed from it.

original: bu yang yan lag yongs su tshang bar btsa' zhing gzugs bzang ba dang mdzes pa dang / blta na sdug pa dang / dbang po rno ba dang / blo dang ldan pa dang / nad med cing gnod pa nyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu yang yan lag yongs su tshang bar btsa' zhing gzugs bzang ba dang mdzes pa dang / blta na sdug pa dang / dbang po rno ba dang / blo dang ldan pa dang / nad med cing gnod pa nyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Her child will be born with complete limbs, with a good body, beautiful, pleasing to look at, with sharp faculties, intelligent, healthy, and with few difficulties.

original: de la yi ma yin pas mdangs 'phrogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: de la yi ma yin pas mdangs 'phrogs par mi nus so //
translated: No one will be able to steal its radiance.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo gang gi phyir nga bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od de'i mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gang gi phyir nga bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od de'i mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed na /
translated: Ānanda, if you make various offerings to that Bhagavān, the Tathāgata King of the Golden-Hued Medicine,

original: de dag la ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal med par shes par bya'o //
translated: you should know that they will not have the suffering of the three lower realms.

original: yon tan brjod par khyod dad dam yid ches sam /
analyzed: yon tan brjod par khyod dad dam yid ches sam /
translated: Do you have faith in the description of his qualities? Do you believe it?

original: yang na khyod sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul zab mo 'di la yid gnyis sam som nyi'am /🔽the tshom za ba med dam de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to ;
analyzed: yang na khyod sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul zab mo 'di la yid gnyis sam som nyi'am / the tshom za ba med dam de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to ;
translated: Or do you have any doubt, uncertainty, or skepticism about this profound domain of activity of the buddhas?”

original: / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das bdag de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos rnams la yid gnyis sam som nyi'am the tshom 'tshal ba ma lags so //
analyzed: / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das bdag de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos rnams la yid gnyis sam som nyi'am the tshom 'tshal ba ma lags so //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said to the Bhagavān, “Honored Bhagavān, I do not have any doubt, uncertainty, or skepticism about the Dharma taught by the Tathāgata.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' ba'i slad du'o //
translated: Because the Tathāgatas have no impure physical, verbal, or mental activity.

original: bcom ldan 'das gdugs dang dgung zla 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba 'di gnyis ni dog sa la ltung yang gda'/
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gdugs dang dgung zla 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba 'di gnyis ni dog sa la ltung yang gda'/
translated: Blessed One, these two, the sun and moon, so powerful and majestic, might fall to the ground;

original: ri'i rgyal po ri rab ni gnas nas 'pho yang gda'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bka' ni gzhan du mi 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab ni gnas nas 'pho yang gda'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bka' ni gzhan du mi 'gyur lags so //
translated: and Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, might move from its base, but the words of the Buddhas could never be otherwise.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das de ltar lags kyis kyang /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das de ltar lags kyis kyang /
translated: Blessed One, even so,

original: sems can dad pa'i dbang po dang bral ba dag mchis te /
analyzed: sems can dad pa'i dbang po dang bral ba dag mchis te /
translated: there are beings who are devoid of the faculty of faith.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul 'di thos na de dag 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul 'di thos na de dag 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
translated: When they hear this domain of activity of the Buddhas, they will think:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan 'di dran pa tsam gyis ji ltar shin tu yon tan dang phan yon du 'gyur snyam nas de dag mi dad cing yid mi ches te spong bas yun ring por gnod pa dang mi sman pa dang yid mi bde ba dang rnam par
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan 'di dran pa tsam gyis ji ltar shin tu yon tan dang phan yon du 'gyur snyam nas de dag mi dad cing yid mi ches te spong bas yun ring por gnod pa dang mi sman pa dang yid mi bde ba dang rnam par
translated: Thinking, “By merely recalling the name of the Thus-Gone One, how could there be such great qualities and benefits?” they will lack faith and confidence and will reject it. For a long time, they will be harmed, be unbeneficial, be unhappy, and experience🔽

original: ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not believe or trust in this, and by rejecting it they will for a long time be harmed, be unbenefited, be unhappy, and fall into the lower realms.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mtshan su'i rna lam du grag par gyur pa de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mtshan su'i rna lam du grag par gyur pa de /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Ānanda, it is impossible, there is no chance, that someone who has heard the name of that thus-gone one

original: ngan 'gro ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni gnas med de go skabs @98b ma yin no //
analyzed: ngan 'gro ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni gnas med de go skabs @98b ma yin no //
translated: will go to the lower realms.

original: kun dga' bo sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul ni yid ches par dka'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul ni yid ches par dka'o //
translated: Ānanda, the domain of the buddhas is difficult to believe in.

original: kun dga' bo khyod dad cing yid ches par gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod dad cing yid ches par gyur pa de ni /
translated: Ānanda, that you have faith and trust

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu yin par blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu yin par blta'o //
translated: is due to the power of the thus-gone ones.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams ma gtogs par 'di nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams ma gtogs par 'di nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Except for bodhisattva great beings who are impeded by one birth, this is not the case for all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: yang de nyid las dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang dag yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i bsnyen gnas la nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: yang de nyid las dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang dag yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i bsnyen gnas la nye bar gnas te /
translated: Moreover, that same text says, “Those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who have faith, who practice the observance of the eight [precepts]

original: lo gcig gam zla ba gsum du bslab pa'i gzhi rnams 'dzin cing /
analyzed: lo gcig gam zla ba gsum du bslab pa'i gzhi rnams 'dzin cing /
translated: and who maintain the bases of training for one year or three months,

original: gad dag gi bsam pa 'di lta bus /
analyzed: gad dag gi bsam pa 'di lta bus /
translated: and who have the following thought:

original: bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nub phyogs gang na de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dpag med bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du skye bar shog shig ces smon lam de lta bu btab pa dag las /
analyzed: bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nub phyogs gang na de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dpag med bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du skye bar shog shig ces smon lam de lta bu btab pa dag las /
translated: ‘By these roots of virtue of mine, may I be born in the western buddha-field of Sukhāvatī, where the Tathāgata Amitāyus dwells,’ and who make such a prayer,

original: gang dag gis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'u rya'i 'od de'i mtshan thos par gyur pa de dag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe byang chub sems dpa' brgyad rdzu 'phrul gyis lhags nas lam ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag gis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'u rya'i 'od de'i mtshan thos par gyur pa de dag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe byang chub sems dpa' brgyad rdzu 'phrul gyis lhags nas lam ston par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who hear the name of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata King of Healing, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance, when they are dying, eight bodhisattvas will miraculously appear and show them the path.

original: de dag der padma tshon kha dog sna tshogs rnams las rdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag der padma tshon kha dog sna tshogs rnams las rdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be reborn miraculously from various colored lotuses.

original: gang la la dag lha'i 'jig rten du skya bar 'gyur ba de dag ni /
analyzed: gang la la dag lha'i 'jig rten du skya bar 'gyur ba de dag ni /
translated: Some will be reborn in the world of the gods.

original: der skyes nas sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de zad par mi 'gyur zhing ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der skyes nas sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de zad par mi 'gyur zhing ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Once born there, their previous roots of virtue will not be exhausted, and they will not go to the lower realms.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas kyang mi'i 'jig rten 'dir gling bzhi pa'i dbang phyug 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas kyang mi'i 'jig rten 'dir gling bzhi pa'i dbang phyug 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
translated: After they die and transmigrate from there, they will be reborn in this world of humans as universal monarchs, lords of the four continents.

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la 'god par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la 'god par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will establish many hundreds of thousands of millions of beings in the ten virtuous actions.

original: yang gzhan dag ni rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Others will be born in the great Sāla tree-like royal families,

original: bram ze shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag dang / khyim bdag shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag dang / nor dang 'bru dang mdzod dang bang ba mang po 'byor pa'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bram ze shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag dang / khyim bdag shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag dang / nor dang 'bru dang mdzod dang bang ba mang po 'byor pa'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: in the great Sāla tree-like Brahmin families, in the great Sāla tree-like business families, in families with great wealth, grain, treasures, and storehouses.

original: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa dang / g-yog phun sum tshogs pa dang dpa' ba dang rtul phod pa dang tshan po che chen po'i stobs kyi shugs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa dang / g-yog phun sum tshogs pa dang dpa' ba dang rtul phod pa dang tshan po che chen po'i stobs kyi shugs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have perfect bodies, perfect power, perfect retinues, and be brave, heroic, and strong as great champions.

original: bud med gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa de'i @99a * //
analyzed: bud med gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa de'i @99a * //
translated: Any woman who hears the name of that Tathāgata

original: mtshan thos shing bzung ba de'i bud med kyi dngos po de tha ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes gsungs so /🔽// / bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: mtshan thos shing bzung ba de'i bud med kyi dngos po de tha ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes gsungs so /🔽// / bam po brgyad pa /
translated: and holds it should know that she will have her last embodiment as a woman.”

original: 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa'i rgyan las kyang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa'i rgyan las kyang /
translated: The Ornament of the Qualities of the Buddha-field of Manjushri also says:

original: ye shes bla ma 'od kyi tog //
analyzed: ye shes bla ma 'od kyi tog //
translated: Jnanottara, Prabhaketu,

original: de bzhin smon lam blo gros dang // dbang po zhi dang 'jam dbyangs la //
analyzed: de bzhin smon lam blo gros dang // dbang po zhi dang 'jam dbyangs la //
translated: Pranidhanamati, Shantaindra, and Manjushri,

original: bdag ni gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag ni gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I respectfully bow to them all.

original: su zhig byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag gi ming 'dzin pa de bud med kyi dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: su zhig byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag gi ming 'dzin pa de bud med kyi dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Anyone who remembers the names of these bodhisattvas will not be reborn in a female body.

original: gnyen po kun tu spyad pa mngon par bstan zin to //
analyzed: gnyen po kun tu spyad pa mngon par bstan zin to //
translated: The practice of the antidote has been explained.

original: da ni nyes pa las bzlog pa'i stobs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni nyes pa las bzlog pa'i stobs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the power of turning away from faults will be explained.

original: 'phags pa sa'i snying po'i mdo las ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa'i snying po'i mdo las ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: As it is said in the noble Kshitigarbha-sutra:

original: srog gcod pa spong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa yin te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who gives up killing gives freedom from fear to all beings.

original: skrag par mi byed 'khrug par mi byed sku zing zhes 'gyur bar mi byed do //
analyzed: skrag par mi byed 'khrug par mi byed sku zing zhes 'gyur bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not frighten them, does not disturb them, and does not make their bodies tremble.

original: de dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa de dang srog gcod pa spong ba'i 'khor lo des sngon gyi mtha'i mu nas 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor lor zhugs shing 'khor ba'i chu ngos khyer nas /
analyzed: de dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa de dang srog gcod pa spong ba'i 'khor lo des sngon gyi mtha'i mu nas 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor lor zhugs shing 'khor ba'i chu ngos khyer nas /
translated: Through the maturation of that virtuous karma and through that wheel of abandoning killing, one will, from the point of beginningless samsara, enter the wheel of the five types of beings and be carried along on the surface of the water of samsara.

original: srog gcod pa'i rgyus lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi las kyi sgrib pa dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang chos kyi sgrib pa byas pa dang byed du bcug pa dang rjes su yi rang ba gang yin pa thams cad 'joms te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i rgyus lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi las kyi sgrib pa dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang chos kyi sgrib pa byas pa dang byed du bcug pa dang rjes su yi rang ba gang yin pa thams cad 'joms te /
translated: Through the cause of killing, all the karmic obscurations, afflictive obscurations, and obscurations to dharma that one has created or caused others to create with body, speech, and mind will be destroyed.

original: ma lus par rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du byed do //
analyzed: ma lus par rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du byed do //
translated: They will be completely destroyed so that they do not ripen.

original: de la rigs mthun pa'i lha dang mi rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rigs mthun pa'i lha dang mi rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods and humans who are of a similar type will be pleased.

original: nad med pa dang tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad med pa dang tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be free of illness and will have a long life.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ma byin par len pa spangs par gyur cing sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin la gzhan la 'gran pa med pa dang 'khrug pa med par rang gi🔽rnyed pas chog shes shing /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ma byin par len pa spangs par gyur cing sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin la gzhan la 'gran pa med pa dang 'khrug pa med par rang gi rnyed pas chog shes shing /
translated: Son of noble family, moreover, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who abandons taking what is not given for as long as he lives, who gives fearlessness to all sentient beings, who is without rivalry and conflict with others, who is content with his own wealth,

original: chos ma yin pa'i longs spyod mi 'dod de /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i longs spyod mi 'dod de /
translated: who does not desire wealth that is not in accordance with the Dharma,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des ma byin par len pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bar gyi las kyi sgrib pa 'joms so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des ma byin par len pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bar gyi las kyi sgrib pa 'joms so //
translated: by that root of merit destroys the karmic obscurations that arise from the cause of taking what is not given.

original: rab tu 'joms so //
analyzed: rab tu 'joms so //
translated: He utterly destroys them.

original: ma lus par rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du byed do //
analyzed: ma lus par rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du byed do //
translated: He makes them not ripen at all.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on, in the same way,

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyis rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi dge ba rnams 'joms par gsungs so //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyis rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi dge ba rnams 'joms par gsungs so //
translated: it is said that the ten virtuous actions destroy their opposites, the ten nonvirtuous actions.

original: de skad du zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And so too in the Candrapradīpa Sūtra:

original: gnod sems @99b spangs pas sdig pa zad par 'gyur ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnod sems @99b spangs pas sdig pa zad par 'gyur ba 'byung ste /
translated: Through abandoning malice, the force of the antidote, one’s evil is exhausted.

original: ji skad du //🔽'dir ni yang dag ma lags par //
analyzed: ji skad du // 'dir ni yang dag ma lags par //
translated: As it is said:🔽Here, the childish, with their false accusations,

original: byis pa rnams kyis mtshang brus dang // spyod pa dag ni bzod bgyi ste //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis mtshang brus dang // spyod pa dag ni bzod bgyi ste //
translated: and their conduct, are to be endured.

original: smod pa'ang 'dren pa dang du blang //
analyzed: smod pa'ang 'dren pa dang du blang //
translated: Even if they revile me, I will accept it.

original: byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la //
translated: The bodhisattva should think:🔽“I have generated malice toward others,

original: bdag gis gnod sems bskyed pa dang ; / sngon chad bdag gis sdig pa'i las //
analyzed: bdag gis gnod sems bskyed pa dang ; / sngon chad bdag gis sdig pa'i las //
translated: and I have previously done evil actions.

original: bgyis pa rnams ni sbyang bar bgyi //
analyzed: bgyis pa rnams ni sbyang bar bgyi //
translated: I will purify them.”

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: nyes pa las zlog pa'i stobs bshad zin to //
analyzed: nyes pa las zlog pa'i stobs bshad zin to //
translated: The force of turning away from faults has been explained.

original: rten gyi stobs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rten gyi stobs brjod par bya ste /
translated: The force of reliance should be mentioned.

original: 'dir phag gi rtogs pa brjod pa dper bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir phag gi rtogs pa brjod pa dper bya'o //
translated: Here, the story of the pig should be used as an example.

original: gang dag sangs rgyas skyabs dong ba //
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas skyabs dong ba //
translated: Those who have gone for refuge to the Buddha

original: de dag ngan 'gror 'gro mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag ngan 'gror 'gro mi 'gyur //
translated: will not go to the lower realms.

original: mi yi lus ni spangs nas su //
analyzed: mi yi lus ni spangs nas su //
translated: Having given up their human bodies,

original: de dag lha yi lus thob po //
analyzed: de dag lha yi lus thob po //
translated: they will obtain divine bodies.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du chos dang dge 'dun gyi dbang du byas te gdon to //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos dang dge 'dun gyi dbang du byas te gdon to //
translated: In the same way, one should recite the names of the Dharma and the Community.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Liberation of Maitreya,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis sdig pa rnam par dag par gsungs te ;
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis sdig pa rnam par dag par gsungs te ;
translated: it is said that the Awakening Mind purifies evil deeds:

original: nyes pa byas pa thams cad bsregs pas sreg pa'i bskal pa'i me lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyes pa byas pa thams cad bsregs pas sreg pa'i bskal pa'i me lta bu'o //
translated: “It is like the fire at the end of the world, burning up all faults.

original: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad zad par byed pas sa'i 'og lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad zad par byed pas sa'i 'og lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the underworld, destroying all nonvirtue.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
translated: “Noble sir, it is like this:

original: dper na dngul chu'i rigs gser du snang ba zhes bya ba yod de /🔽de ni srang gcig gis kyang lcags srang stong gser du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na dngul chu'i rigs gser du snang ba zhes bya ba yod de / de ni srang gcig gis kyang lcags srang stong gser du 'gyur ro //
translated: There is a substance called ‘gold-like’ that belongs to the mercury family.🔽Even one ounce of it can turn one thousand ounces of iron into gold.

original: dngul chu srang gcig pa da ni lcags srang stong po des zad par byas pa'am lcags su bsgyur bar mi nus so //
analyzed: dngul chu srang gcig pa da ni lcags srang stong po des zad par byas pa'am lcags su bsgyur bar mi nus so //
translated: But that one ounce of mercury cannot be exhausted by even that much iron, nor can it be turned into iron.”

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i dngul chu'i khams dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba dang ye shes kyis bzung ba gcig gis las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i lcags thams cad zad par byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i dngul chu'i khams dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba dang ye shes kyis bzung ba gcig gis las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i lcags thams cad zad par byas te /
translated: In the same way, a single particle of mercury, the root of virtue dedicated with the gnosis of the generation of the resolve for omniscience, exhausts all the iron of the obscurations of karma and afflictions.

original: chos thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu byed kyang /
analyzed: chos thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu byed kyang /
translated: It makes all phenomena the color of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i dngul chu'i khams gcig po de ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i lcags thams cad kyis kyang kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'am zad par mi nus so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i dngul chu'i khams gcig po de ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i lcags thams cad kyis kyang kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'am zad par mi nus so //
translated: But that single particle of mercury, the generation of the resolve for omniscience, cannot be defiled or exhausted by all the iron of karma and afflictions.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na mar me gcig gis khyim mam khang bu ji lta bur bcug kyang rung ste bcug ma thag tu lo stong du bsags pa'i mun pa yang rnam par sel cing snang bar byed do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na mar me gcig gis khyim mam khang bu ji lta bur bcug kyang rung ste bcug ma thag tu lo stong du bsags pa'i mun pa yang rnam par sel cing snang bar byed do //
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this: a single lamp, whether it is placed in a house or a small room, as soon as it is placed there, dispels the darkness that has accumulated for a thousand years and illuminates.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i @100a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i @100a * //
translated: In the same way, a single particle of mercury, the generation of the resolve for omniscience,

original: sems bskyed pa'i mar me gcig gis kyang sems can gyi bsam pa'i thibs po ma rig pa'i mun pa dang ldan pa ji lta bu yang rung bar zhugs na zhugs ma thag tu bskal pa brgya stong brjod du med par bsags pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i mar me gcig gis kyang sems can gyi bsam pa'i thibs po ma rig pa'i mun pa dang ldan pa ji lta bu yang rung bar zhugs na zhugs ma thag tu bskal pa brgya stong brjod du med par bsags pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib
translated: If a single lamp of bodhicitta is lit in any of the thickets of beings’ intentions, which are accompanied by the darkness of ignorance, as soon as it is lit, the obscurations of karma and afflictions accumulated over inexpressible hundreds of thousands of eons will be burned away.

original: pa dang mun pa thams cad rnam par sel zhing ye shes kyi snang ba skyed do //🔽rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i cod pan thogs pa'i klu'i rgyal po chen po rnams la gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba'i 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: pa dang mun pa thams cad rnam par sel zhing ye shes kyi snang ba skyed do // rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i cod pan thogs pa'i klu'i rgyal po chen po rnams la gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba'i 'jigs pa med do //
translated: Even a single lamp of the generation of the Thought, when it enters into any of the thickets of the thoughts of living beings, which are endowed with the darkness of nescience, immediately dispels all the obscurations and darkness of karma and the afflictions accumulated during inexpressible hundreds of thousands of eons, and it generates the light of knowledge.🔽Son in the lineage! It is thus. For example, the great kings of the nagas who wear the diadem of the king of wish-fulfilling gems have no fear of being harmed by others.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems dang snying rje chen po'i nor bu rin po che'i yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i cod pan thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems dang snying rje chen po'i nor bu rin po che'i yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i cod pan thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang /
translated: In the same way, the Bodhisattvas who wear the diadem of the king of wish-fulfilling gems, the jewel of the Thought of Enlightenment and of great compassion, have no fear of being harmed by the actions and afflictions.

original: ngan song dang ngan 'gros gnod par bya ba'i 'jigs pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngan song dang ngan 'gros gnod par bya ba'i 'jigs pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There is no fear of being harmed by the lower realms and bad destinies.

original: 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang gsungs te /
translated: The noble Ārya-upaparikṣā-paripṛcchā also says,

original: nye ba 'khor 'di la theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gal te snga dro'i dus na ltung ba byung ba yang /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor 'di la theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gal te snga dro'i dus na ltung ba byung ba yang /
translated: “O Upāli, in this case, if a bodhisattva practicing the Great Way commits a downfall in the morning,

original: phyi dro'i dus na thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gnas te /
analyzed: phyi dro'i dus na thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gnas te /
translated: if in the afternoon he does not remain separate from the thought of complete knowing,

original: de ltar na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po mtha' med do //
analyzed: de ltar na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po mtha' med do //
translated: then the bodhisattva practicing the Great Way has an infinite amount of moral discipline.

original: gal te phyi dro'i dus na ltung ba byung ba yang ;
analyzed: gal te phyi dro'i dus na ltung ba byung ba yang ;
translated: If he commits a downfall in the afternoon,

original: phye ma red kyi dus na thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gnas te /
analyzed: phye ma red kyi dus na thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gnas te /
translated: if in the evening he does not remain separate from the thought of complete knowing,

original: de ltar na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mtha' med do //
analyzed: de ltar na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mtha' med do //
translated: Thus, the aggregate of morality of the bodhisattva who has entered the Great Vehicle is infinite.

original: gal te phye ma red kyi dus na ltung ba byung ba yang srod la thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gnas te /
analyzed: gal te phye ma red kyi dus na ltung ba byung ba yang srod la thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gnas te /
translated: If he should commit a transgression in the first watch of the night, he should pass the second watch of the night in a state of mind that is not separated from the thought of omniscience.

original: de ltar na tshul khrims kyi phung po mtha' med do //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul khrims kyi phung po mtha' med do //
translated: Thus, the aggregate of morality is infinite.

original: gal te srod la ltung ba byung ba yang nam phyed na thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gnas te /
analyzed: gal te srod la ltung ba byung ba yang nam phyed na thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gnas te /
translated: If he should commit a transgression in the second watch of the night, he should pass the third watch of the night in a state of mind that is not separated from the thought of omniscience.

original: de ltar na tshul khrims kyi phung po mtha' med do //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul khrims kyi phung po mtha' med do //
translated: Thus, the aggregate of morality is infinite.

original: gal te nam phyed na ltung ba byung na yang tho rangs thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gnas te /
analyzed: gal te nam phyed na ltung ba byung na yang tho rangs thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gnas te /
translated: If he should commit a transgression in the third watch of the night, he should pass the first watch of the night in a state of mind that is not separated from the thought of omniscience.

original: de lta na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mtha' med do //
analyzed: de lta na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mtha' med do //
translated: Thus, the aggregate of morality of the bodhisattva who has entered the Great Vehicle is infinite.

original: nye ba 'khor de lta na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa ni bcos su @100b rung ba yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor de lta na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa ni bcos su @100b rung ba yin no //
translated: Upāli, in that case, the training of the bodhisattvas who have set out in the Great Vehicle is restorable.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'gyod pas kun nas ldang ba de skyes na ha cang yang mi dga' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'gyod pas kun nas ldang ba de skyes na ha cang yang mi dga' bar mi bya'o //
translated: In this regard, when a bodhisattva has given rise to remorse, he should not be excessively unhappy.

original: nye ba 'khor de la gal te nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag la /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor de la gal te nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag la /
translated: Upāli, if a person belonging to the Śrāvaka Vehicle

original: ltung ba yang dang yang byung na //
analyzed: ltung ba yang dang yang byung na //
translated: commits a downfall again and again,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag gi tshul khrims kyi phung po nyams par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag gi tshul khrims kyi phung po nyams par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: it should be understood that the aggregate of morality of a person belonging to the Śrāvaka Vehicle is ruined.

original: bslab pa kun las btus pa las sdig pa sbyang ba'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus pa las sdig pa sbyang ba'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the eighth chapter of the Compendium of Trainings, on purifying evil deeds.

original: // / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs s+ho /
analyzed: // / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs s+ho /
translated: The perfection of morality is complete.

original: // / des na de ltar rgyun mi 'chad par sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pa'i 'chal pa'i tshul khrims skye ba bsrung zhing de ltar las kyi sgrib pa'i gegs sel ba des nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / des na de ltar rgyun mi 'chad par sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pa'i 'chal pa'i tshul khrims skye ba bsrung zhing de ltar las kyi sgrib pa'i gegs sel ba des nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should strive to purify the afflictions by that means which removes the obstruction of karma, which is the protection of one's morality from the many sufferings that arise from immorality.

original: de la thog mar re zhig bzod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la thog mar re zhig bzod par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, one should first of all be patient.

original: mi bzod pa ni skyo ba ni sron mi nus pa'i phyir thos pa la sogs pa la brtson pa nyams par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mi bzod pa ni skyo ba ni sron mi nus pa'i phyir thos pa la sogs pa la brtson pa nyams par 'gyur zhing /
translated: For, if one is impatient, one will be unable to bear the weariness and will lose interest in striving for learning, etc.

original: thos pa dang mi ldan pas ni bsam gtan gyi thabs dang nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i thabs kyang mi shes te /
analyzed: thos pa dang mi ldan pas ni bsam gtan gyi thabs dang nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i thabs kyang mi shes te /
translated: And, without learning, one will not know the means of meditative concentration and the means of purifying the afflictions.

original: de bas na skyo ba med par thos pa btsal bar bya /
analyzed: de bas na skyo ba med par thos pa btsal bar bya /
translated: Therefore, one should seek learning without weariness.

original: shes su zin kyang 'dren mar spyod pas mnyam par gzhag dka' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes su zin kyang 'dren mar spyod pas mnyam par gzhag dka' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if one does know, it will be difficult to become concentrated if one practices erratically.

original: de'i phyir / de nas nags su gnas par bya //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de nas nags su gnas par bya //
translated: Therefore, one should live in the forest.

original: der yang rnam par g-yeng ba zhi bar bya ba la mi brtson pas sems mnyam par 'jog par mi 'gyur bas //
analyzed: der yang rnam par g-yeng ba zhi bar bya ba la mi brtson pas sems mnyam par 'jog par mi 'gyur bas //
translated: Moreover, since one does not strive to pacify distraction, the mind does not become concentrated.

original: mnyam par gzhag la brtson bya zhing //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag la brtson bya zhing //
translated: Therefore, one should strive for concentration.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i 'bras bu ni nyon mongs pa sbyangs pa ma gtogs pa ci yang med pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i 'bras bu ni nyon mongs pa sbyangs pa ma gtogs pa ci yang med pas de'i phyir /
translated: The result of concentration is nothing other than the purification of the afflictions. Therefore,

original: mi sdug la sogs bsgom par bya //
analyzed: mi sdug la sogs bsgom par bya //
translated: one should cultivate the meditation on foulness and so on.

original: de ltar 'di dag ni re zhig sdig pa sbyong ba bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag ni re zhig sdig pa sbyong ba bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: These, then, are the words that teach the purification of evil.

original: da ni bshad pa brjod do //🔽de la bzod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni bshad pa brjod do // de la bzod pa ni /
translated: Now, the explanation will be given.

original: chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las /
translated: Among them, patience is explained in the Dharmasangiti-sutra:

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa dang gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o zhes rnam pa gsum gsungs so ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa dang gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o zhes rnam pa gsum gsungs so ;
translated: “There is the patience of accepting suffering, the patience of being certain about the Dharma, and the patience of not retaliating when others do you harm.”

original: / de la sdug bsngal nyams su len pa'i bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni /
analyzed: / de la sdug bsngal nyams su len pa'i bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni /
translated: The resistance to the patience of accepting suffering is

original: sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa nyid mi 'dod pa byung ba dang phrad pa dang / rang gi bde ba la mngon par chags pa nyid 'dod pa'i gegs byed pa dang phrad pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa nyid mi 'dod pa byung ba dang phrad pa dang / rang gi bde ba la mngon par chags pa nyid 'dod pa'i gegs byed pa dang phrad pa ste /
translated: Attachment to one's own happiness is encountering obstacles to what is desirable.

original: de dag las yid mi bde zhing /
analyzed: de dag las yid mi bde zhing /
translated: From these, there is mental dissatisfaction.

original: de las ni @101a * //
analyzed: de las ni @101a * //
translated: From that,

original: sdang ba'am zhum pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdang ba'am zhum pa nyid do //
translated: there is anger or depression.

original: de bas na zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las kyang /🔽bde ba la mi chags pa dang // sdug bsngal la mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las kyang / bde ba la mi chags pa dang // sdug bsngal la mi skyo ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the Candrapradīpa Sūtra says,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Do not be attached to happiness, and do not be discouraged by suffering.

original: dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las kyang /
translated: And the Ratnamegha Sūtra says,

original: gang nang gi mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa de dag bzod cing dang du len to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang nang gi mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa de dag bzod cing dang du len to zhes gsungs so //
translated: “One should endure and accept whatever internal grief, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and mental disturbance there is.”

original: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa las kyang /
translated: And the Ārya-dṛḍhabalaparipṛcchā says,

original: khyim bdag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' khyim pas rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pas 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la mnyam pa nyid thob par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' khyim pas rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pas 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la mnyam pa nyid thob par bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, a householder bodhisattva should attain equanimity with regard to the eight worldly concerns, without attachment or aversion.

original: des longs spyod rnyed dam chung ma dang bu rnyed dam nor dang 'bru dang rdzas rnyed kyang khengs par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: des longs spyod rnyed dam chung ma dang bu rnyed dam nor dang 'bru dang rdzas rnyed kyang khengs par yang mi bya'o //
translated: If he obtains wealth, or obtains a wife or a son, or obtains wealth, grain, or property, he should not become arrogant.

original: thams cad ma 'byor yang de zhum par yang mi bya yi mug par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad ma 'byor yang de zhum par yang mi bya yi mug par yang mi bya'o //
translated: Even if he does not obtain all of them, he should not become discouraged or depressed.

original: des 'di ltar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: des 'di ltar brtag par bya ste /
translated: He should consider this:

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bu rnam par bsgrub pas so sor nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bu rnam par bsgrub pas so sor nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: All conditioned things are like illusions, established by conceptual construction, and characterized by impermanence.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: pha ma dang chung ma dang bran dang las byed pa dang zho shas 'tsho ba dang mdza' bshes dang blon po dang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams de dag ni las kyi rnam par smin pas grub pa yin te /
analyzed: pha ma dang chung ma dang bran dang las byed pa dang zho shas 'tsho ba dang mdza' bshes dang blon po dang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams de dag ni las kyi rnam par smin pas grub pa yin te /
translated: Parents, wives, servants, workers, employees, friends, ministers, relatives, and blood relations are established by the ripening of karma.

original: bdag dbang ba ma yin la nga yang 'di dag gi ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: bdag dbang ba ma yin la nga yang 'di dag gi ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so ;
translated: “They are not mine, I am not theirs. ”🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / gal te bcos su yod na ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te bcos su yod na ni //
translated: If there is a remedy,

original: de la mi dga' ba ci dgos //
analyzed: de la mi dga' ba ci dgos //
translated: what is the use of being unhappy?

original: de ste bcos su med na ni //
analyzed: de ste bcos su med na ni //
translated: But if there is no remedy,

original: de la mi dga' byas ci phan //🔽bcos kyang yid mi bde na ni //
analyzed: de la mi dga' byas ci phan // bcos kyang yid mi bde na ni //
translated: what is the use of being unhappy?🔽If, even though there is a remedy,

original: khro bas rgyal bas 'thad pa'am //
analyzed: khro bas rgyal bas 'thad pa'am //
translated: you are still unhappy,🔽then your anger is not appropriate,

original: zhum pa'i phyir na spro nyams pas //
analyzed: zhum pa'i phyir na spro nyams pas //
translated: and your enthusiasm is lost through weakness.

original: rgud pa chen pos zin par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgud pa chen pos zin par 'gyur //
translated: You are seized by a great misfortune.

original: de la yang dang yang sems pas //
analyzed: de la yang dang yang sems pas //
translated: And by repeatedly thinking about it,

original: tshe yang thung bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: tshe yang thung bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: your life is shortened.

original: de lta bas na goms pa las //
analyzed: de lta bas na goms pa las //
translated: Therefore, through practice,

original: gnod pa bzhin du don med spang //
analyzed: gnod pa bzhin du don med spang //
translated: give up unhappiness as you would harm.

original: yid mi bde ba spang ba yang ji ltar goms par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba spang ba yang ji ltar goms par bya zhe na /
translated: How should you practice giving up unhappiness?

original: yang ba dang snyi ba'i sems spangs pa las te /
analyzed: yang ba dang snyi ba'i sems spangs pa las te /
translated: By giving up a weak and flaccid mind.

original: drag shul can gyis zhus pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: drag shul can gyis zhus pa las ji skad du /
translated: As the Sūtra of the Questions of Ugra says,

original: shing bal gyi 'da' ba lta bu'i sems dang bral bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
