analyzed: shing bal gyi 'da' ba lta bu'i sems dang bral bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “You should be free of a mind that is like cotton fluff. ”

original: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las kyang /🔽bu mo khyod kyis nyon mongs pa thams cad gzhom pa'i phyir thub par dka' ba'i sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las kyang / bu mo khyod kyis nyon mongs pa thams cad gzhom pa'i phyir thub par dka' ba'i sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: The noble Array of Stalks also says,🔽“Girl, you should arouse the hard-to-conquer thought in order to conquer all reactive emotions.

original: mngon par zhen pa thams cad gzhom pa'i phyir gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i @101b sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa thams cad gzhom pa'i phyir gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i @101b sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: You should arouse the invincible thought in order to conquer all attachments.

original: mi mthun pa'i bsam pa can gyi sems can rgya mtsho'i glong 'khyil ba lta bu bab pa rnams la mi 'khrugs pa'i sems bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i bsam pa can gyi sems can rgya mtsho'i glong 'khyil ba lta bu bab pa rnams la mi 'khrugs pa'i sems bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: You should arouse the unshakable thought in order to be unmoved by the waves of the ocean of sentient beings with incompatible intentions.”

original: goms par gyur na dka' ba cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: goms par gyur na dka' ba cung zad kyang med de /
translated: When you are accustomed to it, there is not the slightest difficulty.

original: 'di ltar re zhig shin tu blun pa khur rtsa ba dang nya pa dang zhing pa la sogs pa dag kyang sdug bsngal la goms pa las 'bras bu shin tu chung ngu dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yang yun ring po nas rmad du gyur pa'i mtshan ma
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig shin tu blun pa khur rtsa ba dang nya pa dang zhing pa la sogs pa dag kyang sdug bsngal la goms pa las 'bras bu shin tu chung ngu dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yang yun ring po nas rmad du gyur pa'i mtshan ma
translated: In this way, even very stupid people, such as porters, fishermen, farmers, and so on, by becoming accustomed to suffering, come to delight in things that have very little result.

original: can gyi sems mkhrang ba dang / sgyid lug pas zil gyis mi non na /
analyzed: can gyi sems mkhrang ba dang / sgyid lug pas zil gyis mi non na /
translated: If you are not overcome by a hard or lazy mind,

original: 'khor ba'i bde ba thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba thams cad dang bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i 'bras bu can gyi las la smos su yod dam ci /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bde ba thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba thams cad dang bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i 'bras bu can gyi las la smos su yod dam ci /
translated: what need is there to mention the karma that has the result of attaining all the happiness of cyclic existence, all the happiness of the bodhisattva grounds, and the unsurpassed state?

original: 'di ltar phal pa dag kyang cung zad gnod pa byed pa bdag gi nyes par byas pas bcom zhing rang nyid 'chi ba rnams la brdeg pa'i ched du /
analyzed: 'di ltar phal pa dag kyang cung zad gnod pa byed pa bdag gi nyes par byas pas bcom zhing rang nyid 'chi ba rnams la brdeg pa'i ched du /
translated: In this way, even ordinary people, who are destroyed by their own misdeeds, are beaten to death for the sake of beating others who have harmed them a little.

original: drag tu brdegs pa myong yang g-yul du 'jug na /
analyzed: drag tu brdegs pa myong yang g-yul du 'jug na /
translated: If they enter the battlefield, they experience severe beatings.🔽If you are a bodhisattva, you should be willing to enter the hells, which are like a prison of existence, for a long time, in order to steal the wealth of virtue that is the result of the hardships undergone by those who are thieves of the mere scraps of virtue that are the result of karma that has the result of harming you for a long time.

original: dus shin tu ring por gnod pa byed pa dka' bas bsgrubs pa'i dge ba'i nor bag tsam pa'i rkun po dmyal ba nyid kyi gsod sar gsad bya'i gshed mar gyur pa srid pa'i btson ra'i srung mar nges par 'byung ba'i lam gyi phyir phyogs ma rung bar byed
analyzed: dus shin tu ring por gnod pa byed pa dka' bas bsgrubs pa'i dge ba'i nor bag tsam pa'i rkun po dmyal ba nyid kyi gsod sar gsad bya'i gshed mar gyur pa srid pa'i btson ra'i srung mar nges par 'byung ba'i lam gyi phyir phyogs ma rung bar byed
translated: The hells are the execution ground for those who are thieves of virtue.🔽They are the butchers who kill you.🔽They are the guards of the prison of existence.🔽They are the ones who block the path to liberation.

original: pa rjes su mthun pa 'dra yang gnod pa drag po byed pa gnod pa ma byas par dgrar gyur pa /
analyzed: pa rjes su mthun pa 'dra yang gnod pa drag po byed pa gnod pa ma byas par dgrar gyur pa /
translated: Even though the enemies are similar in that they are harmful, they are not enemies unless they do harm.

original: thog ma med pa'i bskal pa las dam du 'brel ba'i sha 'khon can /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bskal pa las dam du 'brel ba'i sha 'khon can /
translated: They are enemies who have been related to you since beginningless time.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams la gzhom par spro ba'am sdug bsngal bzod par go ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams la gzhom par spro ba'am sdug bsngal bzod par go ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: How could it not be reasonable to be enthusiastic about conquering the afflictions or to endure suffering?

original: sa gsum las rnam par rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir chas shing bdud kyi ri khrod pa'i bdag pos zin pa'i 'gro ba gnang ba con thar bar bya ba'i phyir g-yul ngor zhugs pa ni khyad par du yang 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: sa gsum las rnam par rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir chas shing bdud kyi ri khrod pa'i bdag pos zin pa'i 'gro ba gnang ba con thar bar bya ba'i phyir g-yul ngor zhugs pa ni khyad par du yang 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: It is especially so when you are ready to conquer the three worlds and enter the battlefield to liberate beings who are seized by the demon king of the mountain retreats.

original: de la sdug bsngal chung ngu la goms par bya ba sngon du btang na /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal chung ngu la goms par bya ba sngon du btang na /
translated: If you first become accustomed to small sufferings,

original: dka' ba dang shin tu dka' ba la yang goms pa 'grub ste /
analyzed: dka' ba dang shin tu dka' ba la yang goms pa 'grub ste /
translated: you will achieve the ability to endure great difficulties.

original: dper na goms pa'i dbang gis sems can thams cad sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal 'byung ba thams cad la bde bar 'du shes nye bar gzhag pa goms pas bde ba'i 'du shes nyid du nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na goms pa'i dbang gis sems can thams cad sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal 'byung ba thams cad la bde bar 'du shes nye bar gzhag pa goms pas bde ba'i 'du shes nyid du nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, through the power of habituation, all sentient beings perceive suffering as happiness. In the same way, through the habituation of perceiving all the arising of suffering as happiness, the perception of happiness itself will be present.

original: 'di'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni chos thams cad bde bas non pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni chos thams cad bde bas non pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa yin no //
translated: The result that is in accordance with the cause is the attainment of the samadhi called “all phenomena are pervaded by happiness.”🔽In the Meeting of Father and Son Sutra,

original: @102a * // yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: @102a * // yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las /
translated: it says:

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la bde bas non pa zhes bgyi ba'i ting nge 'dzin mchis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la bde bas non pa zhes bgyi ba'i ting nge 'dzin mchis te /
translated: “Bhagavat, there is the samadhi called ‘all phenomena are pervaded by happiness.’

original: ting nge 'dzin de thob pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dmigs pa'i dngos po thams cad la bde ba'i tshor ba sha stag myong bar 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba mi myong la sdug bsngal yang ma lags /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de thob pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dmigs pa'i dngos po thams cad la bde ba'i tshor ba sha stag myong bar 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba mi myong la sdug bsngal yang ma lags /
translated: By attaining that samadhi, the bodhisattva mahasattva will experience only the sensation of happiness with regard to all the things that are perceived, and will not experience the sensation of suffering. There is no suffering.

original: bde ba yang ma lags pa yang mi myong ste /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma lags pa yang mi myong ste /
translated: They do not experience pleasure or pain.🔽Even when harmed by the harm of the hells, the perception of pleasure remains present. Even when harmed by the harm of humans, the perception of pleasure remains present.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i gnod pas gnod par bgyis kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pa dang / mi'i gnod pas gnod par bgyis kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pa dang / lag pa bcad dam rkang pa bcad dam /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i gnod pas gnod par bgyis kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pa dang / mi'i gnod pas gnod par bgyis kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pa dang / lag pa bcad dam rkang pa bcad dam /
translated: Even when their hands are cut off, their feet are cut off,

original: rkang lag bcad dam /🔽rna ba'am / sna'am /
analyzed: rkang lag bcad dam / rna ba'am / sna'am /
translated: their hands and feet are cut off,🔽their ears are cut off, their noses are cut off,

original: rna ba dang sna gtubs kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / sba lcag gis gzhus sam /
analyzed: rna ba dang sna gtubs kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / sba lcag gis gzhus sam /
translated: or their ears and noses are cut off, the perception of pleasure remains present.🔽Even when struck with a whip,

original: sba lcag phyed tshal lam /
analyzed: sba lcag phyed tshal lam /
translated: a half-whip,🔽or a whip, the perception of pleasure remains present.

original: lcag gis gzhus kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / btson rar bcug gam /
analyzed: lcag gis gzhus kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / btson rar bcug gam /
translated: Even when imprisoned,

original: lcags sgrog dang shing sgrog tu bcug gam /
analyzed: lcags sgrog dang shing sgrog tu bcug gam /
translated: bound in iron or wooden shackles,

original: btson cha dam po la rgyas btab bam /
analyzed: btson cha dam po la rgyas btab bam /
translated: sealed in strict custody,

original: byis pa'i gtsug phud ltar bcings sam /🔽dugs kyi snod ltar bdugs sam /
analyzed: byis pa'i gtsug phud ltar bcings sam / dugs kyi snod ltar bdugs sam /
translated: bound like a child’s topknot,🔽steamed like a bamboo steamer,🔽crushed like sugarcane,

original: bu ram shing brdungs pa ltar brdungs sam /
analyzed: bu ram shing brdungs pa ltar brdungs sam /
translated: Are you crushed like sugar cane?🔽

original: 'dam bu gzhom pa ltar bcom mam /
analyzed: 'dam bu gzhom pa ltar bcom mam /
translated: or like reeds being crushed,

original: 'bru mar gyi mar me ltar 'bar bar byas sam /
analyzed: 'bru mar gyi mar me ltar 'bar bar byas sam /
translated: or like a butter lamp,🔽or like a burning butter lamp or boiling curd, even then the perception of pleasure would persist.

original: mar gyi mar me dang / zho bskol ba ltar 'bar bar byas kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / me'i nang du bor ram /🔽seng ge'i khar bstabs sam /
analyzed: mar gyi mar me dang / zho bskol ba ltar 'bar bar byas kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / me'i nang du bor ram / seng ge'i khar bstabs sam /
translated: or thrown into a fire,🔽or into the mouth of a lion,

original: stag gi khar bstabs sam /
analyzed: stag gi khar bstabs sam /
translated: or into the mouth of a tiger,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽skam dril bya ba ltar dril tam /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / skam dril bya ba ltar dril tam /
translated: and so on,🔽or rolled up like a reed,

original: byi bo'i chad pa lta bus bcad dam /
analyzed: byi bo'i chad pa lta bus bcad dam /
translated: or cut up like a corpse,

original: nyes pa byung ba bsgrags pa ltar bsgrags sam /
analyzed: nyes pa byung ba bsgrags pa ltar bsgrags sam /
translated: or proclaimed like a crime,

original: k'arsha pa na tsam du gtubs sam /
analyzed: k'arsha pa na tsam du gtubs sam /
translated: or chopped up like a kārṣāpanṇa,

original: 'bras phye btso ba ltar btsos sam /
analyzed: 'bras phye btso ba ltar btsos sam /
translated: or cooked like boiled rice,🔽or crushed by elephants, even then the perception of pleasure would persist.

original: glang po che rnams kyis bcom yang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / mig phyung ngam /
analyzed: glang po che rnams kyis bcom yang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / mig phyung ngam /
translated: or their eyes gouged out,

original: gsal shing gi rtse mo la gzhag gam /
analyzed: gsal shing gi rtse mo la gzhag gam /
translated: or impaled on a stake,

original: gsad pa'i gnas su khrid de rnam pa thams cad du mgo bcad kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur te bde ba yang ma lags mi bde ba yang ma lags pa'i 'du shes rnam pa thams cad du mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsad pa'i gnas su khrid de rnam pa thams cad du mgo bcad kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur te bde ba yang ma lags mi bde ba yang ma lags pa'i 'du shes rnam pa thams cad du mi 'byung ngo //
translated: He is led to the place of execution, and his head is cut off, but he still has the perception of pleasure, and he does not have the perception of pain at all.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems @102b dpa' chen po des /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems @102b dpa' chen po des /
translated: Because that bodhisattva,

original: yun ring po nas spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: yun ring po nas spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when he was practicing the bodhisattva practice for a long time,🔽made this aspiration: ‘May those who give me food attain the happiness of peace.🔽May those who give me drink, and those who serve me, honor me, respect me, and worship me, all attain the happiness of peace.

original: smon lam 'di ltar btab ste gang gis bdag la kha zas byin pa de dag nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba thob par gyur cig / gang gis bdag la skom blud pa de dag dang / gang gis bdag la rim gror byas pa dang bkur sti byas pa dang bsti stang byas pa dang mchod pa byas pa de dag thams cad kyang nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba thob par gyur cig / gang yang bdag la gshe bar byed pa dang mi bde ba
analyzed: smon lam 'di ltar btab ste gang gis bdag la kha zas byin pa de dag nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba thob par gyur cig / gang gis bdag la skom blud pa de dag dang / gang gis bdag la rim gror byas pa dang bkur sti byas pa dang bsti stang byas pa dang mchod pa byas pa de dag thams cad kyang nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba thob par gyur cig / gang yang bdag la gshe bar byed pa dang mi bde ba
translated: May those who revile me, who are violent toward me, who take away my life, attain the happiness of peace.’

original: byed pa dang rdeg pa dang mtshon gyis 'debs pa dang rnam pa thams cad du srog gcod pa'i bar du byed pa de dag thams cad kyang byang chub kyi bde ba thob cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
analyzed: byed pa dang rdeg pa dang mtshon gyis 'debs pa dang rnam pa thams cad du srog gcod pa'i bar du byed pa de dag thams cad kyang byang chub kyi bde ba thob cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
translated: All of them, from those who engage in killing to those who engage in killing and beating and killing with weapons, will attain the bliss of awakening and fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.🔽

original: rgya bar gyur cig ces smon lam btab ste /
analyzed: rgya bar gyur cig ces smon lam btab ste /
translated: May all those who are being killed, beaten, cut, and stabbed, and all those who are being deprived of life, attain the bliss of awakening and fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.”

original: de yid la bya ba de dag dang ldan zhing /🔽de lta bu'i las dang de lta bu'i smon lam dang ldan pas sems can thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i bde ba'i 'du shes la brten zhing bsnyen la bsgom zhing mang du byed de /
analyzed: de yid la bya ba de dag dang ldan zhing / de lta bu'i las dang de lta bu'i smon lam dang ldan pas sems can thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i bde ba'i 'du shes la brten zhing bsnyen la bsgom zhing mang du byed de /
translated: With this thought in mind,🔽they make aspirations for all beings to be happy.

original: de las de'i rnam par smin pas chos thams cad la bde bas non pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob po //
analyzed: de las de'i rnam par smin pas chos thams cad la bde bas non pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob po //
translated: As a result of this karma and these aspirations, they will attain the meditative absorption known as ‘the bliss of all phenomena.’

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad la bde bas non pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur pa de'i tshe bdud kyi las thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs shing mi 'khrugs par 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad la bde bas non pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur pa de'i tshe bdud kyi las thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs shing mi 'khrugs par 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: When the bodhisattva attains the meditative absorption of being overwhelmed by happiness with respect to all phenomena, at that time he is not carried away and is not disturbed by any demonic activity.

original: sbyor ba 'di ni gtong ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / bya bar dka' ba'i spyod pa thams cad bsgrubs pa dang / bzod pa thams cad brtan par byed pa dang / brtson 'grus thams cad la nur ba med par byed pa dang /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di ni gtong ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / bya bar dka' ba'i spyod pa thams cad bsgrubs pa dang / bzod pa thams cad brtan par byed pa dang / brtson 'grus thams cad la nur ba med par byed pa dang /
translated: This practice is the completion of all giving, the accomplishment of all difficult activities, the stabilization of all patience, the non-retreating from all effort,

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi yan lag gi tshogs thams cad la sbyor ba yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi yan lag gi tshogs thams cad la sbyor ba yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: and the application to all the collections of the branches of meditative stabilization and wisdom.

original: de lta bas na rtag tu dga' bar bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtag tu dga' bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, always be happy.

original: zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
analyzed: zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
translated: The Candrapradīpa Sūtra says,

original: gus dang bcas shing yid ni rtag tu dga' bar bya //
analyzed: gus dang bcas shing yid ni rtag tu dga' bar bya //
translated: Be respectful, and always be happy in mind.

original: zhi ba'i lta ba la ni rtag tu gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhi ba'i lta ba la ni rtag tu gnas par 'gyur //
translated: Always abide in the view of peace.

original: zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said,

original: 'phags pa blo gsos mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gsos mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang gsungs so //
translated: and in the noble Aksayamatinirdeśa-sūtra.

original: de la dga' ba chen po gang zhe na /🔽gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dran pa dang rjes su dran pa dang dga' ba dang / dad pa dang mchog tu dga' ba dang sems ma gong zhing mi brdzi ba dang srid pa @103a * //
analyzed: de la dga' ba chen po gang zhe na / gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dran pa dang rjes su dran pa dang dga' ba dang / dad pa dang mchog tu dga' ba dang sems ma gong zhing mi brdzi ba dang srid pa @103a * //
translated: What is great delight?

original: med pa dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad gtong ba dang / chos kyi dga' ba thams cad kyi rten dang sems rab tu dga' ba dang / lus rab tu sim pa dang / sangs rgyas la dga' zhing yid 'phar ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dga' zhing mos pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i rkyen tshol ba la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: med pa dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad gtong ba dang / chos kyi dga' ba thams cad kyi rten dang sems rab tu dga' ba dang / lus rab tu sim pa dang / sangs rgyas la dga' zhing yid 'phar ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dga' zhing mos pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i rkyen tshol ba la mkhas pa dang /
translated: It is the recollection, remembrance, delight, faith, and joy in the Buddha’s Dharma, the state of mind that is not overwhelmed, the absence of worldly existence, the giving up of all worldly delights, the basis of all delight in the Dharma, the joy of mind, the satisfaction of body, the delight in and exaltation of mind toward the Buddha, the delight in and devotion to the body of the Tathagata, the skill in seeking the conditions for the major and minor marks,

original: dge ba'i chos mnyan pas mi skyo ba dang / de kho na'i chos la brten pa'i nan tan dang / dga' ba dang mgu ba dang rangs pa dang rab tu dga' bas chos la mos pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can rnams la khong khro ba med pa'i blo dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos mnyan pas mi skyo ba dang / de kho na'i chos la brten pa'i nan tan dang / dga' ba dang mgu ba dang rangs pa dang rab tu dga' bas chos la mos pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can rnams la khong khro ba med pa'i blo dang /
translated: It is to never tire of listening to the Dharma. It is to be diligent in the Dharma of suchness. It is to have devotion to the Dharma with joy, satisfaction, delight, and supreme joy. It is to have a mind that is never angry with sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol ba la 'dun pa dang / chos la 'dun pa de yang mi 'dor ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po la mos shing rnam par grol ba dang / nyi tshe ba'i theg pa dang ma 'dres pa'i sems bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol ba la 'dun pa dang / chos la 'dun pa de yang mi 'dor ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po la mos shing rnam par grol ba dang / nyi tshe ba'i theg pa dang ma 'dres pa'i sems bskyed pa dang /
translated: It is to have the aspiration to seek the Buddha’s Dharma. It is to never give up that aspiration for the Dharma. It is to have interest in and be liberated by the vast Dharma of the Buddha. It is to give rise to the mind that is not mixed with the limited vehicles.

original: ser sna med pas ma zhum par sems bskyed pa dang / nor gang sems kyis sbyin 'dod pa de sbyin zhing byin nas kyang 'khor gsum dag par yongs su sbyangs pa dang / sbyin pa la dga' ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la rtag tu dang ba dang /
analyzed: ser sna med pas ma zhum par sems bskyed pa dang / nor gang sems kyis sbyin 'dod pa de sbyin zhing byin nas kyang 'khor gsum dag par yongs su sbyangs pa dang / sbyin pa la dga' ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la rtag tu dang ba dang /
translated: They give with a generous attitude, without being miserly or discouraged. They give whatever wealth they wish to give mentally. After giving, they purify it by being free of the three spheres. They delight in generosity. They are always faithful to those who have discipline.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rjes su 'dzin cing byams pa dang / bdag gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa thams cad las shin tu 'das par dbugs 'byin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims kyi bsngo ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rjes su 'dzin cing byams pa dang / bdag gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa thams cad las shin tu 'das par dbugs 'byin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims kyi bsngo ba dang /
translated: They take care of those with faulty discipline and love them. They have pure discipline. They are relieved because they have completely transcended all the fears of the lower realms. They dedicate their discipline to the tathāgatas.

original: brtan zhing mi phyed pa dang / pha rol gyis ngan par brjod pa dang ngan par smras pa'i tshig gi lam la khong khro ba med pa'i sems nyid dang / bzod cing nges pa dang / nga rgyal med pa dang / bla ma la 'dud cing rim gro byed pa dang /
analyzed: brtan zhing mi phyed pa dang / pha rol gyis ngan par brjod pa dang ngan par smras pa'i tshig gi lam la khong khro ba med pa'i sems nyid dang / bzod cing nges pa dang / nga rgyal med pa dang / bla ma la 'dud cing rim gro byed pa dang /
translated: It is to be steadfast and indivisible, to have a mind that is not angry at the unpleasant words and verbal actions of others, to be patient and certain, to be without pride, to bow to and serve one’s gurus,

original: rtag tu bzhin 'dzum pa dang / khro gnyer med pa dang / sngon du gsong por smra ba dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang / thob kyis 'jal ba med pa dang / bsam pa dag pa dang / sems la brlang ba med pa dang /
analyzed: rtag tu bzhin 'dzum pa dang / khro gnyer med pa dang / sngon du gsong por smra ba dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang / thob kyis 'jal ba med pa dang / bsam pa dag pa dang / sems la brlang ba med pa dang /
translated: to always have a smiling face, to be without frowns, to speak pleasantly first, to be without hypocrisy, to be without flattery, to be without deceit, to have a pure motivation, to have a mind that is not rough,

original: gya gyu med pa dang / thams cad la legs par lta ba dang / skyon med par lta ba dang / ltung ba mi gleng ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ston pa ltar phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: gya gyu med pa dang / thams cad la legs par lta ba dang / skyon med par lta ba dang / ltung ba mi gleng ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ston pa ltar phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: It is to be without deceit, to see everything as excellent, to see without fault, to not speak of downfalls, to follow the Dharma that brings perfect joy, to cherish the bodhisattvas as much as one cherishes one’s teacher,

original: chos rnams la bdag bzhin phangs par @103b 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la srog bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / bla ma la pha ma bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / sems can rnams la bu bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: chos rnams la bdag bzhin phangs par @103b 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la srog bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / bla ma la pha ma bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / sems can rnams la bu bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: to cherish the Dharma as much as one cherishes oneself, to cherish the thus-gone ones as much as one cherishes one’s life, to cherish one’s gurus as much as one cherishes one’s parents, to cherish sentient beings as much as one cherishes one’s children,

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon la sangs rgyas bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / nan tan la yan lag gi dam pa mgo bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rkang lag bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon la sangs rgyas bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / nan tan la yan lag gi dam pa mgo bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rkang lag bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: to cherish one’s preceptors and instructors as much as one cherishes the Buddha, to cherish one’s practice as much as one cherishes one’s head, to cherish the perfections as much as one cherishes one’s limbs,

original: chos smra ba rnams la rin po che thams cad bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / rjes su bstan pa la dga' ba'i rtsed mo bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: chos smra ba rnams la rin po che thams cad bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / rjes su bstan pa la dga' ba'i rtsed mo bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: They value the teachers of the Dharma as much as they value all jewels. They value all the qualities of the Buddhas as much as they value a wish-fulfilling jewel. They value the joy of teaching as much as they value play.

original: chog shes pa la nad med pa bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / chos tshol ba la sman bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / skul zhing dran par byed pa la sman pa bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: chog shes pa la nad med pa bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / chos tshol ba la sman bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / skul zhing dran par byed pa la sman pa bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: They value contentment as much as they value health. They value seeking the Dharma as much as they value medicine. They value being exhorted and reminded as much as they value a doctor.

original: de ltar gang dbang po thams cad la dbang po ma gong ba 'di ni dga' ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar gang dbang po thams cad la dbang po ma gong ba 'di ni dga' ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, they value all the faculties as much as they value the highest faculty. This is called joy.

original: 'di la bslabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni /🔽'phags pa sprin chen po'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'di la bslabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni /🔽'phags pa sprin chen po'i mdo las /
translated: The bodhisattvas who train in this🔽are said to be “endowed with the faculty of joy.”

original: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba la dga' bar yang 'gyur ba dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba la sems shing rtag tu bsam pa gtong ba'i ngang tshul can du'ang 'gyur ba dang / sems can dmyal ba'i tshong rdal gyi tshong par yang 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba la dga' bar yang 'gyur ba dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba la sems shing rtag tu bsam pa gtong ba'i ngang tshul can du'ang 'gyur ba dang / sems can dmyal ba'i tshong rdal gyi tshong par yang 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will delight in the realms of hell beings, and they will always be inclined to think about and reflect on the realms of hell beings. They will be merchants in the marketplaces of the realms of hell beings.🔽They will not give up on the realms of hell beings, and they will be filled with thoughts of the fires of the realms of hell beings.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i 'thob pa mi gtong bar yang 'gyur ba dang / sems can dmyal ba'i me la sems rgyas par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa'i tshig 'dis brgyan par byed do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i 'thob pa mi gtong bar yang 'gyur ba dang / sems can dmyal ba'i me la sems rgyas par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa'i tshig 'dis brgyan par byed do //
translated: This is the adornment of those words.

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa bshad zin to //
translated: This completes the explanation of the patience of accepting suffering.

original: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang bzod pa rnam pa gsum bstan te /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang bzod pa rnam pa gsum bstan te /
translated: The noble Sūtra of the Questions of Sāgaramati also teaches three kinds of patience:

original: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa rin po che de ltar bskyed nas /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa rin po che de ltar bskyed nas /
translated: “Sāgaramati, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas, having generated the precious mind of awakening,

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa tshul khrims 'chal pa'i sems can rnams sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa tshul khrims 'chal pa'i sems can rnams sam /
translated: They are not shaken, not stirred, not cowed, not frightened, not intimidated, and do not tremble, quake, or experience any fear by any non-noble, immoral beings,

original: bdud rnams sam /
analyzed: bdud rnams sam /
translated: or by Māra,

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams sam /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams sam /
translated: or by the gods of Māra’s retinue,

original: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams sam /
translated: or by those blessed by Māra,

original: bdud kyi pho nya rnams kyis gtses sam rnam par gtses sam bskyod @104a * //🔽dam kun tu bskyod dam /
analyzed: bdud kyi pho nya rnams kyis gtses sam rnam par gtses sam bskyod @104a * // dam kun tu bskyod dam /
translated: or by Māra’s messengers, whether they are threatening,🔽or threatening and stirring,

original: dkrugs sam kun tu dkrugs sam /
analyzed: dkrugs sam kun tu dkrugs sam /
translated: or threatening, stirring, and agitating,

original: spyos sam bsdigs sam brdegs kyang /
analyzed: spyos sam bsdigs sam brdegs kyang /
translated: or threatening, stirring, agitating, and beating.

original: byang chub tu bsam pa'i sems bskyed pa de las mi phyed pa dang / sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar byed pa'i snying rje chen pos //
analyzed: byang chub tu bsam pa'i sems bskyed pa de las mi phyed pa dang / sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar byed pa'i snying rje chen pos //
translated: They are unshaken in their generation of the mind set on awakening, in their great compassion that liberates all sentient beings,

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa las mi phyed pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi 'chad par bya ba la brtson pa las mi phyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sbyor ba las mi phyed pa dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa las mi phyed pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi 'chad par bya ba la brtson pa las mi phyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sbyor ba las mi phyed pa dang /
translated: in their application of diligence, in their application to not interrupting the lineage of the Three Jewels, and in their application to the roots of virtue that accomplish all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa las mi phyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba mngon par bsgrub par brtson pa las mi phyed pa dang / lus dang srog 'dor zhing dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin par mngon par brtson pa las mi phyed pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa las mi phyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba mngon par bsgrub par brtson pa las mi phyed pa dang / lus dang srog 'dor zhing dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin par mngon par brtson pa las mi phyed pa dang /
translated: They are inseparable from the effort to uphold the sublime Dharma, even at the cost of their bodies and lives.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la mngon par brtson zhing bdag bde ba la mi chags pa las mi phyed pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la mngon par brtson zhing bdag bde ba la mi chags pa las mi phyed pa ste /
translated: They are inseparable from the effort to ripen all sentient beings, without being attached to their own happiness.

original: de de ltar lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pas /
analyzed: de de ltar lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pas /
translated: Thus, with their perfect superior intention,

original: sems can thams cad kyis co dris kyang bzod /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis co dris kyang bzod /
translated: they are patient with the insults of all sentient beings.

original: thing slad byas pa dang / smad pa dang / bshung ba byas kyang bzod //
analyzed: thing slad byas pa dang / smad pa dang / bshung ba byas kyang bzod //
translated: They are patient with the criticism, contempt, and slander of others.

original: sems can thams cad kyis mtshang brus sam spyos sam /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis mtshang brus sam spyos sam /
translated: They are patient with all sentient beings, whether they are digging up their body or beating them,

original: bsdigs sam / ngan du brjod dam /
analyzed: bsdigs sam / ngan du brjod dam /
translated: whether they are threatening them or speaking badly of them,

original: ngan du smras pa'i tshig gi lam kyang bzod /🔽sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa yang bzod /
analyzed: ngan du smras pa'i tshig gi lam kyang bzod / sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa yang bzod /
translated: They endure the bad words spoken to them.🔽They endure the harm of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi khur yang bzod /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi khur yang bzod /
translated: They endure the burden of all sentient beings.

original: sgrol bas kyang skyo ba med /🔽zhum pa med /
analyzed: sgrol bas kyang skyo ba med / zhum pa med /
translated: They are not discouraged by the task of liberating all sentient beings.🔽They are not disheartened.

original: kun du zhum pa med /🔽sgyid lug pa med /
analyzed: kun du zhum pa med / sgyid lug pa med /
translated: They are not completely disheartened.🔽They are not lazy.

original: yi chad pa med ;
analyzed: yi chad pa med ;
translated: They are not despondent.

original: stobs nye bar ston par byed /
analyzed: stobs nye bar ston par byed /
translated: They show their strength.

original: mthu skyed par byed cing brtson 'grus rtsom par byed la /
analyzed: mthu skyed par byed cing brtson 'grus rtsom par byed la /
translated: They generate power and undertake perseverance.🔽They are heroic and do not hold on to a confused mind.

original: brtul ba sa brtul bar byed de de spro ba skyed cing rmongs pa'i sems mi 'dzin to //🔽mtshang brus kyang slar mtshang mi 'bru ba dang / brdegs kyang slar mi rdeg / khros kyang slar mi khro //
analyzed: brtul ba sa brtul bar byed de de spro ba skyed cing rmongs pa'i sems mi 'dzin to // mtshang brus kyang slar mtshang mi 'bru ba dang / brdegs kyang slar mi rdeg / khros kyang slar mi khro //
translated: Even if they are attacked, they do not attack in return.🔽Even if they are beaten, they do not beat in return.🔽Even if they are angry with, they are not angry in return.

original: gshe ba la slar ni gshe ba ste /
analyzed: gshe ba la slar ni gshe ba ste /
translated: Even if they are reviled, they do not revile in return.

original: de ltar sems 'grang ba'i go cha gyon no //
analyzed: de ltar sems 'grang ba'i go cha gyon no //
translated: They put on the armor of mind-protection.

original: 'di lta ste theg pa chen po'i mdo 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste theg pa chen po'i mdo 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i theg pa'o //
translated: This is the Great Vehicle, the vehicle that does not accord with the world.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can de dag ni rgyun gyi rjes su 'gro ba dag go //
analyzed: sems can de dag ni rgyun gyi rjes su 'gro ba dag go //
translated: Those sentient beings are in the stream of continuity.

original: bdag ni rgyun las ldog par rtsol bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rgyun las ldog par rtsol bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: I am striving to turn away from the stream of continuity.

original: sems can de dag ni @104b phan tshun mi mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: sems can de dag ni @104b phan tshun mi mthun pa dag go //
translated: Those sentient beings are mutually hostile.

original: bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi mi mthun pa spang pa'i phyir go cha ba gos pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi mi mthun pa spang pa'i phyir go cha ba gos pa'o //
translated: I am wearing the armor of patience for the sake of removing all sentient beings’ hostility.

original: sems can de dag ni gnod sems la dpa' bdag go //
analyzed: sems can de dag ni gnod sems la dpa' bdag go //
translated: Those sentient beings are heroes in malice.

original: bdag ni bzod pa dang des pa yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni bzod pa dang des pa yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: I am seeking patience and gentleness.

original: sems can de dag ni gcig la gcig 'drid cing yongs su 'drid par gnas pa dag go //
analyzed: sems can de dag ni gcig la gcig 'drid cing yongs su 'drid par gnas pa dag go //
translated: Those sentient beings are living in mutual deception and betrayal.

original: bdag ni shes rab kyis ngoms pa yongs su tshol ba'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab kyis ngoms pa yongs su tshol ba'o // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: I am seeking to be satisfied with wisdom.

original: gal te phyogs bcu'i rab tu dbye bas rab tu phye ba'i sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad /
analyzed: gal te phyogs bcu'i rab tu dbye bas rab tu phye ba'i sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad /
translated: In the same way, if all those sentient beings who are distinguished by the distinctions of the ten directions

original: ral gri dang shag ti dang mdung thung dang mtshon rtse gnyis pa la sogs pa lag na thogs te bdag gi phyi bzhin 'brang yang sa phyogs gang du 'greng ngam 'dug gam 'chag gam nyal yang rung ste byang chub kyi sems skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ral gri dang shag ti dang mdung thung dang mtshon rtse gnyis pa la sogs pa lag na thogs te bdag gi phyi bzhin 'brang yang sa phyogs gang du 'greng ngam 'dug gam 'chag gam nyal yang rung ste byang chub kyi sems skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Wherever I stand, sit, walk, or lie down, may the thought of awakening arise.

original: sbyin pa'i sems sam /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i sems sam /
translated: May the thought of generosity arise.

original: tshul khrims kyi sems sam /🔽bzod pa'i sems sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sems sam / bzod pa'i sems sam /
translated: May the thought of ethical discipline arise.🔽May the thought of patience arise.

original: brtson 'grus kyi sems sam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi sems sam /
translated: May the thought of perseverance arise.

original: bsam gtan gyi sems sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sems sam /
translated: May the thought of concentration arise.

original: shes rab kyi sems sam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi sems sam /
translated: May the thought of wisdom arise.🔽May the thought of the roots of virtue of listening to the teachings arise.

original: thos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba'i sa phyogs der bdag lus rgya shug gi lo ma'i brgya cha tsam du gtubs sam rnam par gtor ram /🔽rnam par bcom mam /
analyzed: thos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba'i sa phyogs der bdag lus rgya shug gi lo ma'i brgya cha tsam du gtubs sam rnam par gtor ram / rnam par bcom mam /
translated: Wherever I am, may I cut up my body into a hundred pieces, or a thousand pieces, or reduce it to dust.

original: sems can de dag thams cad las gzhan mi byed par rgyun du gshe'am /
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad las gzhan mi byed par rgyun du gshe'am /
translated: May I not do anything else but constantly serve all those beings.

original: bsdigs sam ; smod dam /
analyzed: bsdigs sam ; smod dam /
translated: May I constantly abuse them, threaten them, and revile them.

original: bshung ngam / tshig ngan pa dang / ngag rtsub po smra bar gyur kyang bdag gis sems can 'ga' la yang 'khrug pa'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bshung ngam / tshig ngan pa dang / ngag rtsub po smra bar gyur kyang bdag gis sems can 'ga' la yang 'khrug pa'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: Even if others should revile me, speak badly of me, or use harsh words toward me, I will not arouse an angry mind toward any living being.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon gyi mtha' nas 'khor ba tshad med par byas te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' nas 'khor ba tshad med par byas te /
translated: In the past, I have wandered in samsara for immeasurable time.

original: gang du bdag gi lus 'di sems can dmyal bar song ngam /
analyzed: gang du bdag gi lus 'di sems can dmyal bar song ngam /
translated: Whether this body of mine has gone to the hells,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ngam /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ngam /
translated: to the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du song ngam /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du song ngam /
translated: to the world of Yama,

original: mir gyur kyang rung ste /
analyzed: mir gyur kyang rung ste /
translated: or to the human realm,

original: 'dod pa'i zas kyi dri mas dri ma can du gyur nas chos thos pa dang mi ldan zhing /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zas kyi dri mas dri ma can du gyur nas chos thos pa dang mi ldan zhing /
translated: it has become defiled by the stain of food that is the cause of desire, and has not been fit for hearing the Dharma.

original: yang ba'i 'tsho ba'i spyod yul don med pas 'tsho ba can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang ba'i 'tsho ba'i spyod yul don med pas 'tsho ba can du 'gyur te /
translated: It has lived a meaningless life, with a livelihood that is a cause of weakness.

original: yan lag dang nying lag rnam pa brgyar gshegs shing gtubs te phye zhing phral la bya ba rnam pa mang po byas kyang bdag gis gzhi de las bdag gi don byas kyi /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag rnam pa brgyar gshegs shing gtubs te phye zhing phral la bya ba rnam pa mang po byas kyang bdag gis gzhi de las bdag gi don byas kyi /
translated: It has been cut, split, and torn into a hundred pieces, and has been subjected to many kinds of harm. But I have not done anything good for myself on that basis.

original: gzhan gyi don ma byas kyi gal te sems can de dag thams cad kyis phyi ma'i mthar bdag gi lus gshegs gtubs rnam par gtor rnam par bcom pa de lta bur gyur kyang bdag gis @105a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ma byas kyi gal te sems can de dag thams cad kyis phyi ma'i mthar bdag gi lus gshegs gtubs rnam par gtor rnam par bcom pa de lta bur gyur kyang bdag gis @105a * //
translated: If all those sentient beings were to cut, break, and destroy my body until the end of time,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: I would not give up on omniscience.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: I would not give up on all sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i chos 'dod pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos 'dod pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: I would not give up on the desire for wholesome states.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: lus gtubs pa'i lus kyi gnod pa 'di thams cad kyis ni sems can dmyal ba pa'i sdug bsngal gyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod do //
analyzed: lus gtubs pa'i lus kyi gnod pa 'di thams cad kyis ni sems can dmyal ba pa'i sdug bsngal gyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod do //
translated: Because all the harm to the body, the cutting up of the body, does not amount to even a hundredth of the suffering of the hells, and so on up to: it is not even bearable as a comparison.

original: bdag ni sems can dmyal bar gnas par spro'i bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos gtang bar ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sems can dmyal bar gnas par spro'i bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos gtang bar ni mi bya'o //
translated: I would rather stay in the hells than give up the Dharma of the Buddhas.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: gang gi gzhi las gnod sems byung ba'i chos de bdag gis spang bar bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: gang gi gzhi las gnod sems byung ba'i chos de bdag gis spang bar bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will give up the things that are the basis for ill will.

original: chos de gang zhe na ;
analyzed: chos de gang zhe na ;
translated: What is that Dharma?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: lus la dga' ba dang lus la gnas pa dang lus la chags pa ste /
analyzed: lus la dga' ba dang lus la gnas pa dang lus la chags pa ste /
translated: delight in the body, dwelling in the body, and attachment to the body.

original: lus gtang na gnod sems kyang gtong ngo //
analyzed: lus gtang na gnod sems kyang gtong ngo //
translated: If you give up the body, you also give up malice.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho de ltar chos 'grang ba la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa bzod de mi skyo mi khro'o //
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho de ltar chos 'grang ba la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa bzod de mi skyo mi khro'o //
translated: Sāgaramati, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has thus entered the reckoning of Dharma will endure the harm of all sentient beings without weariness or anger.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The same is true of the other four aggregates.🔽

original: blo gros rgya mtsho de la thabs mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lus gcod pa ni /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho de la thabs mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lus gcod pa ni /
translated: Sāgaramati, the bodhisattva skilled in means who cuts up the body

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: will perfect the cultivation of the six perfections.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lus gcod pa na /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lus gcod pa na /
translated: Sāgaramati, how does the bodhisattva skilled in means who cuts up the body

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: perfect the cultivation of the six perfections?

original: gang lus 'dor ba dang lus yongs su gtong ba dang lus la mi lta ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gang lus 'dor ba dang lus yongs su gtong ba dang lus la mi lta ba 'di ni /
translated: Giving up the body, giving up the body completely, and not looking at the body—

original: de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is his perfection of generosity.

original: gang lus gcod pa na sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par byed pa dang / tshor ba rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa 'di ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang lus gcod pa na sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par byed pa dang / tshor ba rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa 'di ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the morality of one who, while his body is being cut up, pervades all sentient beings with loving kindness and is not carried away by feelings.

original: gang lus yongs su gcod pa na gang dag de'i lus gcod pa de dag nyid rab tu thar bar bya ba'i phyir bzod cing sems kyis rma mi 'byin te /🔽bzod pa'i stobs nye bar ston pa 'di ni de'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang lus yongs su gcod pa na gang dag de'i lus gcod pa de dag nyid rab tu thar bar bya ba'i phyir bzod cing sems kyis rma mi 'byin te / bzod pa'i stobs nye bar ston pa 'di ni de'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is the patience of one who, while his body is being cut up, does not allow his mind to be injured, but remains patient in order to liberate those who are cutting up his body.

original: brtson 'grus gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa de la 'dod pa mi 'dor zhing sems kyi stobs bskyed pa yang rab tu 'dzin la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa de la 'dod pa mi 'dor zhing sems kyi stobs bskyed pa yang rab tu 'dzin la /
translated: The perfection of effort is the effort of one who, by means of his effort, does not abandon his desire for omniscience, and who maintains the strength of his mind,

original: 'khor ba'i rjes su yang 'brang zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsam pa yang rtsom pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rjes su yang 'brang zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsam pa yang rtsom pa 'di ni /
translated: while following the course of cyclic existence and undertaking the roots of virtue.

original: de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is the meditation of one who, while his body is being cut up, does not abandon the meditative absorption of the bodhisattvas, but remains in meditative absorption in order to liberate those who are cutting up his body.

original: gang lus rnam par 'dor ba na thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa rin po che de mi brjod cing byang chub nyid la lta ba @105b dang ; zhi ba dang rab tu zhi ba la so sor rtog pa 'di ni de'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang lus rnam par 'dor ba na thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa rin po che de mi brjod cing byang chub nyid la lta ba @105b dang ; zhi ba dang rab tu zhi ba la so sor rtog pa 'di ni de'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: When they give up their bodies, they do not abandon the precious thought of awakening, but look to awakening itself, and discern peace and complete peace. This is their perfection of meditative stability.

original: gang lus gcod pa na lus la rtsva dang rtsig pa dang shing dang rdo dang mig yor lta bur so sor rtog cing /
analyzed: gang lus gcod pa na lus la rtsva dang rtsig pa dang shing dang rdo dang mig yor lta bur so sor rtog cing /
translated: When their bodies are being cut up, they discern that the body is like grass, a wall, a piece of wood, a stone, or a reflection.

original: lus la sgyu ma'i chos nyid du 'jug pa dang yang dag par na mi rtag pa nyid dang yang dag par na sdug bsngal ba nyid dang yang dag par na bdag med pa nyid dang / yang dag par na zhi ba nyid du lus la rtog pa 'di ni /
analyzed: lus la sgyu ma'i chos nyid du 'jug pa dang yang dag par na mi rtag pa nyid dang yang dag par na sdug bsngal ba nyid dang yang dag par na bdag med pa nyid dang / yang dag par na zhi ba nyid du lus la rtog pa 'di ni /
translated: They discern the body as having the nature of an illusion, and in reality as impermanent, in reality as suffering, in reality as not a self, and in reality as peaceful.

original: de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is their perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: gzhan yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, they think as follows:

original: sems can 'di ni le lo can dge ba'i chos dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: sems can 'di ni le lo can dge ba'i chos dang bral ba ste /
translated: This being is lazy and lacks virtuous qualities.

original: de ni bdag la mtshang 'bru zhing gshe ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag la mtshang 'bru zhing gshe ba'o //
translated: He is reproaching and reviling me.

original: bdag ni brtson 'grus brtsam par bya /
analyzed: bdag ni brtson 'grus brtsam par bya /
translated: I will undertake perseverance.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su btsal bar brtson pa la mi ngoms par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su btsal bar brtson pa la mi ngoms par bya ste /
translated: I will be insatiable in my efforts to seek the roots of virtue.

original: sems can 'di byang chub kyi snying por sngar je 'dug par byas la /
analyzed: sems can 'di byang chub kyi snying por sngar je 'dug par byas la /
translated: I will first establish this being on the seat of awakening,

original: phyis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
translated: and only then will I fully awaken to unsurpassed and complete buddhahood.

original: snyam du de ltar go cha gyon pa 'di ni /
analyzed: snyam du de ltar go cha gyon pa 'di ni /
translated: Such is the donning of armor.

original: de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of perseverance.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽sems can ma dul ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / sems can ma dul ba /
translated: And so on, up to

original: ma zhi ba /🔽ma sbas pa /
analyzed: ma zhi ba / ma sbas pa /
translated: “These beings are undisciplined,🔽unpeaceful,

original: nye bar ma zhi ba /
analyzed: nye bar ma zhi ba /
translated: unprotected,🔽and unpacified.

original: 'di lta bu 'di dag gi don du bdag gis go cha chen po bgos te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu 'di dag gi don du bdag gis go cha chen po bgos te /
translated: I will don the great armor for their sake.

original: 'di ltar sems nges par sems su gzhug go snyam pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems nges par sems su gzhug go snyam pa 'di ni /
translated: I will definitely think this way.”

original: de'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is his perfection of meditative stability.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: bdag ni chos nyid la brten par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag ni chos nyid la brten par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: I should rely on the true nature of things.

original: de la gshe ba dang khro ba su yin zhes des yongs su tshol ba na gang gshe ba dang khro ba'i chos de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de la gshe ba dang khro ba su yin zhes des yongs su tshol ba na gang gshe ba dang khro ba'i chos de mi dmigs so //
translated: When he searches for who is insulting and who is angry, he does not find any phenomenon of insult or anger.

original: de bdag dang gzhan mi dmigs pas dmigs par lta ba dang bral bar bzod pa 'di ni ;
analyzed: de bdag dang gzhan mi dmigs pas dmigs par lta ba dang bral bar bzod pa 'di ni ;
translated: Since he does not find self or other, he is free from the view that there is something to be attained. This is his patience.

original: de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is his perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma las kyang gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed Lady also says,

original: 'di ltar bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi rtsod pa dor bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi rtsod pa dor bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, I should remove all conflict among sentient beings.

original: bdag nyid rtsod par byed dam /
analyzed: bdag nyid rtsod par byed dam /
translated: Do I myself create conflict?

original: bdag gang smra ba la slar smra na ni /
analyzed: bdag gang smra ba la slar smra na ni /
translated: If I speak in return when someone speaks to me,

original: bdag gis ma rnyed pa dang nyes pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis ma rnyed pa dang nyes pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: I will not find what I want and will find what I do not want.

original: ji ltar bdag gis ni sems can thams cad kyi zam pa lta bur bya na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis ni sems can thams cad kyi zam pa lta bur bya na /
translated: How can I be like a bridge for all sentient beings?

original: bdag gzhan la khyod ces bya ba'i tshig gam tshig rtsub po smra bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag gzhan la khyod ces bya ba'i tshig gam tshig rtsub po smra bar bya ba'am /
translated: I will not speak to others in a way that is harsh or offensive.

original: 'di ni bdag gis smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gis smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: I will not speak in this way.

original: 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa'i nang du bdag gis bem po lta bu dang / lug ltar lkugs pa lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa'i nang du bdag gis bem po lta bu dang / lug ltar lkugs pa lta bur bya'o //
translated: In the midst of disputes and arguments, I will be like a block of wood or a mute sheep.

original: @106a * // gzhan gyis ngan du smras pa dang ngan du brjod pa'i tshig gi lan thos na sems kyi kun du gnod sems su mi bya'o //

analyzed: gang bdag gis gzhan dag gi nyes pa gzhan mnyam par bsams pa de ni bdag gi cha ma yin no //

original: bdag gis bsam pa rnam par 'khrugs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bsam pa rnam par 'khrugs par mi bya'o //

original: 'di ltar bdag gis ni sems can thams cad bde bar sbyar ba thams cad kyis bde bar bya zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ste /

original: mya ngan las 'das par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par bya ba yin na /

original: de la bdag gnod sems su byed dam /

original: 'di ni bdag gis bya ba'i cha yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gis bya ba'i cha yin te /

analyzed: bdag gis khro gnyer can gyi bzhin dbyung bar mi bya'o zhes de ltar sems bskyed do zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: chos kyis tshim par byed do zhes gsungs so // bslab pa kun las btus pa las /

translated: Vimalatejas, for bodhisattva great beings who are eager for the Dharma, the Dharma treasure, which is hidden in the mountains and forests, and which is in the form of the Dharma scrolls, will come into their hands.

analyzed: 'phags pas kun shes pa'i rnam pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams mos par byed pa'i rnam pa dang / bden pa mthong ba'i rnam pa dang / phung po'i nyes pa spang ba'i rnam pa dang / 'dus byas kyi nyes pa yongs su 'jal ba'i rnam pa dang /
translated: the aspect of the noble ones’ complete understanding, the aspect of inspiring the non-noble ones, the aspect of seeing the truth, the aspect of abandoning the faults of the aggregates, the aspect of fully comprehending the faults of conditioned things,

original: don la brten pa'i rnam pa dang ; chos la brten pa'i rnam pa dang / ye shes la brten pa'i rnam pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la brten pa'i rnam pa dang / sdig pa thams cad mi bya ba'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: don la brten pa'i rnam pa dang ; chos la brten pa'i rnam pa dang / ye shes la brten pa'i rnam pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la brten pa'i rnam pa dang / sdig pa thams cad mi bya ba'i rnam pa dang /
translated: the aspect of relying on the meaning, the aspect of relying on the Dharma, the aspect of relying on wisdom, the aspect of relying on the sūtras of definitive meaning, the aspect of not committing any negative actions,

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i rnam pa dang / legs par byas pa'i las kyi rnam pa dang / mi 'gyod pa'i rnam pa dang / bye brag tu 'gro ba'i rnam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'thob pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i rnam pa dang / legs par byas pa'i las kyi rnam pa dang / mi 'gyod pa'i rnam pa dang / bye brag tu 'gro ba'i rnam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'thob pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: the aspect of benefiting oneself and others, the aspect of virtuous actions, the aspect of being free from regret, the aspect of making progress, and the aspect of attaining all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thos pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thos pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu zhes gsungs so //
translated: These are the bodhisattvas' eighty kinds of learning.

original: yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: The same text says:

original: gang chos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba de ni de'i ye shes kyi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: gang chos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba de ni de'i ye shes kyi tshogs yin no //
translated: The application to the collection of teachings is the collection of wisdom.

original: de la chos kyi tshogs su sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos kyi tshogs su sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the application to the collection of teachings?

original: gang 'di ni don nyung ba dang smra ba nyung ba dang yo byad nyung ba dang srod dang tho rangs la mi nyal zhing rnal 'byor la brtson bas /
analyzed: gang 'di ni don nyung ba dang smra ba nyung ba dang yo byad nyung ba dang srod dang tho rangs la mi nyal zhing rnal 'byor la brtson bas /
translated: It is having few desires, speaking little, having few possessions, not sleeping in the late evening and before dawn, and being diligent in practice.

original: thos pa'i don la rtogs pa dang / yang dang yang tshol ba dang / sems la rnyog pa med pa dang / sgrib pa rnams gnon pa dang / ltung ba rnams las 'byung ba shes shing 'gyod pa med pa dang kun nas ldang ba med pa dang /
analyzed: thos pa'i don la rtogs pa dang / yang dang yang tshol ba dang / sems la rnyog pa med pa dang / sgrib pa rnams gnon pa dang / ltung ba rnams las 'byung ba shes shing 'gyod pa med pa dang kun nas ldang ba med pa dang /
translated: It is understanding the meaning of what one has learned, seeking it again and again, having a mind free of turbidity, overcoming the obscurations, knowing how to rise above downfalls without regret or agitation,

original: nan tan snying por byed pa dang / chos la gzhol pa dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / chos la bab pa dang / mthu dang ldan pa dang / ye shes tshol ba la mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba lta bu dang / de la ma chags par gnas pa dang /
analyzed: nan tan snying por byed pa dang / chos la gzhol pa dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / chos la bab pa dang / mthu dang ldan pa dang / ye shes tshol ba la mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba lta bu dang / de la ma chags par gnas pa dang /
translated: 1.6. seeking wisdom as if one’s head or clothes were on fire,🔽1.7. abiding without attachment,🔽1.8. not being lax in one’s ethics,🔽1.9. not giving up one’s striving,🔽1.10. being particular,

original: tshul khrims mi lhod pa dang / brtson pa mi gtong ba dang / bye brag tu 'gro ba dang / 'du 'dzi la mi dga' ba dang / gcig pur dga' ba dang / dgon pa la mngon par phyogs shing yid la byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i rigs kyis chog shes pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims mi lhod pa dang / brtson pa mi gtong ba dang / bye brag tu 'gro ba dang / 'du 'dzi la mi dga' ba dang / gcig pur dga' ba dang / dgon pa la mngon par phyogs shing yid la byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i rigs kyis chog shes pa dang /
translated: 1.11. not enjoying crowds,🔽1.12. enjoying solitude,🔽1.13. being inclined to and intent on the wilderness,🔽1.14. being content with the lineage of the noble ones,🔽1.15. not wavering from the ascetic qualities,

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan las mi g-yo ba dang / chos kyi dga' ba @108a * //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan las mi g-yo ba dang / chos kyi dga' ba @108a * //
translated: 1.16. delighting in the Dharma,🔽1.17.

original: la dga' zhing mos pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i sngags dran par mi byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos tshol ba dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / don rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / blo gros kyi lam dang mthun pa dang /
analyzed: la dga' zhing mos pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i sngags dran par mi byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos tshol ba dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / don rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / blo gros kyi lam dang mthun pa dang /
translated: They are to be joyful and interested, not to remember worldly mantras, to seek supramundane qualities, to be undiminished in mindfulness, to follow the realization of the meaning, to be in accord with the path of intelligence,

original: bstan pas sngom pa dang / rkyen gyis ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha shes pa sa brgyan pa dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba lhur byed pa dang / mi shes pa sel ba dang /
analyzed: bstan pas sngom pa dang / rkyen gyis ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha shes pa sa brgyan pa dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba lhur byed pa dang / mi shes pa sel ba dang /
translated: to be in accord with the vows of the teachings, to follow the wisdom of conditions, to be adorned with shame and modesty, to be dedicated to following wisdom, to dispel ignorance,

original: ma rig pa dang / gti mug gi mun pa dang rab rib kyi mun pas chod pa bsal ba dang / shes rab kyi mig rnam par dag pa dang / blo shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ; blo rgya che ba dang / blo ma zhum pa dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / gti mug gi mun pa dang rab rib kyi mun pas chod pa bsal ba dang / shes rab kyi mig rnam par dag pa dang / blo shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ; blo rgya che ba dang / blo ma zhum pa dang /
translated: to dispel the darkness of ignorance and the darkness of the obscurations of delusion, to have the pure eye of insight, to have a very pure mind, to have a vast mind, to have an undiminished mind,🔽and to have a mind that is not attached to the world.

original: blo ma gyes pa dang / mngon sum du shes pa dang / yon tan gzhan la rag ma lus pa dang / bdag gi yon tan mi bsnyems pa dang / gzhan gyi yon tan kun la brjod pa dang / legs par bya ba'i las byed pa dang /
analyzed: blo ma gyes pa dang / mngon sum du shes pa dang / yon tan gzhan la rag ma lus pa dang / bdag gi yon tan mi bsnyems pa dang / gzhan gyi yon tan kun la brjod pa dang / legs par bya ba'i las byed pa dang /
translated: knowing directly, not depending on others’ qualities, not being arrogant about one’s own qualities, praising the qualities of all others, doing good deeds,

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'gal bar mi byed pa dang / las yongs su dag pa'i ye shes 'di ni /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'gal bar mi byed pa dang / las yongs su dag pa'i ye shes 'di ni /
translated: not contradicting the ripening of karma, and the wisdom of purified karma.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this is called the bodhisattvas’ imperishable accumulation of wisdom.”

original: ci mnyan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci mnyan par bya zhe na /
translated: What should be studied?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Blessed One said in the Sūtra of Vast Wisdom:

original: don dang bcas pa'i gzhon nu rtse ba'i bstan bcos rnams bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: don dang bcas pa'i gzhon nu rtse ba'i bstan bcos rnams bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Study the treatises that are meaningful and are taught for the amusement of princes.

original: don med pa rnams yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: don med pa rnams yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: Abandon those that are meaningless.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i bstan bcos rnams dang / chad pa'i tshul gyi bstan bcos rnams dang / byad stems kyi bstan bcos rnams dang / smra ba'i rig pa'i bstan bcos rnams dang / gzhon nu rtse ba'i bstan bcos rnams dang / rmugs byed kyi rig pa'i bstan bcos rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i bstan bcos rnams dang / chad pa'i tshul gyi bstan bcos rnams dang / byad stems kyi bstan bcos rnams dang / smra ba'i rig pa'i bstan bcos rnams dang / gzhon nu rtse ba'i bstan bcos rnams dang / rmugs byed kyi rig pa'i bstan bcos rnams so //
translated: the treatises of the materialists, the treatises of nihilism, the treatises of astrology, the treatises of rhetoric, the treatises of children’s games, and the treatises of magic spells.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽de las gzhan pa gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / de las gzhan pa gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: And so on.

original: rnam par thar pa dang mi mthun pa'i bstan bcos shes pa rmongs par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pas spang bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang mi mthun pa'i bstan bcos shes pa rmongs par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pas spang bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Whatever other treatises there are that are not in accord with liberation, that cause delusion, all of them should be abandoned by those who have set out in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar thos pa dang ldan pa sems sbyang ba'i phyir dgon par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thos pa dang ldan pa sems sbyang ba'i phyir dgon par gnas par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having become learned in this way, in order to train the mind, one should live in the forest.

original: drag shul can gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: drag shul can gyis zhus pa las /
translated: As the Sūtra of the Questions of Ugra says,

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa la yang khyim gnang ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa la yang khyim gnang ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the Buddha permitted household life for those who are not fully intent on liberation?

original: 'bad pa dang ldan mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad pa dang ldan mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not capable of striving.

original: 'o na gzhan @108b gyi chung ma la yang ltung ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na gzhan @108b gyi chung ma la yang ltung ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But then there would be no offense in having intercourse with another’s wife.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: No, because

original: de dag la mi nus su zin kyang rang bzhin gyis skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la mi nus su zin kyang rang bzhin gyis skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: even if they are not capable, they would be by nature at fault.

original: khyim du gnas pa ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //🔽bslab pa kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: khyim du gnas pa ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i phyir ro // bslab pa kun las btus pa las /
translated: But household life is associated with proscribed offenses.

original: brtson 'grus kyi le'u ste bcu pa'o /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi le'u ste bcu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on effort, the tenth of the Compendium of Trainings.

original: // / de ltar na drag shul can gyis zhus pa'i tshul gyis khyim gyi skyon rnams bsgoms te dgon pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: // / de ltar na drag shul can gyis zhus pa'i tshul gyis khyim gyi skyon rnams bsgoms te dgon pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, as explained in the Inquiry of Ugra, you should meditate on the faults of household life and live in the forest.

original: ji skad du zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las //
analyzed: ji skad du zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las //
translated: As the Candrapradīpa Sūtra says,

original: 'dod pa dag ni rab tu sten byed cing //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag ni rab tu sten byed cing //
translated: Those who enjoy sensual pleasures,

original: bu dang chung ma dag la sred byed na //
analyzed: bu dang chung ma dag la sred byed na //
translated: and are attached to wives and children,

original: smad par bya ba'i khyim la brten pa de //
analyzed: smad par bya ba'i khyim la brten pa de //
translated: “Those who live in a household that is to be disparaged

original: nam yang bla med byang chub mchog mi 'thob //
analyzed: nam yang bla med byang chub mchog mi 'thob //
translated: Will never attain the unsurpassed, supreme enlightenment.

original: gang dag 'dod pa lci skam me bzhin spong //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod pa lci skam me bzhin spong //
translated: Those who abandon desire like a blazing fire,

original: bu dang chung ma dag la sred spangs nas //
analyzed: bu dang chung ma dag la sred spangs nas //
translated: And abandon craving for children and wives,

original: khyim gyis skrag ste khyim nas mngon byung ba //
analyzed: khyim gyis skrag ste khyim nas mngon byung ba //
translated: Terrified of the household, they go forth from the household—

original: de dag byang chub mchog 'di rnyed mi dka' //
analyzed: de dag byang chub mchog 'di rnyed mi dka' //
translated: For them, this supreme enlightenment is not difficult to attain.

original: gang dag khyim na gnas par byed bzhin du //
analyzed: gang dag khyim na gnas par byed bzhin du //
translated: Those who, while living in a household,

original: byang chub dam pa mchog 'di 'thob pa yi //
analyzed: byang chub dam pa mchog 'di 'thob pa yi //
translated: Attain this supreme, excellent enlightenment,

original: sangs rgyas gang dag sngon chad ma byung ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gang dag sngon chad ma byung ste //
translated: Buddhas who did not appear in the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa na'ang mi 'byung gnas pa med //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na'ang mi 'byung gnas pa med //
translated: Will not appear in the future, and do not remain in the present.

original: rgyal srid mchil ma'i thal ba bzhin spangs nas //
analyzed: rgyal srid mchil ma'i thal ba bzhin spangs nas //
translated: Abandoning the kingdom like a drop of spit,

original: dben pa 'dod des dgon par gnas byed pa //
analyzed: dben pa 'dod des dgon par gnas byed pa //
translated: Those who desire solitude live in the wilderness.

original: nyon mongs spangs nas bdud ni bcom nas su //
analyzed: nyon mongs spangs nas bdud ni bcom nas su //
translated: Having abandoned the afflictions and defeated Māra,

original: byang chub rdul med 'dus ma byas 'tshang rgya //
analyzed: byang chub rdul med 'dus ma byas 'tshang rgya //
translated: They attain enlightenment, which is free from dust and unconditioned.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te ;
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te ;
translated: And so on.

original: rab tu byung nas chos spyod ci 'dra ba //
analyzed: rab tu byung nas chos spyod ci 'dra ba //
translated: “What is the practice of the Dharma like for those who have gone forth?

original: zas dang skom dang de bzhin gos rnams dang // me tog spos dang phreng ba rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: zas dang skom dang de bzhin gos rnams dang // me tog spos dang phreng ba rnams kyis ni //
translated: with flowers, incense, and garlands,

original: khyu mchog rnams la bsnyen bkur byas mi 'gyur //
analyzed: khyu mchog rnams la bsnyen bkur byas mi 'gyur //
translated: they do not serve the best of people.

original: gang zhig byang chub rab tu 'dod byed cing //🔽'dus byas ngan las yid byung sems can gyi //
analyzed: gang zhig byang chub rab tu 'dod byed cing // 'dus byas ngan las yid byung sems can gyi //
translated: But those who aspire to awakening,🔽who are disgusted with the evil of conditioned existence,

original: don du dgon par phyogs te gom bdun bor //
analyzed: don du dgon par phyogs te gom bdun bor //
translated: and who take seven steps toward the wilderness for the sake of sentient beings

original: 'di ni de bas bsod nams khyad par 'phags //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni de bas bsod nams khyad par 'phags // zhes gsungs so //
translated: have merit that is superior to that.
