original: gal te skal ba mi 'dra ba'i sems can la rjes su chags pa dang 'khor 'dod pa dang rnyed pa la sogs pa 'dod pas dben pa'i phyogs na sdod na /
analyzed: gal te skal ba mi 'dra ba'i sems can la rjes su chags pa dang 'khor 'dod pa dang rnyed pa la sogs pa 'dod pas dben pa'i phyogs na sdod na /
translated: If you live in a secluded place, free from attachment to sentient beings who are of a different fortune, free from desire for a circle of followers, free from desire for wealth, and so on,

original: de'i phyir 'di las gsungs ba /🔽'di dag bdag la gnod sems ldan pa zhes //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di las gsungs ba / 'di dag bdag la gnod sems ldan pa zhes //
translated: then you should act as stated in the following.🔽The wise do not dispute with fools,

original: mkhas pas byis pa rnams dang rtsod mi byed //
analyzed: mkhas pas byis pa rnams dang rtsod mi byed //
translated: thinking, “They are hostile toward me.”

original: bsti stang byas te byis pa yongs su spong //
analyzed: bsti stang byas te byis pa yongs su spong //
translated: They respectfully avoid fools,

original: byis pa'i chos la 'dris par yongs mi byed //
analyzed: byis pa'i chos la 'dris par yongs mi byed //
translated: and do not associate with the qualities of fools.

original: byis pa ji srid yun rings legs bsten kyang //
analyzed: byis pa ji srid yun rings legs bsten kyang //
translated: “Even if you care for fools a very long time,

original: de dag phyir zhing mi mdza' 'gras 'gyur zhes //🔽byis pa'i ngo @109a * //
analyzed: de dag phyir zhing mi mdza' 'gras 'gyur zhes // byis pa'i ngo @109a * //
translated: they will turn hostile and antagonistic.”

original: bo nyid kyi rgyus shes nas //
analyzed: bo nyid kyi rgyus shes nas //
translated: Knowing the nature of fools,

original: mkhas pa byis pa dag dang sten mi byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa byis pa dag dang sten mi byed //
translated: the wise do not associate with fools.

original: byis pa rang bzhin ngo bo tha dad de //
analyzed: byis pa rang bzhin ngo bo tha dad de //
translated: “Fools are different by their very nature;

original: so so'i skye bo rnams la mdza' med ces //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams la mdza' med ces //
translated: there is no friendship with ordinary people.”

original: byis pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid shes nas //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid shes nas //
translated: Knowing the nature of fools,

original: mkhas pa 'dir byis pa rnams la yid mi rton //
analyzed: mkhas pa 'dir byis pa rnams la yid mi rton //
translated: the wise do not trust fools.

original: chos dang mthun pa'i tshig gis smras gyur kyang //
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa'i tshig gis smras gyur kyang //
translated: “Even if they speak words that accord with the Dharma,

original: khro dang zhe sdang yid mi ches ba dag / rab tu smra ste 'di ni byis pa'i chos //
analyzed: khro dang zhe sdang yid mi ches ba dag / rab tu smra ste 'di ni byis pa'i chos //
translated: they are very angry and hateful, and cannot be trusted. This is the way of fools.”

original: don de rnam par shes nas yid mi rton //
analyzed: don de rnam par shes nas yid mi rton //
translated: Knowing this point, do not trust them.

original: byis pa rnams ni byis pa dag dang mtshungs //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni byis pa dag dang mtshungs //
translated: “Fools are like fools,

original: dper na ngan skyugs dang ni ngan skyugs bzhin //
analyzed: dper na ngan skyugs dang ni ngan skyugs bzhin //
translated: like vomit on vomit.”

original: mkhas pa rnams ni mkhas pa dang lhan cig ste //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni mkhas pa dang lhan cig ste //
translated: “The wise are like the wise,🔽like ghee in butter.”

original: mar dang mar gyi nyid khur mtshungs pa bzhin //
analyzed: mar dang mar gyi nyid khur mtshungs pa bzhin //
translated: Like butter and churned cream.

original: zhes bya'o // de skad du yang de nyid las //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de skad du yang de nyid las //
translated: And the same text says,

original: gang dag dga' dang mi dga' cung zad med //
analyzed: gang dag dga' dang mi dga' cung zad med //
translated: Those who have no likes or dislikes

original: de dag mi yi 'jig rten rtag rab bde //
analyzed: de dag mi yi 'jig rten rtag rab bde //
translated: Are always happy in the human world.

original: gang dag nags dang ri sul la dga' ba //
analyzed: gang dag nags dang ri sul la dga' ba //
translated: Those who delight in forests and mountain retreats

original: dge sbyong nyid kyi rab bde myong bar 'gyur //🔽gang dag bdag gir byed pa ci yang med //
analyzed: dge sbyong nyid kyi rab bde myong bar 'gyur // gang dag bdag gir byed pa ci yang med //
translated: Experience the happiness of being a spiritual practitioner.🔽Those who have no possessions at all

original: gang dag yongs 'dzin rnam pa kun tu med //
analyzed: gang dag yongs 'dzin rnam pa kun tu med //
translated: And have no property in any form

original: bse ru lta bur 'jig rten 'dir gnas pa //
analyzed: bse ru lta bur 'jig rten 'dir gnas pa //
translated: Live in this world like rhinoceroses,

original: de dag nam mkha' la ni rlung ltar 'gro //
analyzed: de dag nam mkha' la ni rlung ltar 'gro //
translated: Moving like the wind through the sky.

original: gang dag 'jig rten la ni yid mi chags //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten la ni yid mi chags //
translated: Those who have no mental attachment to the world

original: de dag mi yi 'jig rten rab tu bde //
analyzed: de dag mi yi 'jig rten rab tu bde //
translated: Are happy in the human world.

original: dga' dang mi dga' la ni chags med pa //
analyzed: dga' dang mi dga' la ni chags med pa //
translated: Those who are not attached to likes and dislikes

original: de dag 'di na rtag tu sems rlung 'dra //🔽gang dag mi sdug de phrad sdug bsngal te //
analyzed: de dag 'di na rtag tu sems rlung 'dra // gang dag mi sdug de phrad sdug bsngal te //
translated: Always have minds like the wind.🔽It is suffering to meet with what is unpleasant;

original: gang dag sdug de dang bral sdug bsngal yin //
analyzed: gang dag sdug de dang bral sdug bsngal yin //
translated: It is suffering to be separated from what is pleasant.

original: mtha' de gnyi ga rab tu spangs nas su //
analyzed: mtha' de gnyi ga rab tu spangs nas su //
translated: Having abandoned both extremes,

original: mi gang chos la dga' ba de dag bde //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi gang chos la dga' ba de dag bde // zhes gsungs so //
translated: those who delight in the Dharma are happy.

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: And the same text says:

original: nyes pa'i tshogs mang thams cad spangs nas su //
analyzed: nyes pa'i tshogs mang thams cad spangs nas su //
translated: Having abandoned the many faults,

original: rnal 'byor can ni rtag tu byed pa nyung //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can ni rtag tu byed pa nyung //
translated: the yogi is always of little activity.

original: rnal 'byor can brtson nam yang rtsod pa med //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can brtson nam yang rtsod pa med //
translated: The yogi, being diligent, is never quarrelsome.

original: dgon par gnas pa de yi yon tan 'di //
analyzed: dgon par gnas pa de yi yon tan 'di //
translated: This is the quality of dwelling in the wilderness.

original: de ni rtag tu 'dus byas yid 'byung 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu 'dus byas yid 'byung 'gyur //
translated: He is always disgusted with conditioned things.

original: de ni 'jig rten ci la'ang 'dod pa med //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten ci la'ang 'dod pa med //
translated: He has no desire for anything in the world.

original: zag pa dag ni rnam par 'phel mi 'gyur //
analyzed: zag pa dag ni rnam par 'phel mi 'gyur //
translated: His defilements do not increase.

original: nags na gnas pa 'di yi yon tan 'di //
analyzed: nags na gnas pa 'di yi yon tan 'di //
translated: This is the quality of dwelling in the wilderness.

original: de ni nam yang rtsod par mi 'gyur te//
analyzed: de ni nam yang rtsod par mi 'gyur te//
translated: He never quarrels,

original: rtag tu zhi zhing dga' la dben par rgyu //
analyzed: rtag tu zhi zhing dga' la dben par rgyu //
translated: always peaceful, joyful, and solitary.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyang rab bsdam 'gyur //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyang rab bsdam 'gyur //
translated: He restrains his body, speech, and mind.

original: dgon par gnas pa 'di la yon tan mang //🔽de ni thar pa'i rjes su mthun pa yin //
analyzed: dgon par gnas pa 'di la yon tan mang // de ni thar pa'i rjes su mthun pa yin //
translated: Dwelling in the wilderness has many qualities.🔽It is conducive to liberation.

original: de ni rnam 'grol zhi ba myur rtogs byed //
analyzed: de ni rnam 'grol zhi ba myur rtogs byed //
translated: It quickly brings the realization of the peace of liberation.

original: nags na gnas shing rnam 'grol sten byed na //
analyzed: nags na gnas shing rnam 'grol sten byed na //
translated: If you live in the forest and practice liberation,

original: dgon gnas de la yon tan 'di kun @109b 'byung ;🔽/ zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dgon gnas de la yon tan 'di kun @109b 'byung ; / zhes gsungs so //
translated: all these good qualities will arise in you.

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: And the same text says:

original: grong dang grong khyer dag la dga' spangs la //
analyzed: grong dang grong khyer dag la dga' spangs la //
translated: Abandon delight in towns and cities,

original: rtag tu dben zhing nags khrod bsten par gyis //
analyzed: rtag tu dben zhing nags khrod bsten par gyis //
translated: always be solitary and live in the forest.

original: bse ru lta bur rtag tu gnyis med byos //
analyzed: bse ru lta bur rtag tu gnyis med byos //
translated: Always be like a rhinoceros, alone.

original: ring por mi thogs ting 'dzin mchog thob 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ring por mi thogs ting 'dzin mchog thob 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Before long you will attain the highest meditative absorption.

original: 'phags pa yul 'khor skyong gis zhus pa'i mdo las kyang //
analyzed: 'phags pa yul 'khor skyong gis zhus pa'i mdo las kyang //
translated: The noble Sūtra on the Questions of Rāṣṭrapāla also says:

original: skyon gyis gzings pa mtha' yas ldan pa'i khyim spangs rtag tu nor mi lta //
analyzed: skyon gyis gzings pa mtha' yas ldan pa'i khyim spangs rtag tu nor mi lta //
translated: “Rāṣṭrapāla, those who have left behind the home life, which is full of endless troubles, should never look back.

original: des shing yon tan ldan pa de dag dgon par dga' zhing dbang po dul //
analyzed: des shing yon tan ldan pa de dag dgon par dga' zhing dbang po dul //
translated: Those gentle ones, who have the qualities, delight in the forest, and have controlled their senses,

original: de dag gang du'ang bud med rnams dang skyes pa dag dang 'dris mi byed //
analyzed: de dag gang du'ang bud med rnams dang skyes pa dag dang 'dris mi byed //
translated: should not associate with women or men anywhere.

original: bse ltar gcig pur gnas shing bsam pa dri med dag la dri ma bral //
analyzed: bse ltar gcig pur gnas shing bsam pa dri med dag la dri ma bral //
translated: Like a rhinoceros, they should live alone, with pure intentions, free from defilements.”

original: de dag thob pa rnams kyis dga' bar mi 'gyur ma thob yid zhum med //
analyzed: de dag thob pa rnams kyis dga' bar mi 'gyur ma thob yid zhum med //
translated: They are not pleased by their gains, nor are they downcast by their losses.

original: 'dod pa chung ste ngan ngon tsam la dga' zhing sgyu dang tshul 'chos spongs //
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ste ngan ngon tsam la dga' zhing sgyu dang tshul 'chos spongs //
translated: They have few desires, and are content with whatever they get. They give up deceit and hypocrisy.

original: sems can don phyir brtson 'grus yid ldan sbyin dang dul ba la yang gnas //
analyzed: sems can don phyir brtson 'grus yid ldan sbyin dang dul ba la yang gnas //
translated: They are diligent for the sake of sentient beings, and they are patient and generous.

original: sangs rgyas ye shes don gnyer bsam gtan brtson 'grus yon tan pha rol phyin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes don gnyer bsam gtan brtson 'grus yon tan pha rol phyin //
translated: They are diligent in the wisdom of the buddhas, and they perfect concentration.

original: lus dang de bzhin srog la mi lta sdug pa'i rtsa lag rnam spangs te //
analyzed: lus dang de bzhin srog la mi lta sdug pa'i rtsa lag rnam spangs te //
translated: They do not care about their bodies or even their lives, and they give up dear friends and relatives.

original: bsam pa rdo rje lta bur rab brtan rtag tu byang chub lam la sbyor //
analyzed: bsam pa rdo rje lta bur rab brtan rtag tu byang chub lam la sbyor //
translated: Their intentions are as firm as diamonds, and they always apply themselves to the path of enlightenment.

original: lus ni dum bu dum bur bcad kyang de dag sems la g-yo ba med //
analyzed: lus ni dum bu dum bur bcad kyang de dag sems la g-yo ba med //
translated: Even if their bodies are cut into pieces, their minds do not waver.

original: thams cad mkhyen nyid re ba phyir zhing brtson 'grus shin tu brtan 'dir rtsom //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen nyid re ba phyir zhing brtson 'grus shin tu brtan 'dir rtsom // zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are even more diligent in their hopes for omniscience.

original: drag shul can gyis zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: drag shul can gyis zhus pa las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra of the Questions of Ugra also says,

original: bdag ni sems can dang 'dre bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sems can dang 'dre bar mi bya'o //
translated: “I will not associate with sentient beings.”

original: bdag gis sems can gcig gi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can gcig gi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: I will not cause a single root of virtue to be produced in any sentient being.

original: gal te thos pa dang ldan pa dal ba phun sum tshogs pa 'di rnyed nas rnyed pa la sogs pa la chags pa'i sems mi sbyong na de ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten la slu ba gcig pur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te thos pa dang ldan pa dal ba phun sum tshogs pa 'di rnyed nas rnyed pa la sogs pa la chags pa'i sems mi sbyong na de ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten la slu ba gcig pur 'gyur ro //
translated: If one who has obtained this leisure of the optimum human rebirth endowed with the freedoms, and who has not purified the mind of attachment to wealth, etc., were to die, he would be the one deceiver of the world with its gods.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las kyang //
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las kyang //
translated: And in the Sutra of the Heap of Jewels:

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na mi la la zhig rgya mtsho'i chu chen pos khyer la chus skom bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed pa de bzhin du 'od srungs 'di ni dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig chos mang po blangs te kun chub par byas kyang
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na mi la la zhig rgya mtsho'i chu chen pos khyer la chus skom bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed pa de bzhin du 'od srungs 'di ni dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig chos mang po blangs te kun chub par byas kyang
translated: KaSyapa, it is like this: for example, a man might be carried away by a great flood of ocean water and die of thirst. In the same way, KaSyapa, some ascetics and Brahmins take up and master many teachings,

original: / 'dod chags la sred pa mi sel zhe sdang la srid pa mi sel gti mug la srid pa mi sel ba de dag ni chos kyi rgya mtsho chen pos khyer la /
analyzed: / 'dod chags la sred pa mi sel zhe sdang la srid pa mi sel gti mug la srid pa mi sel ba de dag ni chos kyi rgya mtsho chen pos khyer la /
translated: but do not eliminate craving for desire, do not eliminate craving for hatred, and do not eliminate craving for delusion. They are carried away by the great flood of the ocean of teachings,🔽but die of thirst, not having eliminated craving for the three realms.

original: nyon mongs pa'i skom pas 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur te /🔽ngan 'gror 'gro bar @110a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i skom pas 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur te / ngan 'gror 'gro bar @110a * //
translated: They die with the thirst of the afflictions.

original: 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: They go to the miserable destinies.

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar dgon pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar dgon pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should certainly live in the wilderness.

original: gnas de lta bu dag ni 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang /
analyzed: gnas de lta bu dag ni 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang /
translated: Such a place is also mentioned in the noble Cloud of Jewels:

original: gnas gang dag na bsod snyoms blang ba'i spyod yul dang ha cang yang mi ring ha cang yang mi nye ba dang / gnas gang dag na chu dang zhing rnyog pa med pa gtsang zhing dri ma med pa tshogs chung ba yod pa dang / gnas gang na shing phun sum tshogs pa me tog phun sum tshogs pa 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa lo ma phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: gnas gang dag na bsod snyoms blang ba'i spyod yul dang ha cang yang mi ring ha cang yang mi nye ba dang / gnas gang dag na chu dang zhing rnyog pa med pa gtsang zhing dri ma med pa tshogs chung ba yod pa dang / gnas gang na shing phun sum tshogs pa me tog phun sum tshogs pa 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa lo ma phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: “In a place where the area for alms-round is neither too far nor too near, where the water is unpolluted, clear, clean, and with little effort one can obtain roots, leaves, flowers, and fruits,

original: gcan gzan khro bo med pa phug dang ldan pa sman gshong dang ldan pa thag thug med pa 'gron bde ba zhib gnyis su med pa'i gnas de 'dra ba dag na gnas so //
analyzed: gcan gzan khro bo med pa phug dang ldan pa sman gshong dang ldan pa thag thug med pa 'gron bde ba zhib gnyis su med pa'i gnas de 'dra ba dag na gnas so //
translated: They live in places that are free from fierce wild animals, have caves, are rich in medicinal herbs, are free from danger, are easy to travel in, and are free from the two extremes.

original: de gnas de dag na gnas shing /🔽gang des sngon blangs pa dang sngon thos pa de nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du ha cang yang mi che ha cang yang mi chung ba dang / dbang po mi rgod cing phyi rol du ma song ba'i sems dang dad pas nye bar 'tsho zhing tshig nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de gnas de dag na gnas shing / gang des sngon blangs pa dang sngon thos pa de nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du ha cang yang mi che ha cang yang mi chung ba dang / dbang po mi rgod cing phyi rol du ma song ba'i sems dang dad pas nye bar 'tsho zhing tshig nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “They live in those places

original: mtshan mar 'dzin cing gnyid kyis ma log par kha ton byed do //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin cing gnyid kyis ma log par kha ton byed do //
translated: and, three times in the day and three times at night, they recite aloud, with a mind that is not distracted by external things, with a mind that is not agitated, with a mind that is not scattered externally, with a mind that is full of faith, with a mind that is full of devotion, with a mind that is not asleep, with a mind that is not distracted, with a mind that is not attached, with a mind that is not clinging, with a mind that is not attached to the characteristics of what is heard and what is recited.

original: gal te dge slong dgon pa'i drung du rgyal po'am blon po'am de ma yin pa gzhan bram ze'am rgyal rigs sam grong pa'am yul gyi mi dag 'ongs na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong dgon pa'i drung du rgyal po'am blon po'am de ma yin pa gzhan bram ze'am rgyal rigs sam grong pa'am yul gyi mi dag 'ongs na /
translated: “If a king, a king’s minister, or another person, such as a brahmin, a kṣatriya, a resident, or a local person, comes into the presence of the monk who lives in the wilderness,

original: des de dag la gus par legs par 'ongs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: des de dag la gus par legs par 'ongs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: he should respectfully say to them, ‘Welcome!’

original: des rgyal po chen po ji ltar stan bting ba la bzhugs shig ces de skad byas nas gal te 'dug na gnyi ga yang 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: des rgyal po chen po ji ltar stan bting ba la bzhugs shig ces de skad byas nas gal te 'dug na gnyi ga yang 'dug par bya'o //
translated: If the king sits down, then both should sit down.

original: de ste mi 'dug na yang gnyi ga mi 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: de ste mi 'dug na yang gnyi ga mi 'dug par bya'o //
translated: If the king does not sit down, then both should remain standing.

original: gal te dbang po rgod par gyur na rgyal po chen po gang khyod kyis sa phyogs na dge slong dang bram ze rnams tshul khrims dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa mang du thos pa dag mi rgod dang spre'u rnams kyis ma gtses par gnas pa de🔽ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed do zhes bstan par bya'o //🔽de ste brtan zhing dul ba dbang po rab tu zhi ba zhig yin te chos bstan par rung na de la chos sna tshogs bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dbang po rgod par gyur na rgyal po chen po gang khyod kyis sa phyogs na dge slong dang bram ze rnams tshul khrims dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa mang du thos pa dag mi rgod dang spre'u rnams kyis ma gtses par gnas pa de ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed do zhes bstan par bya'o // de ste brtan zhing dul ba dbang po rab tu zhi ba zhig yin te chos bstan par rung na de la chos sna tshogs bstan par bya'o //
translated: If the king’s mind is distracted, then the bodhisattva should say to him, ‘Your Majesty, it is a gain for you, a great gain, that in your realm the monks and brahmins who are of great spiritual power and excellence, who are disciplined and well-trained, who are not harassed by apes or violent men,🔽and who are able to practice the holy life in its entirety—it is a gain that they are able to live in your realm without fear.🔽’ If the king is steady, disciplined, and his faculties are calm, then the bodhisattva should teach him the Dharma in a variety of ways.

original: de ste chos sna tshogs bstan pa la mi dga' na de la skyo ba dang mthun pa'i chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ste chos sna tshogs bstan pa la mi dga' na de la skyo ba dang mthun pa'i chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: If the king does not like the variety of teachings, then the bodhisattva should teach him the Dharma in a way that leads to disenchantment.

original: de ste skyo ba dang mthun pa'i chos bstan pa la yang mi dga' na de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba rgya che ba dag bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ste skyo ba dang mthun pa'i chos bstan pa la yang mi dga' na de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba rgya che ba dag bstan par bya'o //
translated: If they are not pleased with teachings that accord with weariness, then the greatness and vastness of the Tathāgata should be taught to them.

original: bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang grong pa dang yul gyi mi dag 'ongs na yang @110b ci rigs par bya ba dag bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang grong pa dang yul gyi mi dag 'ongs na yang @110b ci rigs par bya ba dag bya'o //
translated: When brahmins, kṣatriyas, townspeople, and country people come, one should do what is appropriate.

original: de de ltar mang du thos pas chos nyan pa rnams kyi sems mgu bar byed nus pa yin te /
analyzed: de de ltar mang du thos pas chos nyan pa rnams kyi sems mgu bar byed nus pa yin te /
translated: In this way, through being very learned, one is able to please the minds of those who listen to the Dharma.

original: sems can de dag kyang de la dga' ba dang dad pa dang rangs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so /🔽// / bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang de la dga' ba dang dad pa dang rangs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so / // / bam po dgu pa /
translated: Those sentient beings will attain joy, faith, and delight in him.”

original: khyim bdag drag shul can gyis zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: khyim bdag drag shul can gyis zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Also, in the Sūtra of the Questions of the Layman Ugra:

original: khyim bdag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba dgon pa la gnas pas 'di ltar bdag ci'i phyir dgon pa la gnas /
analyzed: khyim bdag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba dgon pa la gnas pas 'di ltar bdag ci'i phyir dgon pa la gnas /
translated: “Moreover, layman, a monk bodhisattva who lives in the wilderness should think as follows: ‘For what reason do I live in the wilderness?

original: dgon pa na gnas pa 'ba' zhig ni dge sbyong ma yin te /
analyzed: dgon pa na gnas pa 'ba' zhig ni dge sbyong ma yin te /
translated: Living in the wilderness is not just for ascetics.

original: 'di na ma byang ba ma sbas pa ma zhi ba ma dul ba mi 'grus pa rab tu mi brtson pa ;
analyzed: 'di na ma byang ba ma sbas pa ma zhi ba ma dul ba mi 'grus pa rab tu mi brtson pa ;
translated: Here there are no untamed, unprotected, uncontrolled, undisciplined, and uncommitted people.

original: 'di lta ste ri dags dang spre'u dang bya mang po dang chom rkun dang / gdol pa dag kyang mang du gnas te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste ri dags dang spre'u dang bya mang po dang chom rkun dang / gdol pa dag kyang mang du gnas te /
translated: There are many wild animals, monkeys, birds, bandits, and outcastes.

original: de dag kyang dge sbyong gi yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de dag kyang dge sbyong gi yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pas /
translated: But they do not have the qualities of spiritual practitioners.

original: gang gi phyir bdag dgon pa la gnas pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag dgon pa la gnas pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, I will perfect the purpose of living in the wilderness,

original: dge sbyong gi don de yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du brtag par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi don de yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du brtag par bya'o // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: which is the purpose of spiritual practitioners.”

original: khyim bdag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba dgon pa na gnas pas bdag ci'i phyir dgon par 'ongs snyam du brtag par bya ste de yang 'di ltar bdag ni 'jigs shing skrag pa'i phyir dgon par 'ongs so //
analyzed: khyim bdag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba dgon pa na gnas pas bdag ci'i phyir dgon par 'ongs snyam du brtag par bya ste de yang 'di ltar bdag ni 'jigs shing skrag pa'i phyir dgon par 'ongs so //
translated: “Moreover, head of the household, a mendicant bodhisattva who lives in the wilderness should investigate, ‘Why did I come to the wilderness?’ He should investigate in the following way: ‘I came to the wilderness because I was afraid and terrified.’

original: ci zhig gis 'jigs shing skrag ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig gis 'jigs shing skrag ce na /
translated: What was he afraid of?

original: 'du 'dzis 'jigs shing skrag go ;
analyzed: 'du 'dzis 'jigs shing skrag go ;
translated: He was afraid of busyness.

original: /'grogs pas 'jigs shing skrag go //🔽'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: /'grogs pas 'jigs shing skrag go // 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: I am afraid of being in their company.🔽I am afraid of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dang / 'chab pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dang / 'chab pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: I am afraid of pride, conceit, and hypocrisy.

original: chags pa dang phrag dog dang ser snas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: chags pa dang phrag dog dang ser snas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: I am afraid of attachment, jealousy, and stinginess.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg byas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg byas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: I am afraid of forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures.

original: phung po'i bdud kyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud kyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: I am afraid of the demon of the aggregates.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud kyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud kyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: I am afraid of the demon of the afflictions.

original: 'chi bdag gi bdud kyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi bdud kyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: I am afraid of the demon of the Lord of Death.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud kyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud kyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: I am afraid of the demon of the sons of the gods.

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: I am afraid of the error of permanence in impermanence.

original: sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: I am afraid of the error of happiness in suffering.

original: bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: I am afraid of the error of self in selflessness.

original: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by the error of regarding the impure as pure.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by the mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: sred pas 'jigs shing skrag go /
analyzed: sred pas 'jigs shing skrag go /
translated: They are terrified and frightened by craving.

original: @111a * // 'khor bas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: @111a * // 'khor bas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by saṃsāra.

original: sgrib pa dang chod pa dang kun nas ldang bas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang chod pa dang kun nas ldang bas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by obscurations, blockages, and mental distractions.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by the view of the transitory collection.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by grasping at “I” and grasping at “mine.”

original: rgod pas 'jigs shing skag go //
analyzed: rgod pas 'jigs shing skag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by agitation.

original: 'gyod pa dang the tshom gyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang the tshom gyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by regret and doubt.

original: sdig pa'i grogs pos 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs pos 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by sinful friends.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur stis 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur stis 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by gain and honor.

original: mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by nonvirtuous friends.

original: ma mthong bar mthong ngo snyam du 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: ma mthong bar mthong ngo snyam du 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are terrified and frightened by the thought that they will grasp at what they have not seen as having been seen.

original: ma thos par thos so snyam du 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go //🔽ma dran par dran no snyam du 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: ma thos par thos so snyam du 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go // ma dran par dran no snyam du 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are afraid of thinking they have heard what they have not heard.🔽They are afraid of thinking they remember what they do not remember.

original: bye brag ma phyed par bye brag phyed do snyam du 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: bye brag ma phyed par bye brag phyed do snyam du 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are afraid of thinking they have discerned what they have not discerned.

original: mi shes par shes so snyam du 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: mi shes par shes so snyam du 'dzin pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are afraid of thinking they know what they do not know.

original: dge sbyong gi dri mas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi dri mas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are afraid of the stains of asceticism.

original: gcig la gcig gnod par sems pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: gcig la gcig gnod par sems pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are afraid of thinking harmfully of one another.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyis 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are afraid of the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: srid pa'i 'gro ba thams cad du 'chi 'pho dang skye bas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'gro ba thams cad du 'chi 'pho dang skye bas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are afraid of dying and being reborn in all the realms of existence.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang yi dags kyi yul du 'gro bas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang yi dags kyi yul du 'gro bas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are afraid of going to the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: mi khom pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
analyzed: mi khom pas 'jigs shing skrag go //
translated: They are afraid of the unfavorable states.

original: mdor na mi dge ba'i chos thams cad yid la byed pas 'jigs shing skrag ste /
analyzed: mdor na mi dge ba'i chos thams cad yid la byed pas 'jigs shing skrag ste /
translated: In brief, all unwholesome mental activities are terrifying and frightening.

original: bdag de lta bu'i 'jigs shing skrag pas 'jigs nas dgon par 'ongs so //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bdag de lta bu'i 'jigs shing skrag pas 'jigs nas dgon par 'ongs so // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Frightened and terrified by such terrors, I have come to the wilderness.

original: khyim bdag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba 'jigs shing skrag nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba 'jigs shing skrag nas /
translated: “Moreover, head of the family, when the ordained bodhisattva lives in the wilderness, frightened and terrified, he should think as follows:

original: dgon pa la gnas pas 'di la gang cung zad 'jigs pa skye ba de dag thams cad ni bdag tu 'dzin pa las skyes so //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽bdag tu mngon par chags pa dang / bdag tu yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag gi gzhi dang bdag la sred pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang /
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas pas 'di la gang cung zad 'jigs pa skye ba de dag thams cad ni bdag tu 'dzin pa las skyes so // de bzhin du sbyar te / bdag tu mngon par chags pa dang / bdag tu yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag gi gzhi dang bdag la sred pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang /
translated: Whatever fears arise for me, all of them arise from the belief in a self.

original: bdag gi gnas dang / bdag tu yongs su rtog pa dang / bdag bsrung ba las skyes te /
analyzed: bdag gi gnas dang / bdag tu yongs su rtog pa dang / bdag bsrung ba las skyes te /
translated: From the belief in a self, the belief in a being, the belief in a soul, the belief in a person, the belief in a human, the belief in a man, the belief in a human being, the belief in an individual, the belief in a self-entity, the belief in an owner, the belief in an agent, the belief in an experiencer, the belief in a knower, the belief in a seer, the belief in a hearer, the belief in a smeller, the belief in a taster, the belief in a toucher, the belief in a thinker, the belief in a conceiver, the belief in a cognizer, the belief in a creator, the belief in a manifester, the belief in a speaker, the belief in an agent of action, the belief in a revealer, the belief in a defiler, the belief in a purifier, the belief in an appropriator, the belief in an appropriator of form, the belief in an appropriator of feeling, the belief in an appropriator of perception, the belief in an appropriator of volitional formations, the belief in an appropriator of consciousness, the belief in an appropriator of the eyes, the belief in an appropriator of forms, the belief in an appropriator of visual consciousness, the belief in an appropriator of visual contact, the belief in an appropriator of the feelings that arise from visual contact, up to the belief in an appropriator of the mind, the belief in an appropriator of mental phenomena, the belief in an appropriator of mental consciousness, the belief in an appropriator of mental contact, the belief in an appropriator of the feelings that arise from mental contact, the belief in an appropriator of the earth element, the belief in an appropriator of the water element, the belief in an appropriator of the fire element, the belief in an appropriator of the wind element, the belief in an appropriator of the space element, the belief in an appropriator of the consciousness element, the belief in an appropriator of the eye faculty, the belief in an appropriator

original: gal te bdag dgon pa la gnas la bdag tu 'dzin pa yongs su ma spangs /
analyzed: gal te bdag dgon pa la gnas la bdag tu 'dzin pa yongs su ma spangs /
translated: If I live in the wilderness but do not give up clinging to a self,🔽if I do not give up attachment to a self,🔽if I do not give up the basis of a self,🔽if I do not give up craving for a self,🔽if I do not give up the notion of a self,

original: @111b bdag tu mngon par chags pa dang / bdag tu yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag gi gzhi dang / bdag la sred pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang /
analyzed: @111b bdag tu mngon par chags pa dang / bdag tu yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag gi gzhi dang / bdag la sred pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang /
translated: if I do not give up the appropriation of a self,🔽if I do not give up the view of a self,🔽if I do not give up the basis of a self,🔽if I do not give up the idea of a self,

original: bdag gi gnas dang / bdag tu yongs su rtog pa dang / bdag srung ba yongs su ma spangs na ni ;
analyzed: bdag gi gnas dang / bdag tu yongs su rtog pa dang / bdag srung ba yongs su ma spangs na ni ;
translated: if I do not give up protecting a self,

original: bdag dgon pa la gnas pa don med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dgon pa la gnas pa don med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems par bya ste /
translated: then my living in the wilderness would be pointless.

original: bdag tu 'du shes pa la ni dgon pa la gnas pa don med do //
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes pa la ni dgon pa la gnas pa don med do //
translated: The notion of a self is pointless in living in the wilderness.

original: gzhan du 'du shes pa la yang med do //
analyzed: gzhan du 'du shes pa la yang med do //
translated: The notion of another is also pointless.🔽The notion of a soul is pointless in living in the wilderness.🔽The notion of a person is also pointless.🔽The notion of an individual is pointless in living in the wilderness.🔽The notion of a human is also pointless.🔽The notion of man is pointless in living in the wilderness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽khyim bdag dgon pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la mi brten par pa'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / khyim bdag dgon pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la mi brten par pa'o ;
translated: The notion of human being is also pointless.🔽The notion of one who acts is pointless in living in the wilderness.

original: / chos thams cad la mi 'dzin par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: / chos thams cad la mi 'dzin par gnas pa'o //
translated: The notion of one who causes action to be done is also pointless.

original: mtshan ma thams cad la mi chags par gnas pa'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad la mi chags par gnas pa'o // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: He abides without attachment to any signs.

original: gzugs thams cad la mi brten par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad la mi brten par gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides without relying on any form.

original: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg pa thams cad la mi brten par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg pa thams cad la mi brten par gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides without relying on any sound, smell, taste, or touch.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang mi 'gal bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang mi 'gal bar gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides without contradicting the sameness of all phenomena.

original: sems shin tu zhi bas shin tu sbyangs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems shin tu zhi bas shin tu sbyangs par gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides in the pliancy that comes from a very peaceful mind.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad spangs pas mi 'jigs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad spangs pas mi 'jigs par gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides without fear, having abandoned all fears.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad las rnam par grol bas chu bo las rgal bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad las rnam par grol bas chu bo las rgal bar gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides having crossed the rivers, being completely liberated from all afflictions.

original: brten par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: brten par gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides in the noble lineage.

original: ngan ngon gyis chog shes par 'dzin cing 'dod pa chung bas 'phags pa'i rigs rnams la rab tu dga' bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ngan ngon gyis chog shes par 'dzin cing 'dod pa chung bas 'phags pa'i rigs rnams la rab tu dga' bar gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides in the joy of the noble lineages, being content with little and having few desires.

original: dgang sla zhing gso sla bas chog par 'dzin par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dgang sla zhing gso sla bas chog par 'dzin par gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides in contentment, being easy to fill and easy to feed.

original: shes rab kyi phyir tshul bzhin la sbyor bas thos pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi phyir tshul bzhin la sbyor bas thos pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides in learning, applying himself properly for the sake of wisdom.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa la so sor rtog pas thar par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa la so sor rtog pas thar par gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides in liberation by discerning the doors of liberation, namely, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: bcings pa bcad pas rnam par grol bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bcings pa bcad pas rnam par grol bar gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides in liberation by cutting through the bonds.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang mthun pas ma dul ba rnams nye bar zhi bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang mthun pas ma dul ba rnams nye bar zhi bar gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides in the pacification of the untamed by being in accord with dependent origination.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pas bya ba byas par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pas bya ba byas par gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides in the performance of his duty by being utterly pure.

original: khyim bdag 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Householder, it is like this:

original: dgon pa la rtsva dang shing gel ba dang nags tshal gnas kyang 'jigs pa med cing mi skrag skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgon pa la rtsva dang shing gel ba dang nags tshal gnas kyang 'jigs pa med cing mi skrag skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the wilderness, grass, bushes, forests, and trees grow, but there is no fear, no terror, no terrorizing.

original: khyim bdag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba dgon pa la gnas pas kyang lus la rtsva dang shing gel pa dang sman dang rtsvig pa dang shing dang mig yor lta bu dang sgyu @112a * //
analyzed: khyim bdag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba dgon pa la gnas pas kyang lus la rtsva dang shing gel pa dang sman dang rtsvig pa dang shing dang mig yor lta bu dang sgyu @112a * //
translated: In the same way, householder, when a monastic bodhisattva who has gone forth into the homeless life lives in the wilderness, he should develop the perception that the body is like grass, bushes, forests, trees, and magical illusions,

original: ma dang mtshungs pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: ma dang mtshungs pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya ste /
translated: and that it is like a mirage.

original: 'di la su zhig 'jigs par 'gyur 'di la su zhig skrag par 'gyur snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la su zhig 'jigs par 'gyur 'di la su zhig skrag par 'gyur snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Who is afraid here? Who is terrified here?

original: des 'jigs shing skrag par lta na /
analyzed: des 'jigs shing skrag par lta na /
translated: If he sees that he is afraid and terrified,🔽he should properly investigate the body in this way:

original: 'di ltar lus 'di la ni bdag gam sems can nam srog gam skye ba'am gso ba'am skyes bu'am gang zag gam shed las skyes pa'am shed bu med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus 'di la ni bdag gam sems can nam srog gam skye ba'am gso ba'am skyes bu'am gang zag gam shed las skyes pa'am shed bu med de /
translated: In this body there is no self, no sentient being, no life-force, no living thing, no person, no human being, no anyone.

original: 'di ltar 'jigs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jigs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: In this way, what is called “fear”

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa yin gyi bdag gis ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa de la brtag par mi bya'o snyam du lus la tshul bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa yin gyi bdag gis ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa de la brtag par mi bya'o snyam du lus la tshul bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
translated: is an unreal imputation. I should not impute that unreal imputation.”🔽Just as in a wilderness grass, bushes, medicinal herbs, and forest trees grow without “mine” and without possessiveness,

original: des ji ltar dgon pa la rtsva dang shing gel ba dang sman dang nags tshal gnas pa rnams nga'i ba med pas yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang nga'i pa med pa yongs su 'dzin pa med pas chos thams cad dgon
analyzed: des ji ltar dgon pa la rtsva dang shing gel ba dang sman dang nags tshal gnas pa rnams nga'i ba med pas yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang nga'i pa med pa yongs su 'dzin pa med pas chos thams cad dgon
translated: in the same way, a bodhisattva, without “mine” and without possessiveness, should let all dharmas grow in the wilderness of the six sense-spheres.

original: pa nyid do snyam du shes nas nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: pa nyid do snyam du shes nas nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having understood this, he should practice and abide by it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dgon pa la gnas pa de ni nyon mongs pa gcod pa ste nga'i ba med pas yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas pa de ni nyon mongs pa gcod pa ste nga'i ba med pas yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: Because that dwelling in the wilderness is the cutting off of afflictions, without possessiveness, without grasping.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: khyim bdag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung bas sangs rgyas kyis dgon pa la gnas par bka' stsal par shes nas dgon pa la gnas par bya ste ;
analyzed: khyim bdag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung bas sangs rgyas kyis dgon pa la gnas par bka' stsal par shes nas dgon pa la gnas par bya ste ;
translated: Moreover, a householder bodhisattva, knowing that the Buddha has taught dwelling in the wilderness, should dwell in the wilderness.

original: der dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, all wholesome states will be perfected.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar brtan nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar brtan nas /
translated: Having stabilized the wholesome roots,

original: phyis grong dang grong khyer dang grong rdal dang ljongs dang yul dang pho brang 'khor dag tu zhugs te chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis grong dang grong khyer dang grong rdal dang ljongs dang yul dang pho brang 'khor dag tu zhugs te chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: later, he should enter villages, towns, cities, countries, regions, and royal palaces and teach the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: khyim bdag gal te byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba lung dang kha ton mnod pa'i phyir tshogs kyi nang du 'jug na des der gus pa dang bcas par bya ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag gal te byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba lung dang kha ton mnod pa'i phyir tshogs kyi nang du 'jug na des der gus pa dang bcas par bya ste /
translated: “Householder, if an ordained bodhisattva enters an assembly in order to receive instruction or to recite scriptures, he should be respectful there.

original: slob dpon dang mkhan po rnams dang / gnas brtan dang bar ma dang dge sbyong gsar bu rnams la zhe sa dang bcas par bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dang mkhan po rnams dang / gnas brtan dang bar ma dang dge sbyong gsar bu rnams la zhe sa dang bcas par bya'o //
translated: He should be polite to the masters and preceptors, to the elders, the middle-aged, and the junior monks.

original: tshul mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul mkhas par bya'o //
translated: He should be skillful in his conduct.

original: snyom las med par rang gis bya ba dang gzhan la gdung ba med par bya'o //
analyzed: snyom las med par rang gis bya ba dang gzhan la gdung ba med par bya'o //
translated: He should not be lazy, and should not be a burden to others.

original: des bsnyen bkur la gdu bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: des bsnyen bkur la gdu bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be attached to service.

original: des 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram ze'i skye dgu dang @112b bcas pa dang /
analyzed: des 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram ze'i skye dgu dang @112b bcas pa dang /
translated: He should think, ‘The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, is worshipped by the world with its gods, Māra, and Brahmā, by this population with its ascetics and brahmins,

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pas mchod pas /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pas mchod pas /
translated: with its gods and humans.

original: sbyin gnas su gyur pa de yang sems can thams cad la gang las kyang rim gror bya ba bdag gir mi mdzad na /
analyzed: sbyin gnas su gyur pa de yang sems can thams cad la gang las kyang rim gror bya ba bdag gir mi mdzad na /
translated: Moreover, that one who has become a recipient of gifts does not consider himself to be served by anyone, even by all sentient beings.

original: bdag cag ma bslabs pa slob dpon 'dod pa rnams lta ci smos te /
analyzed: bdag cag ma bslabs pa slob dpon 'dod pa rnams lta ci smos te /
translated: How much less would he consider himself to be served by us, who are untrained and desire a teacher?

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad la bsnyen bkur bya'i /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad la bsnyen bkur bya'i /
translated: I should serve all sentient beings.

original: gang las kyang bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir mi bya'o snyam du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: gang las kyang bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir mi bya'o snyam du brtag par bya'o //
translated: I should not consider myself to be served by anyone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: khyim bdag dge sbyong bsnyen bkur la gdu ba ni yon tan gyi chos rjes su gzung ba chud gzon pa yin te /
analyzed: khyim bdag dge sbyong bsnyen bkur la gdu ba ni yon tan gyi chos rjes su gzung ba chud gzon pa yin te /
translated: Because, householder, a śramaṇa who is devoted to service wastes the opportunity to receive the Dharma.

original: des gang dag sdud pa de dag kyang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: des gang dag sdud pa de dag kyang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Those who gather around him think,

original: bdag cag ni bsnyen bkur gyi phyir sdud kyi chos kyi phyir ni ma yin no snyam mo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag cag ni bsnyen bkur gyi phyir sdud kyi chos kyi phyir ni ma yin no snyam mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: “We gather for the sake of service, not for the Dharma.”

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: And the same text says,

original: khyim bdag gal te byang chub sems dpa' dgon pa pa chos nyan par 'dod dam /
analyzed: khyim bdag gal te byang chub sems dpa' dgon pa pa chos nyan par 'dod dam /
translated: “Householder, if a bodhisattva who lives in the wilderness desires to hear the Dharma,

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon la lta bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon la lta bar 'dod nas /
translated: If he wishes to see the preceptor or the master,

original: nad 'dri ba'i phyir grong gi gnas su 'ongs nas /
analyzed: nad 'dri ba'i phyir grong gi gnas su 'ongs nas /
translated: he should go to the village to ask about his illness.

original: des dgongs su slar ldog par bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: des dgongs su slar ldog par bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: He should arouse the thought of returning.

original: de gal te lung mnod pa dang kha ton bya ba gzhan la rag las te gtsug lag khang na gnas na yang /
analyzed: de gal te lung mnod pa dang kha ton bya ba gzhan la rag las te gtsug lag khang na gnas na yang /
translated: If he is staying in the monastery, dependent on others for instruction and recitation,

original: des dgon pa la gzhol ba'i sems kyis /
analyzed: des dgon pa la gzhol ba'i sems kyis /
translated: he should have a mind that is oriented toward the wilderness.

original: gang dngos po thams cad la dgon par 'du shes pa dang chos tshol bas mi ngoms pa de nyid dgon pa la gnas pa yin no snyam du bsam par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang dngos po thams cad la dgon par 'du shes pa dang chos tshol bas mi ngoms pa de nyid dgon pa la gnas pa yin no snyam du bsam par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: He should think, “I will be in the wilderness, where the perception of all things as wilderness and the search for the Dharma are insatiable.”

original: 'phags pa rin po che'i phung po'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rin po che'i phung po'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble Multitude of Jewels Sūtra also says,

original: gal te dge slong dgon pa pa 'bras bu ma thob pa so so'i skye bo'i drung du sdig sbrul dang gcan gzan gtum po dag 'ongs na des de la 'jigs pa dang skrag par mi bya'i /
analyzed: gal te dge slong dgon pa pa 'bras bu ma thob pa so so'i skye bo'i drung du sdig sbrul dang gcan gzan gtum po dag 'ongs na des de la 'jigs pa dang skrag par mi bya'i /
translated: “If a monk in the wilderness who has not attained the fruits, who is an ordinary person, is approached by snakes, wild animals, or predatory animals, he should not be afraid or terrified.

original: des 'di snyam du bdag thog ma nyid nas lus dang srog bor te dgon pa'i gnas su 'ongs kyang 'di la bdag gis 'jigs par mi bya skrag par mi bya'i /
analyzed: des 'di snyam du bdag thog ma nyid nas lus dang srog bor te dgon pa'i gnas su 'ongs kyang 'di la bdag gis 'jigs par mi bya skrag par mi bya'i /
translated: He should think, “From the very beginning I have come to this wilderness dwelling, having already given up my body and life. I should not be afraid of this.

original: byams pa'i sems bskyed par bya zhe sdang rnam par spang par bya 'jigs pa spang bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems bskyed par bya zhe sdang rnam par spang par bya 'jigs pa spang bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I should not be terrified. I should arouse lovingkindness. I should abandon hostility. I should abandon fear.”

original: gal te de ltar byas nas sbrul dang gcan gzan de dag gis srog gcod cing za na yang des 'di snyam du gcan gzan 'di dag la bdag gis zang zing tsam gyis tshim par byed mi nus kyi /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byas nas sbrul dang gcan gzan de dag gis srog gcod cing za na yang des 'di snyam du gcan gzan 'di dag la bdag gis zang zing tsam gyis tshim par byed mi nus kyi /
translated: If, despite his efforts, the wild animals kill him and eat him, he should think, “I am not able to satisfy these wild animals with just material things.

original: de dag gis bdag gi sha zos nas bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur la /🔽bdag gis kyang snying po med pa'i lus las snying po blangs par 'gyur ba ni bdag gis rnyed pa @113a * //
analyzed: de dag gis bdag gi sha zos nas bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur la / bdag gis kyang snying po med pa'i lus las snying po blangs par 'gyur ba ni bdag gis rnyed pa @113a * //
translated: But after they have eaten my flesh, they will live happily.

original: legs par rnyed do //
analyzed: legs par rnyed do //
translated: And I will have obtained a great benefit, in that I will have taken the essence from this body, which is by nature perishable.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: gal te dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa na mi ma yin pa 'ongs na mdog sdug kyang rung mi sdug kyang rung /
analyzed: gal te dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa na mi ma yin pa 'ongs na mdog sdug kyang rung mi sdug kyang rung /
translated: If non-human beings come to the place where he is staying, whether they are beautiful or ugly,

original: de la chags par mi bya khong khro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la chags par mi bya khong khro bar mi bya'o //
translated: he should neither be attached to them nor angry with them.

original: gal te sngon sangs rgyas mthong ba'i lha dag dge slong dgon pa pa'i gan du 'ongs te dri ba yongs su 'dri na /
analyzed: gal te sngon sangs rgyas mthong ba'i lha dag dge slong dgon pa pa'i gan du 'ongs te dri ba yongs su 'dri na /
translated: If gods who have seen the Buddha in the past come to the solitary monk and ask questions,

original: de la dge slong dgon pa pa des ji ltar thos pa bzhin du lha de dag la chos bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong dgon pa pa des ji ltar thos pa bzhin du lha de dag la chos bshad par bya'o //
translated: the solitary monk should explain the Dharma to those gods according to what he has heard.

original: ci ste lha de dag zab mo'i dri ba yongs su dris te dge slong dgon pa des lan mi thebs pa lta na /
analyzed: ci ste lha de dag zab mo'i dri ba yongs su dris te dge slong dgon pa des lan mi thebs pa lta na /
translated: But if those gods ask profound questions and the solitary monk cannot answer,

original: des nga rgyal med par byas la 'di skad ces ma bslabs pa la brnyas par mi bya ste sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la lung mnos nas 'bad de khong du ma chud pa'i chos rnams khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i dus na dris pa thams
analyzed: des nga rgyal med par byas la 'di skad ces ma bslabs pa la brnyas par mi bya ste sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la lung mnos nas 'bad de khong du ma chud pa'i chos rnams khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i dus na dris pa thams
translated: he should be humble and say, “One should not despise the untrained. Having received the scriptures in the Buddha’s teachings, I will strive to understand the teachings that I do not yet understand. At that time, at that moment, I will answer all your questions.

original: cad kyi lan gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: cad kyi lan gdab par bya'o //
translated: I will answer all of them.

original: bdag ni chos nyan pa yin gyi khyed spobs par gyis shig ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag ni chos nyan pa yin gyi khyed spobs par gyis shig ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: I am listening to the Dharma, so you should speak.

original: 'od srungs dge slong dgon pa pa de ltar lha de dag la go bar bya'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'od srungs dge slong dgon pa pa de ltar lha de dag la go bar bya'o // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Kāśyapa, the monk in the wilderness should understand the gods in this way.

original: dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa des rtsva dang shing gel ba dang sman dang nags tshal de dag ji ltar 'byung ba dad ji ltar 'jigs par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po 'di dag bdag po med pa /
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa des rtsva dang shing gel ba dang sman dang nags tshal de dag ji ltar 'byung ba dad ji ltar 'jigs par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po 'di dag bdag po med pa /
translated: … The monk who lives in that wilderness area should think about those grasses, vines, medicinal herbs, and forest trees as follows: “Just as they arise and just as they perish, so too external things are without a master,

original: g-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa /
translated: without a self,

original: byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa /
translated: without an agent,

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung gi / rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang na mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung gi / rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang na mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: arising from the convergence of causes and conditions, and not arising without the convergence of causes and conditions.

original: 'di la don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos gang yang med do snyam du mtshan mar gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos gang yang med do snyam du mtshan mar gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: In this regard, ultimately there is no dharma whatsoever that arises or ceases.” In this way, he should apprehend them as signs.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It also says,

original: dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa na 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa na 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: When living in that monastery, one should arouse the following thought:

original: 'di ltar bdag ni lam ring po nas 'dir 'ongs la gcig pu gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni lam ring po nas 'dir 'ongs la gcig pu gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: “I have come here from far away, alone, without a companion.

original: legs par byas pa'am nyes par byas pa bskul ba'i grogs ni gang yang med kyi /
analyzed: legs par byas pa'am nyes par byas pa bskul ba'i grogs ni gang yang med kyi /
translated: There is no one at all to encourage me to do what is good or to avoid what is bad.

original: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang dri za dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang bdag gi sems kyi bsam pa shes pa dag yod de /
analyzed: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang dri za dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang bdag gi sems kyi bsam pa shes pa dag yod de /
translated: But there are gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, and blessed buddhas who know my thoughts.

original: bdag dgon pa'i gnas na gnas la mi dge ba'i sems kyi dbang du song na de dag dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dgon pa'i gnas na gnas la mi dge ba'i sems kyi dbang du song na de dag dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If, while living in the wilderness, I come under the influence of unwholesome thoughts, they will know it.

original: bdag lam ring po nas 'ongs shing gcig pu gnyis su med de /
analyzed: bdag lam ring po nas 'ongs shing gcig pu gnyis su med de /
translated: I have come here from far away, alone, without a companion.

original: rten pa med bdag gi med yongs su 'dzin pa med la /
analyzed: rten pa med bdag gi med yongs su 'dzin pa med la /
translated: I have no support, no one to rely on, no one to own me.🔽If I think thoughts of desire, thoughts of malice,

original: gal te 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog / gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog /🔽@113b 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog gam /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog / gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog /🔽@113b 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog gam /
translated: thoughts of violence,

original: mi dge ba gzhan la rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog par gyur na /
analyzed: mi dge ba gzhan la rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog par gyur na /
translated: If you think about other unwholesome things,

original: gang 'du 'dzi dang 'du ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams dang bye brag med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'du 'dzi dang 'du ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams dang bye brag med par 'gyur te /
translated: you will be no different from those sentient beings who delight in crowds and gatherings.

original: bdag gis lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang dri za rnams la bslus par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag gis lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang dri za rnams la bslus par 'gyur zhing /
translated: You will have deceived the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and gandharvas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mi mnyes par byas par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mi mnyes par byas par 'gyur gyis /
translated: You will have displeased the blessed buddhas.

original: ci nas kyang bdag la lha rnams 'phya bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang dgyes par 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so //🔽bslab pa kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag la lha rnams 'phya bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang dgyes par 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so // bslab pa kun las btus pa las /
translated: You should think, “I will act in such a way that the gods do not reproach me and the blessed buddhas are pleased.”

original: dgon par gnas par brjod pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: dgon par gnas par brjod pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on living in the wilderness, the eleventh in the “Bodhisattva Collection” chapter of the “Bodhisattva Levels.”

original: // / de ltar dgon pa la gnas nas mnyam par gzhag pa la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: // / de ltar dgon pa la gnas nas mnyam par gzhag pa la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Once you have lived in the wilderness in this way, you should apply yourself to meditative equipoise.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma las /
translated: As the Blessed Lady [Perfection of Wisdom in Verse] says:

original: des sems can de dag gi don du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sems g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des sems can de dag gi don du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sems g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For the sake of those sentient beings, they practice the perfection of concentration, and their minds do not become distracted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de 'di snyam du sems g-yeng ba la ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan bskyed pa'ang dkon na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de 'di snyam du sems g-yeng ba la ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan bskyed pa'ang dkon na /
translated: Because they think, “It is difficult for those with distracted minds to even generate mundane concentrations,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta ci smos /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta ci smos /
translated: let alone the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: de lta bas na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du sems mi g-yeng bar bya'o snyam du sems so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du sems mi g-yeng bar bya'o snyam du sems so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, until I fully awaken to highest, complete enlightenment, I will not let my mind become distracted.”

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: And the same text says:

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: from the time when a bodhisattva great being first begins to set out,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug ste /🔽de mig gis gzugs rnams mthong yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug ste / de mig gis gzugs rnams mthong yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the transcendent perfection of wisdom, and they practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the applications of mindfulness.

original: gang gi phyir mig gi dbang po sdom pas ma bsdams par gnas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig gi dbang po sdom pas ma bsdams par gnas te /
translated: They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the correct exertions, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path.🔽They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba dang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gzhan la yang sems rjes su 'jug pa de dag sdom par byed mig gi dbang po srung bar byed do //
analyzed: brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba dang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gzhan la yang sems rjes su 'jug pa de dag sdom par byed mig gi dbang po srung bar byed do //
translated: They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors to liberation.🔽They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.🔽They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors to liberation.

original: de bzhin du rna bas sgra thos pa dang / snas dri tshor ba dang / lces ro myang ba dang / lus kyis reg bya la reg pa dang / yid kyis chos rnam par rig pa na mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin no //🔽gang gi phyir @114a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna bas sgra thos pa dang / snas dri tshor ba dang / lces ro myang ba dang / lus kyis reg bya la reg pa dang / yid kyis chos rnam par rig pa na mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin no //🔽gang gi phyir @114a * //
translated: They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.🔽They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and arhatship.🔽They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of individual enlightenment and the aspects of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.🔽They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and arhatship.🔽They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of individual enlightenment and the aspects of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.🔽They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors to liberation.🔽They practice the perfection of meditative stability while in meditative equipoise on the aspects of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment

original: yid kyi dbang po sdom pas ma bsdams te sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la rjes su 'jug pa de dag sdom par byed yid kyi dbang po srung bar byed do //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po sdom pas ma bsdams te sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la rjes su 'jug pa de dag sdom par byed yid kyi dbang po srung bar byed do //
translated: He does not let his mind faculty run wild, but restrains it from evil, unwholesome dharmas. He guards the mind faculty and is fully aware of it.

original: de 'gro'am 'greng ngam 'dug gam nyal lam smra'am mi smra yang rung ste /
analyzed: de 'gro'am 'greng ngam 'dug gam nyal lam smra'am mi smra yang rung ste /
translated: Whether he is walking, standing, sitting, lying, talking, or remaining silent,

original: mnyam par gzhag par gnas pa dang zhi bar gnas pa mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag par gnas pa dang zhi bar gnas pa mi 'dor ro //
translated: he does not give up on abiding in meditative equipoise and abiding in peace.

original: de lag pa mi rgod pa dang / rkang pa mi rgod pa dang / mu cor mi smra ba dang / tshig 'chal ba med pa dang / dbang po mi g-yeng ba dang / mi rgod pa dang / yab yab po ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de lag pa mi rgod pa dang / rkang pa mi rgod pa dang / mu cor mi smra ba dang / tshig 'chal ba med pa dang / dbang po mi g-yeng ba dang / mi rgod pa dang / yab yab po ma yin pa dang /
translated: He does not fidget with his hands, does not fidget with his feet, does not prattle, does not speak incoherently, does not have distracted senses, is not agitated, is not fickle,

original: gzu sems can ma yin pa dang / lus 'khrul pa med pa dang / sems 'khrul pa med pa dang / lus zhi ba dang / ngag zhi ba dang / sems zhi ba dang / dben yang rung mi dben yang rung ste spyod lam bcos pa med pa yin no //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gzu sems can ma yin pa dang / lus 'khrul pa med pa dang / sems 'khrul pa med pa dang / lus zhi ba dang / ngag zhi ba dang / sems zhi ba dang / dben yang rung mi dben yang rung ste spyod lam bcos pa med pa yin no //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: is not fickle-minded, does not have a confused body, does not have a confused mind, has a peaceful body, has a peaceful voice, has a peaceful mind, and whether in solitude or not, does not have a contrived demeanor.

original: chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / 'grogs na bde ba dang / cho ga dang spyod yul bde ba dang / 'du 'dzi'i nang na yang spyod yul dben pa dang / rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la yang mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med pa yin /🔽khengs pa med cing 'dud pa dang / de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bstod pa dang smad pa dang / snyan pa dang mi snyan pa dang / 'tsho ba dang 'chi ba yang mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med pa yin /
analyzed: chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / 'grogs na bde ba dang / cho ga dang spyod yul bde ba dang / 'du 'dzi'i nang na yang spyod yul dben pa dang / rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la yang mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med pa yin / khengs pa med cing 'dud pa dang / de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bstod pa dang smad pa dang / snyan pa dang mi snyan pa dang / 'tsho ba dang 'chi ba yang mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med pa yin /
translated: They are content, easy to support, easy to satisfy, pleasant to be with, and have a pleasant way of life. Even in the midst of crowds, they are secluded. They are the same in the face of gain and loss, and are unwavering.🔽They are not arrogant or haughty, and are the same in the face of pleasure and pain, praise and blame, fame and obscurity, life and death, and are unwavering.

original: khengs pa med cing 'dud pa dang ; de bzhin du dgra dang mdza' bo dang / yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang / 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa dang / sgra dang gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnams la yang mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med pa yin /
analyzed: khengs pa med cing 'dud pa dang ; de bzhin du dgra dang mdza' bo dang / yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang / 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa dang / sgra dang gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnams la yang mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med pa yin /
translated: They are not arrogant or haughty, and are the same in the face of friends and enemies, the pleasant and the unpleasant, the noble and the ignoble, and attractive and unattractive sounds and forms, and are unwavering.

original: khengs pa med cing 'dud pa yin /
analyzed: khengs pa med cing 'dud pa yin /
translated: He is not arrogant, but humble.

original: rjes su chags pa dang mi mthun pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang mi mthun pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: He is free from attachment and aversion.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong zhing byung ba med pa dang rdzogs pa med pa dang / mngon du grub pa med par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong zhing byung ba med pa dang rdzogs pa med pa dang / mngon du grub pa med par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Because he sees that all phenomena are empty of their own marks, that they do not arise, do not cease, are not defiled, are not undefiled, are not diminished, and are not increased.

original: de la yid zhum na dga' ba bsgom pas gzengs bstod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yid zhum na dga' ba bsgom pas gzengs bstod par bya'o //
translated: If his mind is low-spirited, he should encourage himself by cultivating joy.
